original: kun tu rtog don kho na dang // rnam rtog nye bar zhi ba'i don //
analyzed: kun tu rtog don kho na dang // rnam rtog nye bar zhi ba'i don //
translated: The meaning of impermanence is the meaning of non-existence,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi rtag pa'i don ni med pa'i don te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi rtag pa'i don ni med pa'i don te /
translated: for bodhisattvas.ğŸ”½The meaning of non-existence is the meaning of impermanence,

original: rtag tu med pa'i don gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa yin pas de dag gi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu med pa'i don gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa yin pas de dag gi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: so it is the imagined identity.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i don ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i don te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i don ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of suffering is the meaning of unreal imagination,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: so it is the relative identity.

original: bdag med pa'i don ni kun tu rtog pa tsam gyi don te /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i don ni kun tu rtog pa tsam gyi don te /
translated: The meaning of selflessness is the meaning of mere imagination,ğŸ”½for bodhisattvas.

original: kho na zhes bya ba'i sgras ni nges par gzung ba'i phyir kun brtags pa'i bdag ni med kyi /
analyzed: kho na zhes bya ba'i sgras ni nges par gzung ba'i phyir kun brtags pa'i bdag ni med kyi /
translated: The word â€œonlyâ€ is used to indicate that the imagined self does not exist,

original: kun tu rtogs pa tsam zhig ni yod pas kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi med pa'i don ni bdag med pa'i don to zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: kun tu rtogs pa tsam zhig ni yod pas kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi med pa'i don ni bdag med pa'i don to zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: but mere imagination does exist. Thus, the meaning of non-existence in the imagined identity is the meaning of selflessness.

original: zhi ba'i don ni rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba'i don te /
analyzed: zhi ba'i don ni rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of peace is the meaning of the pacification of discrimination,ğŸ”½for bodhisattvas.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: The perfected characteristic is nirvana.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid skad cig la 'jig pa'i don yang mi rtag pa'i don du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid skad cig la 'jig pa'i don yang mi rtag pa'i don du rig par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of impermanence should be understood as the meaning of momentariness, which is the moment-by-moment cessation of the dependent nature.

original: de lta bas na de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su @231b bcad pa bcu'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su @231b bcad pa bcu'o //
translated: Therefore, ten verses are analyzed in order to fully establish momentariness.

original: mi rung rgyu las skye phyir dang // 'gal phyir rang nyid mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: mi rung rgyu las skye phyir dang // 'gal phyir rang nyid mi gnas phyir //
translated: Because of non-concordance, arising from causes, because of contradiction, because of non-abiding by itself,

original: med phyir mtshan nyid nges phyir dang // rjes su 'jug phyir 'gag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: med phyir mtshan nyid nges phyir dang // rjes su 'jug phyir 'gag pa'i phyir //
translated: because of non-existence, because of the certainty of characteristics, because of conformity, because of cessation,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba dmigs phyir dang // de'i rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu'i phyir //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba dmigs phyir dang // de'i rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu'i phyir //
translated: because of the observation of transformation, because of being its cause and effect,

original: zin pa'i phyir dang bdag po'i phyir //
analyzed: zin pa'i phyir dang bdag po'i phyir //
translated: because of being grasped, because of being the dominant condition,

original: dag dang sems can rjes 'jug phyir //
analyzed: dag dang sems can rjes 'jug phyir //
translated: because of purity, and because of conforming to sentient beings.

original: de la 'og nas 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma zhes 'byung ba 'di ni dam bca' ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'og nas 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma zhes 'byung ba 'di ni dam bca' ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the statement below that all conditioned things are momentary should be understood as a thesis.

original: de yang ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: How is that established?

original: skad cig ma nyid med par 'du byed rnams 'jug par mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid med par 'du byed rnams 'jug par mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not tenable that formations engage in activity without momentariness.

original: rgyun gyis 'jug pa ni 'jug pa yin na de yang skad cig re re la skye ba dang 'gag pa med par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyun gyis 'jug pa ni 'jug pa yin na de yang skad cig re re la skye ba dang 'gag pa med par mi rung ngo //
translated: If engagement is engagement through a continuum, then that is not tenable without momentariness.

original: 'on te dus gzhan gyi bar du gnas nas snga ma dang phyi ma 'gag pa dang skye ba'i sgo nas rgyun gyis 'jug par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te dus gzhan gyi bar du gnas nas snga ma dang phyi ma 'gag pa dang skye ba'i sgo nas rgyun gyis 'jug par 'dod na /
translated: But if you assert that engagement through a continuum is engagement through abiding for a period of time, then the prior and subsequent moments would cease and arise through engagement.

original: de'i mjug thogs su 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, it would not engage in activity immediately after that,

original: rgyun med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no continuum.

original: skyes pa ni rgyun med par dus gzhan gyi bar du yod par yang rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa ni rgyun med par dus gzhan gyi bar du yod par yang rung ba ma yin no //
translated: And it is not tenable that what has arisen exists for a period of time without a continuum.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu las skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu las skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it arises from a cause.

original: 'dus byas thams cad ni rgyu las skye zhing yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad ni rgyu las skye zhing yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term â€œexistsâ€ means that all conditioned states arise from a cause.

original: de gal te byung nas yang dus phyis yod na de la gdon mi za bar rgyu dgos te /
analyzed: de gal te byung nas yang dus phyis yod na de la gdon mi za bar rgyu dgos te /
translated: If it exists after it has arisen, then it must have a cause.

original: rgyu med na dang po kho na nas rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med na dang po kho na nas rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if there is no cause, it would be causeless from the very beginning.

original: de ni rgyu de kho nas yod par 'gyur bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rgyu de kho nas yod par 'gyur bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that it exists by means of that very cause,

original: de rgyur spyad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rgyur spyad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been used as a cause.

original: rgyu gzhan yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan yang mi dmigs te /
translated: And another cause is not perceived.

original: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar skad cig re re la snga ma'i rgyu can gzhan zhig yod do zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar skad cig re re la snga ma'i rgyu can gzhan zhig yod do zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that it definitely exists by means of another cause in each moment.

original: de ltar na skyes pa rgyun med par dus gzhan gyi bar du yod bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na skyes pa rgyun med par dus gzhan gyi bar du yod bar mi rung ngo //
translated: In this way, it is not possible for what has arisen to exist without a continuum up to another time.

original: ji ste 'di ltar gang gi don du rgyu dgos par 'gyur ba skyes zin pa yang skye ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ste 'di ltar gang gi don du rgyu dgos par 'gyur ba skyes zin pa yang skye ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But if it is maintained that what has already arisen does not arise again for the sake of which a cause would be necessary,

original: skyes pa ni phyis dus gzhan na 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes pa ni phyis dus gzhan na 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: but that what has arisen will cease at another time later,

original: skyes pa tsam kho nas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na de phyis ci zhig gis 'gag par 'gyur /
analyzed: skyes pa tsam kho nas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na de phyis ci zhig gis 'gag par 'gyur /
translated: not merely by its arising, then by what will it cease later?

original: gal te skye ba'i rgyu kho nas so zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te skye ba'i rgyu kho nas so zhe na ;
translated: If it is by the very cause of its arising,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: that is not reasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because arising and cessation are contradictory.

original: 'gal ba dag gi rgyu 'dra bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'gal ba dag gi rgyu 'dra bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that a cause of contradictory things is similar,

original: dper na grib ma dang nyi ma dag grang ba dang dro ba dag gi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na grib ma dang nyi ma dag grang ba dang dro ba dag gi lta bu'o //
translated: like the cold and the hot, or shade and light.

original: dus gzhan na 'gag pa nyid kyang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½gang dang @232a * //
analyzed: dus gzhan na 'gag pa nyid kyang 'gal ba'i phyir ro // gang dang @232a * //
translated: It is also contradictory that they cease at another time.

original: 'gal zhe na /ğŸ”½bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag 'du byed de dag thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu skye zhing 'jig pa /ğŸ”½dus re zhig pa /
analyzed: 'gal zhe na / bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag 'du byed de dag thams cad ni sgyu ma lta bu skye zhing 'jig pa / dus re zhig pa /
translated: With what is it contradictory?ğŸ”½It is contradictory with the scriptures, for the Lord has said:

original: yun thung dur gnas pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'i lung dang yang 'gal lo //
analyzed: yun thung dur gnas pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'i lung dang yang 'gal lo //
translated: Monks, all these formations are like a magical illusion, like a mirage, like a dream, momentary, lasting but a short time, unstable, changeable.

original: rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi yid la byed pa dang yang 'gal te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi yid la byed pa dang yang 'gal te /
translated: It is also contradictory with the mental attention of the yogis,

original: de dag ni 'du byed rnams la skye ba dang 'jig pa dag tu yid la byed pa na skad cig re re la 'di rnams 'gag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni 'du byed rnams la skye ba dang 'jig pa dag tu yid la byed pa na skad cig re re la 'di rnams 'gag par mthong ngo //
translated: for when they attend to the arising and cessation of formations, they see that they cease moment by moment.

original: de lta ma yin na 'chi ba'i dus la sogs pa na 'gag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'chi ba'i dus la sogs pa na 'gag par mthong ngo //
translated: Otherwise, it would be seen to cease at the time of death, and so on.

original: de lta ma yin na 'chi ba'i dus la sogs pa na 'gag par mthong ba gzhan dag ji lta bar de dag kyang yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'chi ba'i dus la sogs pa na 'gag par mthong ba gzhan dag ji lta bar de dag kyang yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, like other things that are seen to cease at the time of death, and so on, they would not cause disgust, detachment, and liberation.

original: yang gal te 'du byed skyes pa dus gzhan gyi bar du gnas par 'gyur nas /
analyzed: yang gal te 'du byed skyes pa dus gzhan gyi bar du gnas par 'gyur nas /
translated: Moreover, if the formations that have arisen endure for a period of time,

original: bdag nyid dam gnas pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig gis gnas par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: bdag nyid dam gnas pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig gis gnas par 'gyur grang na /
translated: they would endure either by themselves or through some cause of endurance.

original: re zhig bdag nyid gnas par ni rigs pa ma yin no//
analyzed: re zhig bdag nyid gnas par ni rigs pa ma yin no//
translated: But it is not reasonable that they endure by themselves.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyis bdag nyid mi gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyis bdag nyid mi gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they do not endure by themselves later.

original: gang gis na 'di gnas par mi nus /
analyzed: gang gis na 'di gnas par mi nus /
translated: By what means are they unable to endure?

original: de med pa'i phyir gnas pa'i rgyus kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir gnas pa'i rgyus kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that they endure through a cause of endurance, because that does not exist.

original: de ni cung zad kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de ni cung zad kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: That is not observed in the least.

original: 'on te gnas pa'i rgyu med du zin kyang 'jig pa'i rgyu med pas gnas la 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas ni phyis mes sngon po nyid bzhin du 'jug go snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'on te gnas pa'i rgyu med du zin kyang 'jig pa'i rgyu med pas gnas la 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas ni phyis mes sngon po nyid bzhin du 'jug go snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that even though there is no cause for endurance, there is no cause for destruction, so that it endures, and that later it is destroyed when it encounters a cause of destruction, like the blueness of fire,

original: de med pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not logical, because that cause does not exist.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni phyis kyang cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni phyis kyang cung zad kyang med do //
translated: A cause of destruction does not exist later.

original: mes sngon po nyid 'jug go zhes bya ba yang rab tu ma grub po //
analyzed: mes sngon po nyid 'jug go zhes bya ba yang rab tu ma grub po //
translated: And it is not established that blueness is destroyed by fire.

original: de'i mthu ni mi 'dra bar skye ba la rab tu grub ste /
analyzed: de'i mthu ni mi 'dra bar skye ba la rab tu grub ste /
translated: The power of fire is established to produce a different color.

original: 'di ltar de dang 'brel pa las sngon po nyid kyi rgyun mi 'dra bar 'dzin gyi rnam pa thams cad du mi 'jug pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dang 'brel pa las sngon po nyid kyi rgyun mi 'dra bar 'dzin gyi rnam pa thams cad du mi 'jug pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, when it is related to fire, the continuum of blueness is apprehended as different, but it is not that it is completely destroyed.

original: chu bskol ba rnams kyang me dang 'brel pa las nyung ba dang ches nyung ba skye ba'i sgo nas mthar shin tu dman pas nam yang mi skye bar 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: chu bskol ba rnams kyang me dang 'brel pa las nyung ba dang ches nyung ba skye ba'i sgo nas mthar shin tu dman pas nam yang mi skye bar 'dzin gyi /
translated: Also, when water is boiled, it is apprehended that it is not produced again because it is extremely weak, due to the production of less and less, in dependence on fire.

original: me dang phrad pa las de cig car kho nar med pa ni ma yin no /
analyzed: me dang phrad pa las de cig car kho nar med pa ni ma yin no /
translated: But it is not the case that it does not exist immediately upon coming into contact with fire.

original: // mtshan nyid nges pa'i phyir skyes pa ni 'ga' yang gnas par rung ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: // mtshan nyid nges pa'i phyir skyes pa ni 'ga' yang gnas par rung ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because the characteristics are fixed, it is not possible for what has arisen to endure.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas mi rtag pa nyid du gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nges pa yin na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas mi rtag pa nyid du gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid nges pa yin na /
translated: The Blessed One has declared that conditioned phenomena are impermanent. This is the fixed characteristic of conditioned phenomena.

original: des gal te skyes pa tsam gyis 'jig par mi @232b 'gyur na ni 'di'i dus cung zad cig mi rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ma nges par thal bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: des gal te skyes pa tsam gyis 'jig par mi @232b 'gyur na ni 'di'i dus cung zad cig mi rtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur bas mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ma nges par thal bar 'gyur ro /
translated: If what has arisen did not perish immediately, then it would not be impermanent for even a moment. Thus, it would follow, absurdly, that the characteristic of impermanence would not be fixed.

original: 'on te skad cig ma re re la sngon med pa skye na de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar ngo shes par yang mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na 'dra bar rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir der ni 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on te skad cig ma re re la sngon med pa skye na de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar ngo shes par yang mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na 'dra bar rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir der ni 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: If you think that if each moment were to arise anew, then it would not be recognized as being the same as the previous one, then this is so, but only because they are similar and follow in a continuous stream.

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi sgang sgong dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi sgang sgong dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is just like the case of a magician's illusions.

original: 'dra ba'i phyir de'i blo 'byung gis de yod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i phyir de'i blo 'byung gis de yod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ci mngon zhe na /
translated: Because it is similar, the cognition of that arises, not because it exists. What is the evidence?

original: 'gag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it ceases.

original: de kho na bzhin du gnas pa ni skad cig ma dang po dang khyad par med pa'i phyir mthar yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du gnas pa ni skad cig ma dang po dang khyad par med pa'i phyir mthar yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it remained just as it is, it would not finally be destroyed, because it would not be different from the first moment.

original: de lta bas na de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar ni nges par mi bzung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar ni nges par mi bzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, one should not grasp it as â€œthat is this.â€

original: mthar yongs su 'gyur ba yang dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mthar yongs su 'gyur ba yang dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because a final transformation is also observed.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba'o /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba'o /
translated: â€œTransformationâ€ means becoming something else.

original: de gal te phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams la dang po kho na nas brtsams par ma gyur na ni mjug tu yang yongs su 'gyur ba dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gal te phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams la dang po kho na nas brtsams par ma gyur na ni mjug tu yang yongs su 'gyur ba dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not begin with external and internal things, a final transformation would not be observed.

original: de lta bas na zho'i gnas skabs na 'o ma lta bur rim gyis 'phel na mthar mngon par 'gyur ba gang yin ba gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni dang po kho na nas brtsams pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na zho'i gnas skabs na 'o ma lta bur rim gyis 'phel na mthar mngon par 'gyur ba gang yin ba gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni dang po kho na nas brtsams pa yin la /
translated: Thus, if it gradually increases in the state of curd, like milk, then that which finally becomes manifest is just a transformation.

original: ji srid du gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba de phra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji srid du gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba de phra ba'i phyir /
translated: But as long as the difference is subtle,

original: yongs su mi chod pa de srid du ni 'dra ba rjes su 'jug pas de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar shes so zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: yongs su mi chod pa de srid du ni 'dra ba rjes su 'jug pas de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar shes so zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: it is not discerned, and so long as it is not discerned, it is understood as â€œthat is this.â€

original: de lta bas na skad cig re re la gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir skad cig ma nyid du rab tu grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na skad cig re re la gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir skad cig ma nyid du rab tu grub po //
translated: Thus, because it becomes different in every moment, momentariness is well established.

original: yang gang gis rab tu grub ce na /ğŸ”½de'i rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu'i phyir zhes bya bas te /
analyzed: yang gang gis rab tu grub ce na / de'i rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu'i phyir zhes bya bas te /
translated: By what is it established?ğŸ”½By its being a cause and an effect.

original: skad cig ma'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang ; skad cig ma'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang ; skad cig ma'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning is: because it is the cause of a moment and because it is the effect of a moment.

original: sems ni skad cig mar rab tu sgrub po //
analyzed: sems ni skad cig mar rab tu sgrub po //
translated: Thus, mind is established as momentary.

original: de'i rgyu ni mig la sogs pa 'du byed gzhan dag yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni mig la sogs pa 'du byed gzhan dag yin no //
translated: The cause of this is the other formations, such as the eye, etc.

original: de lta bas na de dag kyang skad cig ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag kyang skad cig ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that these are momentary.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa las skad cig ma 'byung bar 'os pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa las skad cig ma 'byung bar 'os pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible for something that is not momentary to arise from something that is momentary,

original: dper na mi rtag pa las rtag pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mi rtag pa las rtag pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as it is not possible for something permanent to arise from something impermanent.

original: yang 'du byed thams cad kyang sems kyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: yang 'du byed thams cad kyang sems kyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Moreover, all formations are the result of mind.

original: 'di ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci mngon zhe na /
translated: What is the evidence for this?

original: zin pa'i phyir dang / bdag po'i phyir dang / dag pa dang sems can gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zin pa'i phyir dang / bdag po'i phyir dang / dag pa dang sems can gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are grasped, because they are dominant, and because they follow the purity and the defilement of the mind.

original: mig la sogs pa'i 'du byed @233a * //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i 'du byed @233a * //
translated: The formations of the eye, etc.

original: rnams ni des sems dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rjes su zin par 'jug pa'i sgo nas rten dang bcas par zin pa yin te /
analyzed: rnams ni des sems dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rjes su zin par 'jug pa'i sgo nas rten dang bcas par zin pa yin te /
translated: are grasped by the mind because they are associated with the mind and they are grasped as having a basis by way of being grasped as concomitant.

original: de lta bas na sems kyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems kyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are the result of the mind.

original: sems ni 'du byed rnams kyi bdag po yang yin te /
analyzed: sems ni 'du byed rnams kyi bdag po yang yin te /
translated: The mind is dominant with regard to the formations.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten 'di ni sems kyis khrid cing sems kyis 'dren te sems 'byung zhing byung ba'i dbang du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes kyang gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten 'di ni sems kyis khrid cing sems kyis 'dren te sems 'byung zhing byung ba'i dbang du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes kyang gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: And, â€œConditioned by consciousness is name and form. â€

original: de lta bas na 'du byed rnams ni sems kyi 'bras bu yin no ;
analyzed: de lta bas na 'du byed rnams ni sems kyi 'bras bu yin no ;
translated: Therefore, formations are the result of mind.

original: / sems dag pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: / sems dag pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: They are also subsequent to the purification of mind.

original: 'du byed rnams ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sems dag pa'i rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sems dag pa'i rjes su 'jug go //
translated: For, formations are subsequent to the purification of the mind of yogins.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said,

original: dge slong bsam gtan pa rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa sems la dbang thob pas ni gal te shing gi phung po 'di la gser du mos na de la de kho na nyid bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dge slong bsam gtan pa rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa sems la dbang thob pas ni gal te shing gi phung po 'di la gser du mos na de la de kho na nyid bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: â€œA monk who is a meditator, who has supernormal powers, who has attained mastery of mind, if he wishes this mass of wood to be gold, it would become just that for him. â€

original: de'i phyir yang 'du byed rnams sems kyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'du byed rnams sems kyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, formations are the result of mind.

original: sems can gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: sems can gyi rjes su 'jug pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: and because they follow the mind.

original: 'di ltar na sems can sdig pa byed pa rnams la phyi'i dngos po rnams ngan par 'gyur la //
analyzed: 'di ltar na sems can sdig pa byed pa rnams la phyi'i dngos po rnams ngan par 'gyur la //
translated: Thus, for sentient beings who commit evil deeds, external things become bad.

original: bsod nams byed pa rnams la gya nom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams byed pa rnams la gya nom par 'gyur ro //
translated: For those who commit meritorious deeds, they become excellent.

original: de bas na de dag gi sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir 'du byed rnams sems kyi 'bras bu nyid du grub po //
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir 'du byed rnams sems kyi 'bras bu nyid du grub po //
translated: Therefore, because they follow the mind, it is established that formations are the result of the mind.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are momentary.

original: de'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir skad cig ma'i 'bras bu skad cig ma ma yin par ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir skad cig ma'i 'bras bu skad cig ma ma yin par ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Because they follow the mind, it is not possible that a momentary result is not momentary.

original: de ltar na re zhig tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis khyad par med par 'du byed rnams skad cig ma nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis khyad par med par 'du byed rnams skad cig ma nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in the first two verses, formations are established as momentary without distinction.

original: yang nang gi rnams bsgrub pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang nang gi rnams bsgrub pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa lngar rig par bya ste /

analyzed: dang po je bas je che dang // zhes bya ba nas /
translated: First, it increases gradually.ğŸ”½

original: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag gis skad cig ma nyid ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag gis skad cig ma nyid ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: How is momentariness established by these statements beginning with â€œfirst, arisingâ€ and ending with â€œall conditioned phenomena are momentaryâ€?

original: nang gi 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba ni rnam pa bcu bzhi ste /
analyzed: nang gi 'du byed rnams kyi skye ba ni rnam pa bcu bzhi ste /
translated: There are fourteen types of arising of internal formations.

original: dang por skye ba ni dang po nyid du bdag gi ngo bo mngon par grub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dang por skye ba ni dang po nyid du bdag gi ngo bo mngon par grub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Arising as first is the first establishment of oneâ€™s own nature.

original: je bas je cher skye ba ni skye ba'i skad cig ma dang po phyin chad gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: je bas je cher skye ba ni skye ba'i skad cig ma dang po phyin chad gang yin pa'o //
translated: Arising as growth is that which occurs after the first moment of arising.

original: rgyas pas ni zas dang nyal ba dang tshangs par spyod pa dang snyoms par 'jug pas rgyas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pas ni zas dang nyal ba dang tshangs par spyod pa dang snyoms par 'jug pas rgyas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Arising as development is that which is developed by food, sleep, celibacy, and meditative concentration.

original: rten gyi dngos pos ni rten mig la sogs pas mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rten gyi dngos pos ni rten mig la sogs pas mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Arising as a basis is that of eye consciousness and so on, which is based on the eyes and so on.

original: 'gyur ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pas kha dog la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pas kha dog la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas gang yin pa'o //
translated: Arising as transformation is that which occurs through the transformation of color and so on due to attachment and so on.

original: yongs su smin par ni mngal na gnas pa dang byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang lang tsho dang dar la bab pa dang / rgan po'i gnas skabs dag na gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: yongs su smin par ni mngal na gnas pa dang byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang lang tsho dang dar la bab pa dang / rgan po'i gnas skabs dag na gang yin pa'o ;
translated: It is fully developed in the stages of embryo, child, youth, adult, and old age.

original: / dman pa nyid dang khyad par du 'phags pa nyid du ni ngan 'gro dang bde 'gror skye ba rnams kyi gang yin pa ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: / dman pa nyid dang khyad par du 'phags pa nyid du ni ngan 'gro dang bde 'gror skye ba rnams kyi gang yin pa ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is inferior or superior according to birth in unfortunate or fortunate planes of existence, respectively.

original: 'od gsal ba nyid du ni 'dod pa sprul pa dang / 'dod pa gzhan gyis sprul pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag tu skye ba rnams kyi gang yin pa ste ;
analyzed: 'od gsal ba nyid du ni 'dod pa sprul pa dang / 'dod pa gzhan gyis sprul pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag tu skye ba rnams kyi gang yin pa ste ;
translated: It is luminous in the case of those born in the desire realm, the desire realm created by others, and the form and formless realms,

original: sems tsam la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems tsam la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it depends on mind alone.

original: 'od mi gsal ba nyid du ni de las gzhan du skye ba rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'od mi gsal ba nyid du ni de las gzhan du skye ba rnams kyi gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is non-luminous in the case of those born in other realms.

original: yul gzhan du 'gro bar ni yul gzhan du skyes pa 'gags nas yul gzhan du skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yul gzhan du 'gro bar ni yul gzhan du skyes pa 'gags nas yul gzhan du skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It goes to another place when birth ceases in one place and arises in another.

original: sa bon dang bcas pa nyid du ni dgra bcom pa'i phung po tha ma gang dag yin pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang bcas pa nyid du ni dgra bcom pa'i phung po tha ma gang dag yin pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: â€œWith seedsâ€ means all the aggregates of an arhat except the final ones.

original: sa bon med pa nyid du ni tha ma de dag gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon med pa nyid du ni tha ma de dag gang yin pa'o //
translated: â€œWithout seedsâ€ means the final ones.

original: gzugs brnyan nyid du ni rnam par thar pa'i bsam gtan pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba'i 'du byed rnams skye ba gang yin pa'o //ğŸ”½skye pa rnam pa bcu bzhi po 'di dag la nang gi 'du @234a * //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan nyid du ni rnam par thar pa'i bsam gtan pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba'i 'du byed rnams skye ba gang yin pa'o // skye pa rnam pa bcu bzhi po 'di dag la nang gi 'du @234a * //
translated: â€œLike a reflectionâ€ means the formations called â€œreflectionsâ€ that arise by the power of concentration of those who are absorbed in liberation.

original: byed rnams rgyu dang tshad kyi khyad par dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyus skad cig ma nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byed rnams rgyu dang tshad kyi khyad par dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rgyus skad cig ma nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: These fourteen kinds of birth should be understood as momentary on the basis of internal formations, because of the difference in cause and measure, etc.

original: re zhig dang por skye ba la ni rgyu nyid kyi khyad par gyi phyir ro //ğŸ”½gal te de rgyu nyid kyi khyad par du ma gyur na /
analyzed: re zhig dang por skye ba la ni rgyu nyid kyi khyad par gyi phyir ro // gal te de rgyu nyid kyi khyad par du ma gyur na /
translated: The difference in cause is the first kind of birth.ğŸ”½If it were not a difference in cause,

original: des na rgyu khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na rgyu khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: then there would be no difference in cause.

original: 'du byed kyi 'jug pa'i khyad par phyi ma phyi ma dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi 'jug pa'i khyad par phyi ma phyi ma dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The later and later special activities of the formations become the object.

original: khyad par yod na ni phyi ma phyi ma dag las de gzhan yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid du grub po //
analyzed: khyad par yod na ni phyi ma phyi ma dag las de gzhan yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid du grub po //
translated: If there is a difference, then because it is different from the later and later, momentariness is established.

original: je bas je cher skye ba la ni tshad kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: je bas je cher skye ba la ni tshad kyi phyir ro //
translated: In the case of growth, because of the measure.

original: tshad ni bong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: tshad ni bong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Measure means size.

original: skad cig re re la gzhan du 'gyur ba med par tshad kyi khyad par yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig re re la gzhan du 'gyur ba med par tshad kyi khyad par yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Without momentariness, there would be no difference in size, without changing from one moment to the next.

original: rgyas par skye ba la ni skye ba don med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyas par skye ba la ni skye ba don med pa'i phyir te /
translated: In the case of expansion, because expansion would be pointless.

original: rgyas pa ni nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: Expansion is the increase of size.

original: skad cig ma nyid med na de don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid med na de don med par 'gyur te /
translated: If there were no momentariness, expansion would be pointless.

original: de kho na bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would remain just as it is.

original: rgyas pa de nyid mi rung ba'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: rgyas pa de nyid mi rung ba'i yang phyir te /
translated: Also, because that expansion itself is not tenable.

original: skad cig re re la ches rgyas pa skye ba med par ni rgyas par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skad cig re re la ches rgyas pa skye ba med par ni rgyas par mi rung ngo //
translated: Without the generation of a greater expansion in each moment, expansion is not tenable.

original: rten gyi dngos pos skye ba la ni rten nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rten gyi dngos pos skye ba la ni rten nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: But it is impossible for that which is the basis to be born, because it is the basis.

original: rten gnas bzhin du de la brten pa mi gnas par mi rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rten gnas bzhin du de la brten pa mi gnas par mi rung ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not impossible for that which is based to not abide when its basis abides.

original: theg pa gnas bzhin du de la zhon pa mi gnas pa bzhin no /
analyzed: theg pa gnas bzhin du de la zhon pa mi gnas pa bzhin no /
translated: It is like a rider not abiding when the mount abides.

original: de lta ma yin na rten nyid du mi srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rten nyid du mi srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, it would be impossible for it to be the basis.

original: 'gyur par skye ba dang yongs su smin par skye ba la ni /
analyzed: 'gyur par skye ba dang yongs su smin par skye ba la ni /
translated: It is impossible for that which is born as transformation and that which is born as complete maturation

original: gnas pa la ni mi srid dang // dang po mi 'ji mthar mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gnas pa la ni mi srid dang // dang po mi 'ji mthar mi 'gyur //
translated: to abide, because it would not be destroyed at first and would not be destroyed in the end.

original: de bzhin du gnas pa nyid la ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa nyid la ni /
translated: It is impossible for that which is abiding

original: 'dod chags la sogs pas 'gyur ba yang mi srid la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pas 'gyur ba yang mi srid la /
translated: to transform through attachment and so on,

original: gnas skabs gzhan dag tu yongs su smin pa yang mi srid de /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan dag tu yongs su smin pa yang mi srid de /
translated: and it is impossible for it to be completely matured in other states.

original: dang po nas mi 'jig pa yin na tha mar yang 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po nas mi 'jig pa yin na tha mar yang 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not destroyed from the beginning, it would not transform in the end.

original: 'gyur ba dang yongs su smin par skye ba la ji lta ba de bzhin du dman pa dang / khyad par can du skye ba la yang skad cig ma nyid du rig par bya ste //
analyzed: 'gyur ba dang yongs su smin par skye ba la ji lta ba de bzhin du dman pa dang / khyad par can du skye ba la yang skad cig ma nyid du rig par bya ste //
translated: Just as it is for arising as transformation and complete maturation, so it is for arising as inferior and superior.

original: de kho na bzhin du gnas pa'i 'du byed dag la ni gang gis na ngan 'gro'am bde 'gror skye bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi bag chags 'jug pa rnyed par mi 'gyur gyi rim gyis rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par las ni 'jug pa rnyed par rung ngo
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du gnas pa'i 'du byed dag la ni gang gis na ngan 'gro'am bde 'gror skye bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi bag chags 'jug pa rnyed par mi 'gyur gyi rim gyis rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par las ni 'jug pa rnyed par rung ngo
translated: For conditioned factors that remain just as they are, the latent impressions of karma that would cause birth in a miserable realm or happy realm would not be found. But it is possible that they would be found through the special transformation of the continuum over time.

original: // 'od gsal ba dang 'od mi gsal bar skye ba la yang de kho na bzhin du skad cig ma nyid du rung ste //
analyzed: // 'od gsal ba dang 'od mi gsal bar skye ba la yang de kho na bzhin du skad cig ma nyid du rung ste //
translated: It is also possible that arising as luminous and nonluminous is momentary, just as it is.

original: re zhig 'od gsal ba la ni de @234b bzhin du gnas pa la sems la rag lus te 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig 'od gsal ba la ni de @234b bzhin du gnas pa la sems la rag lus te 'jug pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For luminous beings, it is impossible for engagement to depend on mind, since they remain just as they are.

original: 'od mi gsal ba la yang dang po nas 'jig pa med na tha mar 'gyur ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od mi gsal ba la yang dang po nas 'jig pa med na tha mar 'gyur ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And for nonluminous beings, if there is no destruction from the beginning, it is impossible for there to be transformation at the end.

original: yul gzhan du 'gro bar skye ba la ni 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½'du byed rnams la 'gro ba zhes bya ba yul gzhan du 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba 'ga' yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: yul gzhan du 'gro bar skye ba la ni 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro // 'du byed rnams la 'gro ba zhes bya ba yul gzhan du 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba 'ga' yang mi rung ste /
translated: But it is not tenable that there is going where one has gone, because it has already gone.ğŸ”½Nor is it tenable that there is going where one has not gone, because it is not yet gone.

original: de ni skyes pa'am ma skyes pa zhig gis 'du byed yul gzhan du 'gro bar byed grang /ğŸ”½gal te skyes pas so zhe na /
analyzed: de ni skyes pa'am ma skyes pa zhig gis 'du byed yul gzhan du 'gro bar byed grang / gal te skyes pas so zhe na /
translated: Nor is it tenable that there is going where one goes, because there is no activity of going there.

original: des na 'gro ba'i dus na gang du yang ma song bas gnas pa kho na la 'gro ba 'thad pa ma yin no //ğŸ”½'on te ma skyes pas so zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'gro ba'i dus na gang du yang ma song bas gnas pa kho na la 'gro ba 'thad pa ma yin no // 'on te ma skyes pas so zhe na /
translated: Nor is it tenable that there is going where one is going, because there is no activity of going there.ğŸ”½If it is asked whether that which is being gone over is being gone over by that which has arisen or by that which has not arisen,ğŸ”½it is not tenable that that which is being gone over is being gone over by that which has arisen, because it is already arisen.ğŸ”½Nor is it tenable that that which is being gone over is being gone over by that which has not arisen, because it has not yet arisen.

original: des na 'gro ba med na song ba zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na 'gro ba med na song ba zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Nor is it tenable that that which is being gone over is being gone over by that which is in the process of arising, because that which is in the process of arising does not exist.

original: bya ba de yang gal te yul de nyid na gnas pa'i 'du byed la bya ba byed do zhe na /
analyzed: bya ba de yang gal te yul de nyid na gnas pa'i 'du byed la bya ba byed do zhe na /
translated: If it is asked whether that activity is performed by formations that are abiding in that very place,

original: rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin te /
translated: that is not tenable.

original: gnas pa ni yul gzhan du ma phyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa ni yul gzhan du ma phyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because abiding does not go to another place.

original: 'on te yul gzhan na gnas pa la'o zhe na yang rung ba ma yin te ;
analyzed: 'on te yul gzhan na gnas pa la'o zhe na yang rung ba ma yin te ;
translated: If it is asked whether that activity is performed by formations that are abiding in another place, that is also not tenable.

original: bya ba med na yul gzhan du ma phyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba med na yul gzhan du ma phyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is no action, there is no going to another place.

original: bya ba ni yul de'am gzhan na gnas pa'i 'du byed las gzhan du yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba ni yul de'am gzhan na gnas pa'i 'du byed las gzhan du yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And action is not perceived as anything other than the formations that are either in that place or in another.

original: de lta bas na 'du byed rnams yul gzhan dag tu rgyun gyis skye ba las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba ni med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'du byed rnams yul gzhan dag tu rgyun gyis skye ba las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba ni med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no going of formations other than their arising in a continuous series in another place.

original: de med pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid du grub po //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid du grub po //
translated: And because there is no going, their momentariness is established.

original: yul gzhan du bar chad med par skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gro ba ni rgyu du mas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yul gzhan du bar chad med par skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gro ba ni rgyu du mas rig par bya ste /
translated: Going, which is characterized by the arising of formations in another place without interruption, is to be understood as having many causes.

original: sems kyi dbang gis kyang yod de /
analyzed: sems kyi dbang gis kyang yod de /
translated: It exists by the power of the mind,

original: dper na 'chags pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'chags pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi lta bu'o //
translated: as in the case of the stages of creation and so on.

original: sngon gyi las kyi 'phen pas kyang yod de /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi 'phen pas kyang yod de /
translated: It exists by the impetus of past karma,

original: dper na srid pa bar ma'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na srid pa bar ma'i lta bu'o //
translated: as in the case of the intermediate existence.

original: 'phangs pa'i dbang gis kyang yod de //
analyzed: 'phangs pa'i dbang gis kyang yod de //
translated: It exists by the power of an impetus,

original: dper na mda' 'phangs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mda' 'phangs pa lta bu'o //
translated: as in the case of an arrow shot by an archer.

original: 'brel pa'i dbang gis kyang yod de /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i dbang gis kyang yod de /
translated: It exists by the power of a connection,ğŸ”½as in the case of the sun and its light.

original: dper na bzhon pa dang chu rgal bar zhugs pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bzhon pa dang chu rgal bar zhugs pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the case of those who are engaged in riding and crossing water.

original: ded pa'i dbang gis kyang yod de /
analyzed: ded pa'i dbang gis kyang yod de /
translated: It exists by the power of a leader,

original: dper na rtsa rlung gis bdas pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rtsa rlung gis bdas pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: for example, it is like the case of those who are driven by the wind and the channels.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi dbang gis kyang yod de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi dbang gis kyang yod de /
translated: It exists by the power of its own nature,

original: dper na rlung ni thad kar 'gro /
analyzed: dper na rlung ni thad kar 'gro /
translated: for example, it is like the case of wind which moves horizontally,

original: me ni gyen du 'bar /
analyzed: me ni gyen du 'bar /
translated: fire which moves upward,

original: chu ni gzhol bar 'bab pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chu ni gzhol bar 'bab pa lta bu'o //
translated: and water which moves downward.

original: mthus kyang yod de /
analyzed: mthus kyang yod de /
translated: It exists by the power of magic,

original: dper na kha cig ni gsang sngags dang sman gyi mthus /
analyzed: dper na kha cig ni gsang sngags dang sman gyi mthus /
translated: for example, it is like the case of some who move by the power of spells and medicine,

original: lcags dag ni khab len gyi mthus /ğŸ”½rdzu 'phrul dang ldan @235a * //
analyzed: lcags dag ni khab len gyi mthus / rdzu 'phrul dang ldan @235a * //
translated: iron which moves by the power of a magnet,

original: pa rnams ni rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus 'gro ba lta bu'o //ğŸ”½sa bon dang bcas pa dang sa bon med pa'i ngo bor skye ba la ni gnas pa mi rung ba dang / tha ma nyid ni mi srid phyir //
analyzed: pa rnams ni rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus 'gro ba lta bu'o // sa bon dang bcas pa dang sa bon med pa'i ngo bor skye ba la ni gnas pa mi rung ba dang / tha ma nyid ni mi srid phyir //
translated: and those who possess magical powers who move by the power of their magical powers.

original: skad cig ma nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the existence of motion is momentary because it is impossible for something to stand still and because the final end is impossible.

original: sa bon dang bcas pa dang sa bon med pa'i ngo bor skye ba la gnas pa mi rung ba'i phyir skad cig ma nyid yin te /ğŸ”½skad cig re re la rgyu'i ngo bo med pa de bzhin du gnas pa ni dus gzhan nas sa bon gyi ngo bo'am /
analyzed: sa bon dang bcas pa dang sa bon med pa'i ngo bor skye ba la gnas pa mi rung ba'i phyir skad cig ma nyid yin te / skad cig re re la rgyu'i ngo bo med pa de bzhin du gnas pa ni dus gzhan nas sa bon gyi ngo bo'am /
translated: Because it is not possible for something to arise with the nature of having seeds and without the nature of having seeds, it is momentary.ğŸ”½Just as it is not possible for something to remain without the nature of a cause in each moment, it is not possible for it to have the nature of a seed in another moment.

original: skad cig ma tha ma la sa bon med pa nyid du rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma tha ma la sa bon med pa nyid du rung ba ma yin no //
translated: Or, it is not possible for it to be without seeds in the final moment.

original: sngar sa bon dang bcas pa nyid yin la /ğŸ”½skad cig ma tha ma la sa bon med pa nyid du khas blang bar mi nus te /
analyzed: sngar sa bon dang bcas pa nyid yin la / skad cig ma tha ma la sa bon med pa nyid du khas blang bar mi nus te /
translated: It is not possible to accept that it has seeds previouslyğŸ”½and is without seeds in the final moment.

original: de med na tha ma nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na tha ma nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it did not have seeds, it would not be possible for it to be the final moment.

original: de lta na ni tha ma nyid kyang mi srid do //
analyzed: de lta na ni tha ma nyid kyang mi srid do //
translated: If it were like that, it would not be possible for it to be the final moment.

original: gzugs brnyan du skye ba la ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan du skye ba la ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: In the case of arising as a reflection, it should be understood to be momentary because it follows the mind.

original: skad cig re re la sems kyi dbang gis de bzhin du skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig re re la sems kyi dbang gis de bzhin du skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It arises in that way through the power of the mind in each moment.

original: de ltar ne re zhig nang gi 'du byed thams cad skad cig mar bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ne re zhig nang gi 'du byed thams cad skad cig mar bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: In this way, all internal formations are established as momentary.

original: nga ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis phyi'i skad cig ma nyid du sgrub ste /
analyzed: nga ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis phyi'i skad cig ma nyid du sgrub ste /
translated: I will establish external things as momentary by means of three verses.ğŸ”½The elements and the six objects

original: 'byung ba rnams dang don rnam drug / skad cig nyid du brjod pa ni //ğŸ”½skam dang 'phel dang rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams dang don rnam drug / skad cig nyid du brjod pa ni // skam dang 'phel dang rang bzhin gyis //
translated: are said to be momentaryğŸ”½because of drying up, increase, nature,

original: g-yo dang 'phel dang 'grib pa'i phyir //
analyzed: g-yo dang 'phel dang 'grib pa'i phyir //
translated: motion, increase, and decrease.ğŸ”½Because they are related to those elements

original: 'byung ba de dang 'brel phyir dang // yongs su 'gyur ba bzhi yi phyir //
analyzed: 'byung ba de dang 'brel phyir dang // yongs su 'gyur ba bzhi yi phyir //
translated: and because of the four transformations.ğŸ”½Because of similarity of color, smell, taste, and tactility,

original: kha dog dri dang ro dang reg /'dra phyir de ni de dang 'dra //
analyzed: kha dog dri dang ro dang reg /'dra phyir de ni de dang 'dra //
translated: it is like that.

original: bud shing rag las 'jug pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bud shing rag las 'jug pa'i phyir //
translated: Because fuel is engaged in dependence,

original: je bas je cher dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: je bas je cher dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: because of observation of greater and greater,

original: sems rjes 'jug phyir dri ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sems rjes 'jug phyir dri ba'i phyir //
translated: because of conformity with mind, and because of questioning,

original: des na phyir yang skad cig ma //
analyzed: des na phyir yang skad cig ma //
translated: it is momentary.

original: phyi'i de gang zhe na ;
analyzed: phyi'i de gang zhe na ;
translated: What is external?

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag dang / don rnam pa drug po kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang sgra dang chos kyi skye mched pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag dang / don rnam pa drug po kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang sgra dang chos kyi skye mched pa'i gzugs te /
translated: touch, sound, and the form of the sense-object-base.

original: de bas na 'byung ba rnams dang / don rnam pa drug ni skad cig ma nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na 'byung ba rnams dang / don rnam pa drug ni skad cig ma nyid du brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the elements and the six objects are said to be momentary.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: re zhig chu dag skam pa dang 'phel ba'i phyir te ;
analyzed: re zhig chu dag skam pa dang 'phel ba'i phyir te ;
translated: First, because water dries up and increases.

original: chu mig dang mtsho dang mtshe'u la sogs par chu dag rim gyis 'phel ba dang / skam pa dmigs so //
analyzed: chu mig dang mtsho dang mtshe'u la sogs par chu dag rim gyis 'phel ba dang / skam pa dmigs so //
translated: We see that water in springs, lakes, and ponds increases and decreases.

original: de gnyi ga la yang skad cig re re la yongs su 'gyur ba med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga la yang skad cig re re la yongs su 'gyur ba med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In neither case is there a change from moment to moment.

original: phyis kyang khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis kyang khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because later on there is no cause for a difference.

original: rlung ni rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba'i phyir dang // @235b 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung ni rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba'i phyir dang // @235b 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Wind is by nature moving and it increases and decreases.

original: gnas pa ni g-yo ba nyid du mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: gnas pa ni g-yo ba nyid du mi 'gyur te //
translated: What is stable does not move.

original: 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rab tu bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rab tu bsgrubs zin to //
translated: Because there is no going, as has been demonstrated.

original: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag kyang med de //
analyzed: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag kyang med de //
translated: There is no increase or decrease,

original: de kho na bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it remains as it is.

original: sa ni de dang 'brel pa'i phyir dang / yongs su 'gyur ba bzhi'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa ni de dang 'brel pa'i phyir dang / yongs su 'gyur ba bzhi'i phyir ro //
translated: The earth is the result of the water and wind, because it is connected with them and because of the four transformations.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chu yang bzung la rlung yang bzung ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chu yang bzung la rlung yang bzung ste /
translated: The word â€œitâ€ refers to the water and wind.

original: sa ni 'chags pa'i dus na rlung dang bcas pa'i chu dag las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa ni 'chags pa'i dus na rlung dang bcas pa'i chu dag las 'byung ngo //
translated: The earth arises from the water and wind at the time of the formation of the world.

original: de lta bas na de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is the result of the water and wind,

original: de yang skad cig ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang skad cig ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that the earth also is momentary.

original: sa la yongs su 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi yang dmigs te /
analyzed: sa la yongs su 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi yang dmigs te /
translated: Four kinds of transformations of the earth are observed:

original: las kyis byas ba ni sems can rnams kyi las kyi khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: las kyis byas ba ni sems can rnams kyi las kyi khyad par gyis so //
translated: those produced by karma, by the specific karma of sentient beings;

original: gnod pas byas pa ni bsnun pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gnod pas byas pa ni bsnun pa la sogs pas so //
translated: those produced by injury, by blows, etc.;

original: 'byung bas byas pa ni me la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'byung bas byas pa ni me la sogs pas so //
translated: those produced by the elements, by fire, etc.;ğŸ”½and those produced by time, by a long period.

original: dus kyis byas pa ni dus gzhan gyi bar du yongs su gnas pas so //
analyzed: dus kyis byas pa ni dus gzhan gyi bar du yongs su gnas pas so //
translated: That which is produced by time is that which endures for a period of time.

original: de yang skad cig re re la gzhan skye ba med par ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang skad cig re re la gzhan skye ba med par ni mi rung ste /
translated: And that is not tenable without the arising of something else in each moment.

original: 'jigs pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no cause for its destruction.

original: kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams ni sa la sogs pa dang rgyu 'dra ba'i phyir //
analyzed: kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams ni sa la sogs pa dang rgyu 'dra ba'i phyir //
translated: Color, odor, taste, and tangibility are momentary because they are like earth, etc.

original: de kho na bzhin du skad cig ma nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du skad cig ma nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood in the same way as earth, etc.

original: me ni bud shing la rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir skad cig ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: me ni bud shing la rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir skad cig ma nyid yin te /
translated: Fire is momentary because it arises in dependence on fuel.

original: me byung na me dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i bud shing de kho na bzhin du gnas pa ni med do //
analyzed: me byung na me dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i bud shing de kho na bzhin du gnas pa ni med do //
translated: When fire arises, the fuel that co-arises with the fire does not endure in just that way.

original: mjug tu bud shing med pa yang gnas par 'gyur du 'ong bas bud shing tshig pa'i me yang gnas par nus par rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mjug tu bud shing med pa yang gnas par 'gyur du 'ong bas bud shing tshig pa'i me yang gnas par nus par rung ba ma yin no //
translated: And it is not tenable that the fire that burns the fuel endures, because it would follow that there would be fuel at the end when there is no fuel.

original: tshigs su bcad pa sbyar ba'i ngor kha dog la sogs pa ni sngar brjod la me ni phyis brjod do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa sbyar ba'i ngor kha dog la sogs pa ni sngar brjod la me ni phyis brjod do //
translated: In the verse, color, etc. are mentioned first and fire is mentioned later, in accordance with the order of the verse.

original: sgra yang dril bu la sogs pa'i dus gzhan gyi bar du dmigs pa gang yin pa de yang je bas je che bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra yang dril bu la sogs pa'i dus gzhan gyi bar du dmigs pa gang yin pa de yang je bas je che bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sound, for example, is observed to increase gradually until the time of the bell, etc.

original: skad cig ma nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that they are momentary because they are observed to increase gradually.

original: skad cig re re la skad cig ma nyid med par ni je bas je cher dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig re re la skad cig ma nyid med par ni je bas je cher dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For, if they did not exist as momentary, they would not be observed to increase gradually, moment by moment.

original: chos kyi skye mched pa'i gzugs kyang sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid du grub pa kho na ste /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched pa'i gzugs kyang sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid du grub pa kho na ste /
translated: The form of the sphere of dharmas is also established as momentary because it is in conformity with mind.

original: ji skad du sngar bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du sngar bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it was explained above.

original: de lta bas na phyi yang skad cig ma nyid du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na phyi yang skad cig ma nyid du grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the external is also established as momentary.

original: yang dri bas kyang 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma nyid du grub po //
analyzed: yang dri bas kyang 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma nyid du grub po //
translated: Moreover, all formations are established as momentary by the question and answer.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /ğŸ”½re zhig skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba la ci'i phyir @236a * //
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na / re zhig skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba la ci'i phyir @236a * //
translated: How is that?

original: khyod 'du byed rnams mi rtag pa nyid du 'dod la /
analyzed: khyod 'du byed rnams mi rtag pa nyid du 'dod la /
translated: First, to the one who maintains that they are not momentary, â€œWhy do you accept that formations are impermanent?

original: skad cig ma nyid du mi 'dod ces bya ba 'di dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid du mi 'dod ces bya ba 'di dri bar bya'o //
translated: This is the question to be asked:ğŸ”½â€œDo you not assert that they are momentary?â€

original: gal te de 'di skad du skad cig re re la mi rtag pa nyid mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te de 'di skad du skad cig re re la mi rtag pa nyid mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na /
translated: If he says, â€œBecause momentariness is not apprehended in each moment,â€

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: then this should be said to him:

original: mar me la sogs pa skad cig mar rab tu gru pa'i dngos po dag la yang mi g-yo ba'i gnas skabs na de mi 'dzin pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid ma yin par ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: mar me la sogs pa skad cig mar rab tu gru pa'i dngos po dag la yang mi g-yo ba'i gnas skabs na de mi 'dzin pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid ma yin par ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: â€œWhy do you not assert that things that are well known to be momentary, such as a flame, are not momentary because you do not apprehend them in a state of non-movement?â€

original: gal te 'di skad du snga ma bzhin du phyis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du snga ma bzhin du phyis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na /
translated: If he says, â€œBecause they are not apprehended later in the same way as before,â€

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: then this should be said to him:

original: 'du byed rnams la yang ci'i phyir de ltar mi 'dod /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la yang ci'i phyir de ltar mi 'dod /
translated: â€œWhy do you not assert that about formations?â€

original: gal te 'di skad du mar me la sogs pa ni de dag las gzhan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du mar me la sogs pa ni de dag las gzhan pa'i 'du byed rnams dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes zer na /
translated: If he says, â€œBecause a flame, etc. is not similar to formations that are different from them,â€ğŸ”½then this should be said to him:

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: To this we reply as follows.

original: mi 'dra ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of difference:

original: ngo bo nyid mi 'dra ba dang / 'jug pa mi 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid mi 'dra ba dang / 'jug pa mi 'dra ba'o //
translated: difference in nature and difference in function.

original: de la gal te re zhig ngo bo nyid mi 'dra ba yin par 'dod na de nyid kyi phyir dpe nyid du rung ngo //
analyzed: de la gal te re zhig ngo bo nyid mi 'dra ba yin par 'dod na de nyid kyi phyir dpe nyid du rung ngo //
translated: If you maintain that the difference is in nature, then the example is appropriate.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kho na ni de'i dper mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kho na ni de'i dper mi 'gyur te /
translated: The nature of something cannot be its example.

original: dper na mar me'i mar me dang / ba lang gi ba lang lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mar me'i mar me dang / ba lang gi ba lang lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a lamp is not the example of a lamp, and a cow is not the example of a cow.

original: 'on te 'jug pa mi 'dra ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'jug pa mi 'dra ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you maintain that the difference is in function,

original: de nyid kyi phyir dpe nyid du rung ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dpe nyid du rung ste /
translated: then the example is appropriate.

original: mar me la sogs pa ni skad cig ma nyid kyi rjes su 'jug par rab tu grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mar me la sogs pa ni skad cig ma nyid kyi rjes su 'jug par rab tu grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is well known that a lamp, etc., are momentary.

original: yang de la khyod ci bzhon pa 'dug la bzhon pa la zhon pa 'gro bar 'dod dam zhes bya ba 'di 'dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang de la khyod ci bzhon pa 'dug la bzhon pa la zhon pa 'gro bar 'dod dam zhes bya ba 'di 'dri bar bya'o //
translated: You should ask the opponent, â€œDo you maintain that a rider on a horse stands still while the horse moves?â€

original: gal te ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: If he says, â€œNo,â€

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: then you should say to him,ğŸ”½â€œ

original: mig la sogs pa gnas la de dag la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa rgyun gyis 'gro'o zhes bya bar ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa gnas la de dag la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa rgyun gyis 'gro'o zhes bya bar ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible to say that the eye, etc. are the basis and that the consciousnesses supported by them go on continuously.

original: gal te 'di skad du snying po la brten pa'i mar me rgyun gyis 'gro la snying po ni gnas par mthong ba ma yin nam zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du snying po la brten pa'i mar me rgyun gyis 'gro la snying po ni gnas par mthong ba ma yin nam zhes zer na /
translated: If you say, â€œIsnâ€™t it seen that the flame of a lamp, which is supported by its wick, goes on continuously, while the wick remains in one place?â€

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: You should respond as follows:

original: ma mthong ste /
analyzed: ma mthong ste /
translated: It is not seen.

original: de'i rgyun gyi snying po skad cig re re la 'gyur ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyun gyi snying po skad cig re re la 'gyur ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the wick changes from moment to moment as it goes on continuously.

original: gal te 'di skad du 'du byed rnams skad cig ma nyid yin na ci'i phyir mar me bzhin du skad cig ma nyid du ma grub ces zer na /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du 'du byed rnams skad cig ma nyid yin na ci'i phyir mar me bzhin du skad cig ma nyid du ma grub ces zer na /
translated: If you say, â€œIf conditioned factors are momentary, why arenâ€™t they established as momentary, as in the case of a lamp?â€

original: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: You should respond as follows:

original: phyin ci log gi gzhi yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi gzhi yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the basis of error.

original: rgyun 'dra ba 'jug pas 'di dag gi skad cig ma nyid mi @236b shes te ;
analyzed: rgyun 'dra ba 'jug pas 'di dag gi skad cig ma nyid mi @236b shes te ;
translated: Because they go on continuously in a similar way, their momentariness is not recognized.

original: 'di ltar gzhan dang gzhan nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan dang gzhan nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: Although they are different from one another,

original: de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa'i phyin ci log skye'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa'i phyin ci log skye'o //
translated: The error of thinking that it is permanent arises from the notion that it is this same self that was in the past and is now in the present.

original: de lta ma yin na mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, there would be no error in taking the impermanent as permanent.

original: de med na kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur na rnam par byung ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de med na kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur na rnam par byung ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: And if there were no error, there would be no defilement, much less purification.

original: de ltar na brgal zhing brtag pa'i sgo nas kyang 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma nyid du rab tu grub po //
analyzed: de ltar na brgal zhing brtag pa'i sgo nas kyang 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma nyid du rab tu grub po //
translated: Thus, by way of objection and refutation, it is well established that all formations are momentary.

analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir bdag med pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu gnyis te /

original: gang zag btags par yod nyid du //
analyzed: gang zag btags par yod nyid du //
translated: The person is said to exist imputedly,

original: brjod bya rdzas su ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod bya rdzas su ma yin no //
translated: not substantially.ğŸ”½Because of nonapprehension, error,

original: mi dmigs phyin ci log pa dang // kun nas nyon mongs nyon mongs rgyu //ğŸ”½nyes pa gnyis phyir de las 'di //
analyzed: mi dmigs phyin ci log pa dang // kun nas nyon mongs nyon mongs rgyu // nyes pa gnyis phyir de las 'di //
translated: and defilement and purification,ğŸ”½it is not to be said that the person is

original: gcig dang gzhan du brjod bya min //
analyzed: gcig dang gzhan du brjod bya min //
translated: either the same as or different from the aggregates.

original: phung po bdag tu thal ba dang // de rdzas nyid du thal 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: phung po bdag tu thal ba dang // de rdzas nyid du thal 'gyur phyir //

original: gal te rdzas yod brjod min pa'i //
analyzed: gal te rdzas yod brjod min pa'i //
translated: If you say that the self is not a substantial existent,

analyzed: dgos pa yang ni brjod dgos so // gcig dang gzhan du brjod min pa //
translated: You must state the reason why.

original: dgos pa med par mi rigs so //ğŸ”½mtshan nyid dang ni 'jig rten na //
analyzed: dgos pa med par mi rigs so // mtshan nyid dang ni 'jig rten na //
translated: If you say that the self is neither the same as nor different from the aggregates,ğŸ”½You must state the reason why.ğŸ”½Because the self is perceived in terms of characteristics and in the world,

original: mthong phyir bstan bcos sgo nas kyang //
analyzed: mthong phyir bstan bcos sgo nas kyang //
translated: And because it is taught in the treatises,ğŸ”½It is not tenable to say that it cannot be described as either the same as or different from the aggregates,

analyzed: bud shing me bzhin gnyis su ni // brjod min mi rung dmigs phyir ro //
translated: Like fire and fuel, because it is perceived.

original: gnyis yod rnam shes skye ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gnyis yod rnam shes skye ba'i phyir //

analyzed: de rkyen ma yin don med phyir //

original: de phyir lta ba po nas ni //
analyzed: de phyir lta ba po nas ni //
translated: Therefore, it is not the seer, up to and including

analyzed: grol po'i bar du mi 'gyur ro //

original: bdag po nyid cig yin na ni //
analyzed: bdag po nyid cig yin na ni //

analyzed: mi rtag mi 'dod 'byung mi byed //

original: de las mtshan nyid grub dgos te //
analyzed: de las mtshan nyid grub dgos te //

analyzed: de yi byed pa rang byung min //

analyzed: byed pa de yi rkyen can yang //

analyzed: lta sogs byed pa med pa yin //

original: byed po min phyir mi rtag phyir //
analyzed: byed po min phyir mi rtag phyir //

analyzed: cig car rtag tu 'jug pa'i phyir // lta la sogs pa byed pa ni //
translated: Simultaneously and permanently,ğŸ”½It is not tenable that seeing and so forth

original: rang 'byung nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rang 'byung nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: Are self-originated.

analyzed: de bzhin gnas dang zhig pa ni // snga na med dang mi rtag dang ; / phyogs gsum pa yang med pa'i phyir //
translated: Likewise, it is not tenableğŸ”½That the conditions are the prior nonexistence,ğŸ”½The impermanence, or the third possibility.

original: rkyen nyid du ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rkyen nyid du ni mi rung ngo //

analyzed: 'di ltar chos rnams thams cad ni //

analyzed: bdag med dam pa'i don du na //

original: stong nyid bdag tu dmigs pa ni //
analyzed: stong nyid bdag tu dmigs pa ni //
translated: The observation of emptiness as a self

original: nyes par bshad pa kho na yin //
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa kho na yin //
translated: Is explained to be a mistake.ğŸ”½The distinctions of the phases

original: kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang ba'i //ğŸ”½gnas skabs gcod pa'i bye @237a * //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang ba'i // gnas skabs gcod pa'i bye @237a * //
translated: Of thorough affliction and complete purification,

original: brag dang ; /'jug dang rgyun gyi bye brag kyang //
analyzed: brag dang ; /'jug dang rgyun gyi bye brag kyang //

translated: Are taught in terms of the person.

original: bdag tu lta ba skyed mi dgos //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba skyed mi dgos //
translated: The view of self does not need to be generated;

original: goms pa thog ma med dus can //
analyzed: goms pa thog ma med dus can //
translated: It is familiar from beginningless time.ğŸ”½If the person exists,

original: gang zag yod na thams cad ni //
analyzed: gang zag yod na thams cad ni //
translated: All of these

original: 'bad med thar pa'am thar pa med //ğŸ”½ci gang zag yod pa zhes brjod par bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'bad med thar pa'am thar pa med // ci gang zag yod pa zhes brjod par bya ba'am /
translated: There is no liberation without effort.ğŸ”½Should the person be said to exist or not exist?

original: med pa zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: med pa zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: It is said:

original: bshad pa ; gang zag btags par yod nyid du //
analyzed: bshad pa ; gang zag btags par yod nyid du //
translated: The person is said to exist as an imputation,

original: brjod bya rdzas su ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod bya rdzas su ma yin no //
translated: not as a substance.

analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi phyir gang zag btags par ni yod do zhes brjod par bya la rdzas su ni med do zhes brjod par bya ste //

analyzed: de ltar mgo gcig tu smra ba ma yin pa'i smra ba yongs su bzung na med pa nyid kyi nye ba'i go skabs su yang mi 'gyur la /

analyzed: de ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rdzas su mi dmigs so //
translated: It is not perceived as a substance, like form, etc.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang mthong ba'i chos kho na la bdag tu dmigs shing 'dogs par byed do zhes gsungs na /

analyzed: de de ltar dmigs pa ni rdzas su dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is perceived in that way, but not substantially.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: phyin ci log pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag med pa la bdag go snyam du phyin ci log go zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: de lta bas na de ltar gang zag tu 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni phyin ci log yin no //
translated: â€ Therefore, the belief in a person is a perversion.

original: 'di ji ltar rtogs she na //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar rtogs she na //

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is defiled.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said:

analyzed: nga dang nga'i zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa yin te /

analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not suitable to be defiled, because it is not mistaken.
