original: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: 'on te gzhan pa nyid du brjod par bya zhe na /

original: bshad pa ; de las 'di ;
analyzed: bshad pa ; de las 'di ;
translated: It is said:

original: gcig dang gzhan du brjod bya min //
analyzed: gcig dang gzhan du brjod bya min //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: nyes pa gnyis kyi phyir ro //

original: nyes pa gnyis po gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa gnyis po gang gi phyir zhe na /

analyzed: phung po bdag tu thal ba dang // de rdzas nyid du thal 'gyur phyir ;

analyzed: / gcig pa nyid yin na ni phung bo rnam kyang bdag nyid du thal bar 'gyur la /

analyzed: de ltar na gang zag btags par yod pa'i phyir /

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du rigs te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du rigs te /

analyzed: gang dag ston pa'i bstan pa las 'das te /

original: gang zag rdzas su yod pa nyid du 'dod pa de dag la /
analyzed: gang zag rdzas su yod pa nyid du 'dod pa de dag la /
translated: and assert that the person is substantial

original: 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //ğŸ”½gal te rdzas yod brjod min pa'i //
analyzed: 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o // gal te rdzas yod brjod min pa'i //
translated: should be addressed as follows:

original: dgos pa yang ni brjod dgos so //
analyzed: dgos pa yang ni brjod dgos so //
translated: If it is substantial, its purpose must be stated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is that?

original: gcig dang gzhan du brjod min pa //
analyzed: gcig dang gzhan du brjod min pa //

analyzed: dgos pa med par mi rigs so //
translated: it is unreasonable that it have no purpose.

analyzed: 'on te dpe tsam gyis gang zag brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'dod de /
translated: But if you assert that the person cannot be described because it is merely an example,ğŸ”½then you should not say that it is substantial.

analyzed: dper na bud shing las me gzhan dang gzhan nyid ma yin par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: For example, fire is not to be described as different or not different from fuel.

original: de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: To them it should be said:ğŸ”½Because of the characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid dang ni 'jig rten na //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni 'jig rten na //
translated: because of the world,

original: mthong phyir bstan bcos sgo nas kyang //
analyzed: mthong phyir bstan bcos sgo nas kyang //
translated: because of treatises,

original: bud shing me bzhin gnyis su ni //
analyzed: bud shing me bzhin gnyis su ni //
translated: it is not suitable to say that fire is not different from fuel,

original: brjod min mi rung dmigs phyir ro //ğŸ”½gcig pa nyid dang gzhan pa nyid du ste /
analyzed: brjod min mi rung dmigs phyir ro // gcig pa nyid dang gzhan pa nyid du ste /
translated: because of the perception.ğŸ”½It is not suitable to say that fire is not different from fuel, because of the characteristics, because of the world, because of treatises, and because of perception.

original: me zhes bya ba ni me'i khams so //
analyzed: me zhes bya ba ni me'i khams so //
translated: Fire is the fire element.

original: bud shing ni 'byung ba lhag ma rnams te /
analyzed: bud shing ni 'byung ba lhag ma rnams te /
translated: Fuel is the remaining elements.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid tha dad pas bud shing las me gzhan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid tha dad pas bud shing las me gzhan pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since their characteristics are different, fire is definitely different from fuel.

original: 'jig rten na me med par yang shing la sogs pa bud shing mthong la /
analyzed: 'jig rten na me med par yang shing la sogs pa bud shing mthong la /
translated: In the world, fuel such as wood is seen without fire.

original: bud shing med par yang me mthong pas gzhan pa nyid grub po //
analyzed: bud shing med par yang me mthong pas gzhan pa nyid grub po //
translated: And fire is seen without fuel. Therefore difference is established.

original: bstan bcos las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis gang du yang me dang bud shing dag brjod du med par ma gsungs bas 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis gang du yang me dang bud shing dag brjod du med par ma gsungs bas 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But the Master has never said that fire and fuel are inexpressible, so this is not a correct analogy.

original: bud shing med par me yod do zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: bud shing med par me yod do zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that fire exists without fuel?

original: dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is perceived.

original: 'di ltar me rlung gis khyer ba na 'bar bzhin du @238a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar me rlung gis khyer ba na 'bar bzhin du @238a * //
translated: For when fire is carried by the wind, it burns

original: rgyangs bcad par yang 'gro'o //
analyzed: rgyangs bcad par yang 'gro'o //
translated: even though there is no fuel.

original: 'on te yang de na ni rlung bud shing yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yang de na ni rlung bud shing yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the wind is the fuel in that case,

original: de nyid kyi phyir me dang bud shing dag tha dad pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir me dang bud shing dag tha dad pa nyid du grub po //
translated: it is established that fire and fuel are different.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: How so?

original: gnyis su ni dmigs pa'i phyir zhes skabs su bab pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su ni dmigs pa'i phyir zhes skabs su bab pa'o //
translated: Because they are perceived as two.

original: gnyis ni der me dang bud shing nyid du dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ni der me dang bud shing nyid du dmigs pa yin no //
translated: In that case, fire and fuel are perceived as two.

original: mthong ba po nas rnam par shes pa po'i bar dang / byed pa po dang / za ba po dang / shes pa po dang / grol pa po gang yin pa'i gang zag de ni yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba po nas rnam par shes pa po'i bar dang / byed pa po dang / za ba po dang / shes pa po dang / grol pa po gang yin pa'i gang zag de ni yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: The person who is the seer up to the one who is the knower, the one who is the agent, the one who is the experiencer, the one who is the knower, and the one who is the liberator definitely exists.

original: de ni mthong ba por yang mi rung la grol ba po'i bar du yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mthong ba por yang mi rung la grol ba po'i bar du yang mi rung ste /
translated: That is not suitable as the seer up to the one who is the liberator.

original: de ni lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming can rnam par shes pa rnams la rkyen gyi ngo bo'am bdag po la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis byed pa po zhig tu 'gyur grang na //
analyzed: de ni lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming can rnam par shes pa rnams la rkyen gyi ngo bo'am bdag po la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis byed pa po zhig tu 'gyur grang na //
translated: That is the agent in the sense of being a condition or the dominant condition of the consciousnesses that are called seeing and so on.

original: de la re zhig / gnyis yod rnam shes skye ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de la re zhig / gnyis yod rnam shes skye ba'i phyir //
translated: First, since consciousness arises when two are present,

original: de rkyen ma yin /
analyzed: de rkyen ma yin /
translated: it is not a condition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: don med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is meaningless.

original: de la de'i mthu ni cung zad kyang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la de'i mthu ni cung zad kyang ma mthong ngo //
translated: Its power is not seen in the least.

original: bdag po nyid gcig yin na ni /
analyzed: bdag po nyid gcig yin na ni /
translated: If it were the dominant condition,

original: mi rtag mi 'dod 'byung mi byed //
analyzed: mi rtag mi 'dod 'byung mi byed //
translated: it would not produce impermanent and unwanted things.

original: de rnam par shes pa 'byung ba la bdag po nyid gcig yin na ni /
analyzed: de rnam par shes pa 'byung ba la bdag po nyid gcig yin na ni /
translated: If it were the dominant condition of the arising of consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa 'dod pa mi rtag pa yang 'byung bar mi byed la /ğŸ”½mi 'dod pa yang 'byung bar mi byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'dod pa mi rtag pa yang 'byung bar mi byed la / mi 'dod pa yang 'byung bar mi byed pa kho na'o //
translated: Consciousness, whether desired or not, does not arise.

original: de lta bas na gnyi ga ltar yang mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na gnyi ga ltar yang mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since both are impossible,

original: de ni mthong ba po nas grol ba po'i bar yin par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba po nas grol ba po'i bar yin par mi rung ngo //
translated: it is not tenable that it is the seer up to the liberator.

original: gzhan yang gal te gang zag rdzas su yod na de'i las mtshan nyid bsgrub dgos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te gang zag rdzas su yod na de'i las mtshan nyid bsgrub dgos te /
translated: Moreover, if the person exists substantially, its action and its characteristics must be established.

original: gang zhig rdzas su yod pa de'i ni las dang mtshan nyid kyang dmigs te /
analyzed: gang zhig rdzas su yod pa de'i ni las dang mtshan nyid kyang dmigs te /
translated: The action and characteristics of that which exists substantially are observed.

original: dper na mig la sogs pa'i lta ba la sogs pa dang ; gzugs dang ba la sogs pa lta bu yin no /
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pa'i lta ba la sogs pa dang ; gzugs dang ba la sogs pa lta bu yin no /
translated: For example, the seeing, etc. of the eye, and the clarity, etc. of form.

original: gang zag gis ni de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zag gis ni de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case with the person.

original: de lta bas na de ni rdzas su med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni rdzas su med do //
translated: Therefore, it does not exist substantially.

original: de rdzas su 'dod na /
analyzed: de rdzas su 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that it exists substantially,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzogs par byang chub pa rnam pa gsum po zab mo mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang thun mong ma yin pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das par mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la yang gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi rdzogs par byang chub pa rnam pa gsum po zab mo mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang thun mong ma yin pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das par mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la yang gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would also contradict the three kinds of perfect enlightenment of the Lord Buddha: perfect enlightenment in the profound, perfect enlightenment in the extraordinary, and perfect enlightenment in the transcendent.

original: gang zag mngon par rtogs pas ni zab mo yang cung zad kyang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang zag mngon par rtogs pas ni zab mo yang cung zad kyang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: The realization of the person does not lead to perfect enlightenment in the profound at all.

original: gzhan @238b mu stegs can dang thun mong ma yin pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan @238b mu stegs can dang thun mong ma yin pa yang ma yin /
translated: It is not perfect enlightenment in the extraordinary, which is not shared by non-Buddhists.

original: 'jig rten na ma 'dres pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ma 'dres pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not perfect enlightenment in the transcendent, which is not shared by the world.

original: 'di ltar 'dzin pa de ni 'jig rten thams cad kyis go ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dzin pa de ni 'jig rten thams cad kyis go ba /
translated: Because that apprehension is understood by all the world,

original: mu stegs can mngon par zhe na pa /
analyzed: mu stegs can mngon par zhe na pa /
translated: it is not extraordinary to the non-Buddhists.

original: yun ring po nas 'khor ba na 'dres pa yang yin no //
analyzed: yun ring po nas 'khor ba na 'dres pa yang yin no //
translated: It is not transcendent, because it is mixed up in cyclic existence for a long time.

original: gzhan yang gang zag mthong ba po nas rnam par shes pa po'i bar zhig yin na de lta ba la sogs pa la byed pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zag mthong ba po nas rnam par shes pa po'i bar zhig yin na de lta ba la sogs pa la byed pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: Moreover, if the person were the seer up to the cognizer, then seeing and so on would either have an agent or

original: byed pa med pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: byed pa med pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: not have an agent.

original: byed pa dang bcas pa'i byed pa de yang rang byung ba glo bur ba'am /
analyzed: byed pa dang bcas pa'i byed pa de yang rang byung ba glo bur ba'am /
translated: If it has an agent, then that agent would either arise by itself or

original: de'i rkyen can zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de'i rkyen can zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: it would arise due to conditions.

original: nyes pa gsum phyir lta sogs la //
analyzed: nyes pa gsum phyir lta sogs la //
translated: But because of three faults,

original: de yi byed pa rang byung min //
analyzed: de yi byed pa rang byung min //
translated: its activity does not arise by itself.

original: nyes pa gsum po 'chad pa de nyid kyi phyir byed pa de'i rkyen yang min zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyes pa gsum po 'chad pa de nyid kyi phyir byed pa de'i rkyen yang min zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because of the three faults that will be explained, it is also not the case that its activity arises due to conditions.

original: byed pa med pa yin na ni /
analyzed: byed pa med pa yin na ni /
translated: If it has no activity,

original: lta sogs byed pa med pa yin //
analyzed: lta sogs byed pa med pa yin //
translated: then seeing and so on would have no activity.

original: zhes bya ba 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: This would be established.

original: gang zag lta ba la sogs pa la byed pa med na ji ltar lta ba po nas rnam par shes pa po'i bar yin /
analyzed: gang zag lta ba la sogs pa la byed pa med na ji ltar lta ba po nas rnam par shes pa po'i bar yin /
translated: If the person has no activity in seeing and so on, how could it be the seer up to the cognizer?

original: nyes pa gsum gyi phyir zhes bshad pa nyes pa gsum po gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa gsum gyi phyir zhes bshad pa nyes pa gsum po gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: What are the three faults that were explained?

original: byed po min phyir mi rtag phyir //
analyzed: byed po min phyir mi rtag phyir //
translated: Because it is not a creator, because it is impermanent,

original: cig car rtag tu 'jug pa'i phyir //
analyzed: cig car rtag tu 'jug pa'i phyir //
translated: and because it would function simultaneously and constantly,

original: lta la sogs pa byed pa ni //
analyzed: lta la sogs pa byed pa ni //
translated: it is not tenable that seeing and so on

original: rang byung nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rang byung nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: arise from self.

original: gal te lta ba la sogs pa la gang las mthong ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i byed pa glo bur ba zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te lta ba la sogs pa la gang las mthong ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i byed pa glo bur ba zhig yin na /
translated: If seeing and so on arise from a creator that is adventitious to them,

original: 'o na ni gang zag de dag gi byed pa po ma yin pas ji ltar de mthong ba po nas rnam par shes pa po'i bar yin /
analyzed: 'o na ni gang zag de dag gi byed pa po ma yin pas ji ltar de mthong ba po nas rnam par shes pa po'i bar yin /
translated: then since the person is not the creator of those, how could it be the seer up to the knower?

original: yang glo bur ba nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: yang glo bur ba nyid yin na ni /
translated: Moreover, if it is adventitious,

original: ltos pa med pa'i phyir nam yang byed pa med par mi 'gyur bas mi rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i phyir nam yang byed pa med par mi 'gyur bas mi rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would be independent, it would never not function, and therefore it would not be impermanent.

original: byed pa rtag pa yin na yang mthong ba la sogs pa cig car dang rtag tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa rtag pa yin na yang mthong ba la sogs pa cig car dang rtag tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if its function is permanent, the error arises that seeing and so on would occur simultaneously and constantly.

original: de lta bas na lta ba la sogs pa la byed pa rang byung ba nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na lta ba la sogs pa la byed pa rang byung ba nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable that seeing and so on arise from self.

original: de bzhin gnas dang zhig pa ni //
analyzed: de bzhin gnas dang zhig pa ni //
translated: And so too, endurance and destruction

original: snga na med dang mi rtag dang // phyogs gsum pa yang mad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: snga na med dang mi rtag dang // phyogs gsum pa yang mad pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is not prior, because it is impermanent, and because there is no third alternative.

original: rkyen nyid du ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rkyen nyid du ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that it is a condition.

original: 'on te byed pa gang zag gi rkyen can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te byed pa gang zag gi rkyen can yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that the agent is a condition of the action,

original: gnas pa de ni rkyen nyid du rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa de ni rkyen nyid du rung ba ma yin te /
translated: that is not tenable as a condition.

original: snga na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not prior.

original: de de'i rkyen nyid yin na ni gang zag ni nam yang med pa ma yin pas ci'i phyir /ğŸ”½sngon rol gang gi tshe ma skyes pa na byed @239a * //
analyzed: de de'i rkyen nyid yin na ni gang zag ni nam yang med pa ma yin pas ci'i phyir / sngon rol gang gi tshe ma skyes pa na byed @239a * //
translated: If it were a condition of that, then since the person is never nonexistent, why would it not be the case that

original: pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: pa med par 'gyur /
translated: prior to the action, when it has not yet arisen, the person would be without action?

original: zhig pa yang rkyen nyid du mi rung ste /
analyzed: zhig pa yang rkyen nyid du mi rung ste /
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable that the person is a condition of the action that has ceased.

original: gang zag mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½phyogs gsum pa gnas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gang zag mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // phyogs gsum pa gnas pa yang yin la /
translated: Because it would follow that the person would be impermanent.ğŸ”½There is no third alternative apart from these two, that it is both enduring and disintegrating.

original: zhig pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang med pas byed pa de'i rkyen can nyid du rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: zhig pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang med pas byed pa de'i rkyen can nyid du rung ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the person is a condition of the action.

original: de ltar na re zhig rigs pa la brten nas gang zag rdzas su mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig rigs pa la brten nas gang zag rdzas su mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the person is not substantially real, based on reasoning.

original: 'di ltar chos rnams thams cad ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos rnams thams cad ni //
translated: Thus all phenomena

original: bdag med dam pa'i don du na //
analyzed: bdag med dam pa'i don du na //
translated: are selfless in the ultimate.

original: stong nyid bdag tu dmigs pa ni //
analyzed: stong nyid bdag tu dmigs pa ni //
translated: The observation of emptiness as a self

original: nyes par bshad pa kho na yin //
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa kho na yin //
translated: is explained as a fault.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi mod dag las ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi mod dag las ni /
translated: The BhagavÄn has said in the Dharma Discourses:

original: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: â€œAll phenomena are selfless.â€

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid las ni las kyang yod /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid las ni las kyang yod /
translated: In the Ultimate Emptiness, he said:

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa yang yod kyi chos su brdar btags pa ma gtogs pa gang zhig phung po 'di dag 'dor zhing phung po gzhan nying mtshams sbyor bar byad pa'i byed pa po ni mi dmigs so zhes bshad do ;
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa yang yod kyi chos su brdar btags pa ma gtogs pa gang zhig phung po 'di dag 'dor zhing phung po gzhan nying mtshams sbyor bar byad pa'i byed pa po ni mi dmigs so zhes bshad do ;
translated: â€œThere is karma and there is the ripening of karma, but apart from the designation of phenomena as a self, no agent is observed who casts off these aggregates and seizes other aggregates.â€

original: / lnga pa las ni bdag tu dmigs pa la nyes dmigs lnga ste /
analyzed: / lnga pa las ni bdag tu dmigs pa la nyes dmigs lnga ste /
translated: In the fifth chapter, there are five faults in observing a self:

original: bdag tu lta ba dang / srog tu lta bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang / srog tu lta bar 'gyur /
translated: the view of a self and the view of a life force arise;

original: mu stegs can rnams dang khyad par med par 'gyur /
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams dang khyad par med par 'gyur /
translated: there is no difference from the tÄ«rthikas;

original: lam gol bar zhugs par 'gyur /
analyzed: lam gol bar zhugs par 'gyur /
translated: one enters a mistaken path;

original: stong pa nyid la yang 'di'i sems 'jug par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la yang 'di'i sems 'jug par mi 'gyur /
translated: His mind will not enter into emptiness,

original: dad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dad par mi 'gyur /
translated: he will not have faith in it,

original: yang dag par gnas par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yang dag par gnas par mi 'gyur /
translated: he will not abide in it,

original: mos par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mos par mi 'gyur /
translated: he will not aspire to it,

original: 'di'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyang rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad do /
analyzed: 'di'i 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyang rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad do /
translated: and the noble qualities will not be purified in him.

original: de ltar na lung gi sgo nas kyang rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lung gi sgo nas kyang rung ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not tenable to posit the person in terms of scripture.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang kun shes pa dang ldan pa dang / khur khyer ba dang dad pas rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas gang zag kyang de dang de las bshad de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang kun shes pa dang ldan pa dang / khur khyer ba dang dad pas rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas gang zag kyang de dang de las bshad de /
translated: The BhagavÄn also explained the person in terms of the presentation of the person who is endowed with complete understanding, the person who bears a burden, the person who follows faith, and so on.

original: rdzas su med pa nyid gcig yin na ni /
analyzed: rdzas su med pa nyid gcig yin na ni /
translated: If the person does not exist substantially,

original: ci'i phyir bshad ce na /ğŸ”½kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang ba'i //
analyzed: ci'i phyir bshad ce na / kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang ba'i //
translated: why did he explain it?ğŸ”½The BhagavÄn said:ğŸ”½The distinctions of the stages of affliction and purification,

original: gnas skabs gcod pa'i bye brag dang // 'jug dang rgyun gyi bye brag kyang ;
analyzed: gnas skabs gcod pa'i bye brag dang // 'jug dang rgyun gyi bye brag kyang ;
translated: the distinctions of engagement and continuity,

original: / gang zag gis ni nye bar bstan //
analyzed: / gang zag gis ni nye bar bstan //
translated: are taught in terms of the person.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs dang / gcod pa'i bye brag dag dang / de dag gi 'jug pa'i bye brag dag dang / rgyun gyi bye brag ni gang zag gdags pa med par bshad par mi nus so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs dang / gcod pa'i bye brag dag dang / de dag gi 'jug pa'i bye brag dag dang / rgyun gyi bye brag ni gang zag gdags pa med par bshad par mi nus so //
translated: The occasion of affliction and purification, the distinction of severance, the distinction of their engagement, and the distinction of their continuum cannot be explained without positing the person.

original: de la @239b yongs su shes pa'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: de la @239b yongs su shes pa'i mdo las ni /
translated: In the SÅ«tra on Complete Understanding,

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i chos rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i chos rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: the phenomena that are completely understood are afflictions,

original: yongs su shes pa ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes bshad do //
translated: and complete understanding is purification.

original: khur khyer ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: khur khyer ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: In the SÅ«tra on Carrying the Burden,ğŸ”½carrying the burden is affliction,

original: khur dang khur khyer ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: khur dang khur khyer ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: and putting down the burden is purification.

original: khur 'dor ba ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes bshad pa de dag gi 'jug pa'i bye brag dang / rgyun gyi bye brag kyang kun shes pa dang ldan pa dang / khur khyer ba'i gang zag gdags pa med par bshad mi nus la /
analyzed: khur 'dor ba ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes bshad pa de dag gi 'jug pa'i bye brag dang / rgyun gyi bye brag kyang kun shes pa dang ldan pa dang / khur khyer ba'i gang zag gdags pa med par bshad mi nus la /
translated: The distinction of their engagement and the distinction of their continuum cannot be explained without positing the person who completely understands and the person who carries the burden.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos kyi gnas skabs sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / sgom pa dang / mthar thug pa'i lam gyi bye brag gi rnam pa du ma zhig yod pa de dag gi 'jug pa'i bye brag dang / rgyun gyi bye brag kyang dad pas rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa'i gang zag gdags pa med par bshad par mi nus te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos kyi gnas skabs sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / sgom pa dang / mthar thug pa'i lam gyi bye brag gi rnam pa du ma zhig yod pa de dag gi 'jug pa'i bye brag dang / rgyun gyi bye brag kyang dad pas rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa'i gang zag gdags pa med par bshad par mi nus te /
translated: The various aspects of the states of the factors conducive to enlightenment, the path of preparation, the path of seeing, the path of meditation, and the ultimate path cannot be explained without positing persons who follow faith and so on.

original: gang zag rdzas su med pa nyid gcig yin na ni ci'i phyir bshad ces bya ba 'di la tshul ni 'di lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag rdzas su med pa nyid gcig yin na ni ci'i phyir bshad ces bya ba 'di la tshul ni 'di lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If the nonexistence of the person as a substantial reality were the only point, then why was it explained? The method of explaining it should be understood in this way.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: gang zag bshad pa dgos pa med par 'gyur te /ğŸ”½re zhig 'di bdag tu lta ba bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag bshad pa dgos pa med par 'gyur te / re zhig 'di bdag tu lta ba bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: the explanation of the person would be pointless.

original: dgos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dgos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: To begin with, it is not for the purpose of generating the view of a self,ğŸ”½because

original: 'di ltar bdag tu lta ba bskyed mi dgos /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag tu lta ba bskyed mi dgos /
translated: the view of a self is not something to be generated.

original: gna' nas skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gna' nas skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has already been generated from beginningless time.

original: de goms par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de goms par bya ba'i phyir yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not for the purpose of cultivating that view,ğŸ”½because

original: 'di ltar / goms pa thog ma med dus can //
analyzed: 'di ltar / goms pa thog ma med dus can //
translated: Habituation is beginningless.

original: gal te yang bdag tu lta bas thar pas 'di bshad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang bdag tu lta bas thar pas 'di bshad do zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is taught in order to liberate those who have the view of self,

original: de lta yin na ni /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni /
translated: then in that case,

original: thams cad 'bad pa med par thar bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: thams cad 'bad pa med par thar bar 'gyur te //
translated: all would be liberated without effort.

original: 'di ltar bdag tu lta ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag tu lta ba ni /
translated: For the view of self

original: bden pa ma mthong ba thams cad la yod do ;
analyzed: bden pa ma mthong ba thams cad la yod do ;
translated: exists for all who have not seen the truth.

original: / yang na ni thar pa med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: / yang na ni thar pa med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, there would be no liberation at all.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal la sngar sdug bsngal du ma bzung ba las phyis 'dzin pa lta bur /
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal la sngar sdug bsngal du ma bzung ba las phyis 'dzin pa lta bur /
translated: Just as one did not previously apprehend suffering as suffering, but later does,

original: sngar bdag la bdag med par ma bzung ba las /
analyzed: sngar bdag la bdag med par ma bzung ba las /
translated: so too, one would not previously have apprehended the selflessness of the self,ğŸ”½but later would.

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na bdag tu 'dzin pa ni 'ga' yang med kyi /
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na bdag tu 'dzin pa ni 'ga' yang med kyi /
translated: But at the time of the realization of the truth, there is no apprehension of a self at all.

original: sngon ji lta ba phyis kyang de dang 'dra bar thar par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon ji lta ba phyis kyang de dang 'dra bar thar par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as before, later there would be no liberation.

original: yang bdag cig yod na ni gdon mi za bar ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dag gis bdag la sred pa dang / de'i rgyu can gyis nyon mongs pa dag gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir yang thar par mi 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½yang na ni gang zag @240a * //
analyzed: yang bdag cig yod na ni gdon mi za bar ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dag gis bdag la sred pa dang / de'i rgyu can gyis nyon mongs pa dag gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir yang thar par mi 'gyur ro // yang na ni gang zag @240a * //
translated: If there were a self, then without doubt there would be the grasping of â€œIâ€ and â€œmine,â€ the craving for the self, and the defilements caused by that craving. Therefore, there would be no liberation.

original: yod par khas blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: yod par khas blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: Or else, one should not accept the existence of a person.

original: de yod na ni gdon mi za bar nyes pa 'di dag tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod na ni gdon mi za bar nyes pa 'di dag tu thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it exists, then without doubt these faults would follow.

original: de ltar yon tan de dag dang // rtag ldan byang chub sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan de dag dang // rtag ldan byang chub sems dpa' ni //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is always endowed with these virtues

original: bdag nyid don yang mi 'dor zhing //
analyzed: bdag nyid don yang mi 'dor zhing //
translated: does not abandon his own aim

original: gzhan gyi don yang sgrub par byed //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don yang sgrub par byed //
translated: and accomplishes the aim of others.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang brtan pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyi las mdor bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang brtan pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams kyi las mdor bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is a summary of the virtues of conscience and courage.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on the elements leading to enlightenment is completed.

original: // / ngo mtshar che ba rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste /ğŸ”½rang gi lus dang sdom pa'i phyir //ğŸ”½phun sum tshogs pa yongs gtong dang // nyam chung rnams la bzod pa dang // lus dang srog la mi lta bar //
analyzed: // / ngo mtshar che ba rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste / rang gi lus dang sdom pa'i phyir // phun sum tshogs pa yongs gtong dang // nyam chung rnams la bzod pa dang // lus dang srog la mi lta bar //
translated: Giving up the best of things,ğŸ”½forbearance with the weak,ğŸ”½endeavor without regard for body or life,

original: brtson 'grus rtsom dang bsam gtan gyi //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom dang bsam gtan gyi //
translated: and meditative concentration without relishing itsğŸ”½bliss.

original: bde la ro myong med nyid dang // shes rab la ni mi rtog la //
analyzed: bde la ro myong med nyid dang // shes rab la ni mi rtog la //
translated: And also wisdom without discrimination,

original: blo ldan rnams kyi ngo mtshar 'dod //
analyzed: blo ldan rnams kyi ngo mtshar 'dod //
translated: these are held to be the marvels of the geniuses.ğŸ”½Birth in the family of the transcendent lords,

original: de bzhin gshegs rigs skye ba dang // lung bstan pa dang dbang bskur dang // byang chub rab tu thob pa yang //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs rigs skye ba dang // lung bstan pa dang dbang bskur dang // byang chub rab tu thob pa yang //
translated: prophecy, consecration, and full enlightenment

original: ngo mtshar che ba yin par 'dod //ğŸ”½de la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug las brtsams te //
analyzed: ngo mtshar che ba yin par 'dod // de la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug las brtsams te //
translated: are also held to be the marvels of the bodhisattvas.ğŸ”½Two verses on the marvels of the bodhisattvas.

original: sgrub pa'i ngo mtshar che bshad do //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i ngo mtshar che bshad do //
translated: The marvels of the bodhisattvas are explained as being in the six transcendences.

original: sbyin pa la ni rang gi lus gtong ba ngo mtshar che la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la ni rang gi lus gtong ba ngo mtshar che la /
translated: The marvel of generosity is the giving up of ones very body.

original: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa'i ched du ni phun sum tshogs pa rgya chen po gtong ba ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa'i ched du ni phun sum tshogs pa rgya chen po gtong ba ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: The giving up of the great and perfect wealth is the wonder of the vow of morality.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas ni /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas ni /
translated: The third verse

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'bras bu bzhi las brtsams te 'bras bu'i ngo mtshar che ba bshad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'bras bu bzhi las brtsams te 'bras bu'i ngo mtshar che ba bshad de /
translated: The wonder of the result is explained in terms of the four results of the bodhisattva.

original: sa dang po dang brgyad pa dang bcu pa la slob pa'i 'bras bu gsum dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa la mi slob pa'i 'bras bu bzhi pa mchog yin no //
analyzed: sa dang po dang brgyad pa dang bcu pa la slob pa'i 'bras bu gsum dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa la mi slob pa'i 'bras bu bzhi pa mchog yin no //
translated: The three results of the training on the first, eighth, and tenth stages, and the supreme result of the training on the stage of the Buddha, the fourth result.

original: ngo mtshar mi che ba rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /ğŸ”½'dod chags bral dang snying rje dang // de bzhin sgom mchog thob pa dang // sems mnyam phyir na de dag la //
analyzed: ngo mtshar mi che ba rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa / 'dod chags bral dang snying rje dang // de bzhin sgom mchog thob pa dang // sems mnyam phyir na de dag la //
translated: A verse on the analysis of the nonwonderğŸ”½The nonwonder of the bodhisattvas is their application to generosity, etc.

original: sbyor ba ngo mtshar che ma yin //
analyzed: sbyor ba ngo mtshar che ma yin //
translated: out of freedom from attachment, compassion, and the attainment of the highest meditation, because their minds are equal with regard to all beings.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la ste /
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la ste /
translated: The nonwonder of the bodhisattvas is their application to generosity, etc.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la brten nas sbyin pa la sbyor ba la ngo mtshar mi che'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la brten nas sbyin pa la sbyor ba la ngo mtshar mi che'o //
translated: It is not surprising that one should apply oneself to generosity on the basis of freedom from attachment.

original: snying rje la brten nas tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang / sgom pa mchog la brten nas sa brgyad pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med cing rnam par mir tog pa'i brtson 'grus la sogs @240b pa la sbyor ba ngo mtshar mi che'o //ğŸ”½bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa'i sems nyid la brten nas pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la sbyor ba yang ngo mtshar mi che ba nyid de /
analyzed: snying rje la brten nas tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang / sgom pa mchog la brten nas sa brgyad pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med cing rnam par mir tog pa'i brtson 'grus la sogs @240b pa la sbyor ba ngo mtshar mi che'o // bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa'i sems nyid la brten nas pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la sbyor ba yang ngo mtshar mi che ba nyid de /
translated: It is not surprising that one should apply oneself to morality, patience, and the highest meditation on the basis of compassion.

original: bdag nyid kyi don bzhin du gzhan gyi don la skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi don bzhin du gzhan gyi don la skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not surprising that one should apply oneself to the perfections on the basis of the equality of self and other, because one is not discouraged about the welfare of others as one is about one's own.ğŸ”½Three verses on the equality of mind

original: sems mnyam pa nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sems mnyam pa nyid kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste /
translated: Three verses on the sameness of mind.

original: ji ltar blo ldan sems can la //
analyzed: ji ltar blo ldan sems can la //
translated: The wise man's love for all the world

original: rab tu byams par gyur pa ltar //
analyzed: rab tu byams par gyur pa ltar //
translated: is not equaled even by a mother's love for her only child.

original: sems can bdag dang chung ma dang // bu bshes gnyen la de lta min //
analyzed: sems can bdag dang chung ma dang // bu bshes gnyen la de lta min //
translated: The bodhisattva's love for beings is not equaled even by the love of a parent for their only child, nor by the love of a friend for his closest friend.

original: don gnyer ba la phyogs med dang // tshul khrims rtag tu ma nyams dang // kun tu bzod cing thams cad phyir //
analyzed: don gnyer ba la phyogs med dang // tshul khrims rtag tu ma nyams dang // kun tu bzod cing thams cad phyir //
translated: 1. No partiality in regard to those who seek, morality always uncorrupted, patience with all, for all

original: brtson 'grus chen po rtsom pa dang // rtag tu bsam gtan dge ba dang // shes rab rnam par mi rtog nyid //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po rtsom pa dang // rtag tu bsam gtan dge ba dang // shes rab rnam par mi rtog nyid //
translated: 2. great exertion, always virtuous meditation, and nonconceptual intuition

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag la //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag la //
translated: are the universal virtues of the bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar sems mnyam shes par bya //
analyzed: de ltar sems mnyam shes par bya //
translated: One should understand that the bodhisattvas have an equal attitude toward all beings.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni sems can rnams la sems mnyam pa bstan to //ğŸ”½gnyis kyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni sems can rnams la sems mnyam pa bstan to // gnyis kyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la'o //
translated: One verse on the equality of attitude toward all beings.

original: sems can rnams ni bdag nyid la sogs pa la byams pa mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa yang ma yin la gtan du ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni bdag nyid la sogs pa la byams pa mnyam pa nyid dang ldan pa yang ma yin la gtan du ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The love of ordinary people, etc., for themselves, etc., is neither equal nor constant.

original: 'di ltar res 'ga' bdag nyid kyang gsod par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar res 'ga' bdag nyid kyang gsod par byed do //
translated: Sometimes they even kill themselves.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid dang / gtan du ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid dang / gtan du ba yin no //
translated: But the bodhisattvas have an equal and constant attitude toward all beings.ğŸ”½One verse on the equality of attitude toward the transcendences.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sbyin pa la sems mnyam pa nyid ni don du gnyer ba la phyogs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sbyin pa la sems mnyam pa nyid ni don du gnyer ba la phyogs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the perfections, the bodhisattvas have an attitude of sameness with regard to generosity, because they are impartial toward those who seek their gifts.

original: tshul khrims la ni rtag tu phra rab tsam yang mi nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims la ni rtag tu phra rab tsam yang mi nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: With regard to morality, they are always careful not to violate even the most minor moral rule.

original: kun tu bzod cing zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus dang sems can rnams la bye brag med par ro //
analyzed: kun tu bzod cing zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus dang sems can rnams la bye brag med par ro //
translated: They are patient everywhere, without making distinctions of country, time, or persons.

original: thams cad kyi phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni rang gzhan gyi don dang dge ba thams cad kyi don du mnyam par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni rang gzhan gyi don dang dge ba thams cad kyi don du mnyam par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They undertake effort for the sake of all, applying themselves equally to the aims of self and others and to all virtues.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: phan 'dogs pa nyid rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug ste /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa nyid rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu drug ste /
translated: Sixteen verses on the analysis of helpfulnessğŸ”½They make beings fit vessels, establish them in morality,

original: snod nyid du ni byed pa dang // tshul khrims dag la 'god pa dang // gnod pa la ni bzod pa dang // don byed par ni 'gro ba dang // bstan pa 'di la 'dzud pa dang // the tshom gcod par byed pa 'di //
analyzed: snod nyid du ni byed pa dang // tshul khrims dag la 'god pa dang // gnod pa la ni bzod pa dang // don byed par ni 'gro ba dang // bstan pa 'di la 'dzud pa dang // the tshom gcod par byed pa 'di //
translated: are patient with those who injure them,

original: blo ldan rnams kyi sems can la //
analyzed: blo ldan rnams kyi sems can la //
translated: The wise always wish to help

original: phan 'dogs nyid du 'dod pa yin //ğŸ”½tshigs @241a * //
analyzed: phan 'dogs nyid du 'dod pa yin // tshigs @241a * //
translated: sentient beings in six ways.

original: su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phan 'dogs pa nyid ji lta bu yin pa de yongs su bstan te //
analyzed: su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phan 'dogs pa nyid ji lta bu yin pa de yongs su bstan te //
translated: These two verses show how the bodhisattvas help sentient beings through the six perfections.

original: sbyin bas ni sems can rnams dge ba bya ba la stong nyid du byed do //
analyzed: sbyin bas ni sems can rnams dge ba bya ba la stong nyid du byed do //
translated: Through generosity, they make sentient beings fit vessels for the practice of virtue.ğŸ”½Through morality, they introduce them to the teaching.ğŸ”½Through patience, they do not get discouraged.ğŸ”½Through effort, they generate the superknowledges.

original: bsam gtan gyis 'dzud par byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis 'dzud par byed do //
translated: Through meditation, they introduce them to the teaching.

original: mthu'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthu'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Through wisdom, they liberate them.

original: tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni phan 'dogs pa nyid ma la sogs pa dang chos mthun par bstan te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma rnams kyis ni phan 'dogs pa nyid ma la sogs pa dang chos mthun par bstan te /
translated: The remaining verses show how the bodhisattvas help through their similarity to mothers, etc.

original: gang dag rtag tu sems can rnams //
analyzed: gang dag rtag tu sems can rnams //
translated: They always hold sentient beings

original: bsam pa mnyam pas 'dzin byed cing //
analyzed: bsam pa mnyam pas 'dzin byed cing //
translated: with an attitude of equality.ğŸ”½They generate them in the noble stages,ğŸ”½they increase their virtue,ğŸ”½they protect them from misdeeds,

original: 'phags pa'i sa la bskyed pa dang // dge ba 'phel bar byed pa dang // nyes byas las ni yongs su bsrung dang // thos pa byang bar byed pa ni //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i sa la bskyed pa dang // dge ba 'phel bar byed pa dang // nyes byas las ni yongs su bsrung dang // thos pa byang bar byed pa ni //
translated: they purify their learning,

original: las lnga dag gis rgyal sras rnams //ğŸ”½sems can ma dang 'dra ba yin //
analyzed: las lnga dag gis rgyal sras rnams // sems can ma dang 'dra ba yin //
translated: through five activities.

original: sems can gyis ma dang 'dra ba ni sems can rnams kyi ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems can gyis ma dang 'dra ba ni sems can rnams kyi ma lta bu'o //
translated: Like a mother to beings means like a mother to all beings.

original: ma ni bu rnams la phan pa rnam pa lnga byed de ;
analyzed: ma ni bu rnams la phan pa rnam pa lnga byed de ;
translated: A mother performs five benefits for her children:

original: khong na 'dzin par byed //
analyzed: khong na 'dzin par byed //
translated: she carries them in her womb;

original: skyed par byed /ğŸ”½snun par byed /
analyzed: skyed par byed / snun par byed /
translated: she gives birth to them;

original: gos par byed /ğŸ”½kun tu skyed par byed /
analyzed: gos par byed / kun tu skyed par byed /
translated: she nurses them;

original: ngam grog las kyang srung bar byed /
analyzed: ngam grog las kyang srung bar byed /
translated: she protects them from harm;

original: smra ba la yang slob par byed do //
analyzed: smra ba la yang slob par byed do //
translated: and she trains them in speech.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rnams kyi las lnga po 'di dag kyang de dang chos mthun par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnams kyi las lnga po 'di dag kyang de dang chos mthun par rig par bya ste /
translated: These five activities of the bodhisattvas should be understood as analogous to that.

original: 'phags pa'i sa ni 'phags pa'i chos yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i sa ni 'phags pa'i chos yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The noble stage should be understood as the noble qualities.

original: sems can kun la rtag par ni //
analyzed: sems can kun la rtag par ni //
translated: Always generating faith in all beings,ğŸ”½training them in superior morality,ğŸ”½and in the other trainings,

original: dad pa skyed par byed pa dang // lhag pa'i khrims sogs slob pa dang // rnam par grol la sbyor ba'i phyir //
analyzed: dad pa skyed par byed pa dang // lhag pa'i khrims sogs slob pa dang // rnam par grol la sbyor ba'i phyir //
translated: and uniting them with liberation,

original: sangs rgyas la ni gsol ba dang // de dag sgrib pa sbyong ba'i phyir ;

analyzed: bdud kyis las sbron pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: lan du phan 'dogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /

analyzed: longs spyod rnams la ma chags dang // tshul khrims nyams pa med pa dang // byas pa gzo dang ldan pa dang // sgrub pa la yangs sbyor ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of nonattachment to wealth, because of not violating morality, because of gratitude, and because of application to the practice.ğŸ”½Thus, the bodhisattvas,

original: pha rol phyin pa drug po la //ğŸ”½de ltar 'jug pa'i lus can dag / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa drug po la // de ltar 'jug pa'i lus can dag / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni //

analyzed: smon pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa / rtag tu 'phel dang nyams pa dang // sems can rab tu smin pa dang // sa la khyad par 'gro ba dang // bla na med pa'i byang chub 'dod //
translated: A verse on the analysis of aspirationğŸ”½The bodhisattvas always aspire for the increase of the transcendences, for the decrease of their resistances, for the development of living beings, for the progress to higher and higher stages, and for unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnams ni rtag tu pha rol tu phyin pa 'phel ba dang / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa dang / sa la khyad bar du 'gro ba dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste gnas lnga dod do //
translated: The bodhisattvas always aspire for five things: the increase of the transcendences, the decrease of the resistances which are inimical to them, the development of living beings, the progress to higher and higher stages, and unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

original: sbyor ba chud mi za ba nyid rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: sbyor ba chud mi za ba nyid rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the inexhaustibility of applicationğŸ”½Abandoning fear, generating the spirit of enlightenment,

analyzed: 'jigs spangs yang dag bskyed pa dang // the tshom dag ni gcod pa dang // sgrub pa yin gdams dag la //

analyzed: rgyal sras rtag tu chud mi za //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rnams kyi sbyor ba ni // sems can gyi don rnam pa bzhi po chos zab cing rgya che ba la sgag pa spang ba dang / byang chub kyi sems yang dag par bskyed pa dang byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa rnams kyi tho tshom gcod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa bsrub pa'i @243a * //
translated: The bodhisattvas' application is never fruitless.

analyzed: gdams ngag la chud mi zab yin par rig par bya'o //

original: yang dag par sbyor ba nyid rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba nyid rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /

original: re ba med pa'i sbyin pa dang // yang srid mi 'dod tshul khrims dang // thams cad la ni bzod pa dang // yon tan kun 'byung brtson 'grus dang // de bzhin bsams gtan gzugs med yin //

translated: endeavor in the production of all virtues, meditative concentration with its supports,

original: shes rab thabs dang ldan pa ni //
analyzed: shes rab thabs dang ldan pa ni //

analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rig pa'i gnas rnam ni de'i khongs su 'dus pa kho na ste /

original: theg pa chen po las byang chub sems dpa'i rnams la bshad do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po las byang chub sems dpa'i rnams la bshad do //
translated: They are explained in the Great Vehicle for the bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin du nyid rnam pa bdun po 'jug pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / logs par sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyid rnam pa bdun po 'jug pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / gnas pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / logs par sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: Similarly, the seven kinds of reality are the reality of engagement, the reality of characteristics, the reality of representation, the reality of abiding, the reality of error, the reality of purification, and the reality of right practice.

original: yang dag pa'i sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid la brten nas bden pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //ğŸ”½rigs @245a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sgrub pa'i de bzhin nyid la brten nas bden pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no // rigs @245a * //
translated: The four noble truths are established on the basis of the last two realities.

original: pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag par ni rnam par bzhi ste /
analyzed: pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag par ni rnam par bzhi ste /
translated: Reason is classified in four ways:

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o //
translated: the reason of dependence, the reason of cause and effect, the reason of proof, and the reason of nature.

original: theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: theg pa gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The establishment of the designation of vehicle is threefold:

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / theg pa chen po'o //
translated: the vehicle of the Å›rÄvakas, the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas, and the Great Vehicle.

original: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa ni /
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa ni /
translated: The reasoning of dependence is

original: theg pa gsum char la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa gsum char la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /
translated: the proper mental attention to all three vehicles,

original: de la ltos nas rkyen des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ltos nas rkyen des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because in dependence on that condition, the supramundane correct view arises.

original: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa ni /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa ni /
translated: The reasoning of performance of function is

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: correct view together with its result.

original: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni /
analyzed: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni /
translated: The reasoning of proof is

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas yongs su rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas yongs su rtogs pa'o //
translated: thorough understanding by means of the valid knowledge of direct perception and so on.

original: chos nyid kyi rigs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rigs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas te /
translated: The reasoning of reality is the inconceivable state,

original: chos nyid ni grub pa yin pas gdod ci'i phyir tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las yang dag pa'i lta bar 'gyur zhe'am //
analyzed: chos nyid ni grub pa yin pas gdod ci'i phyir tshul bzhin yid la byed pa las yang dag pa'i lta bar 'gyur zhe'am //
translated: because reality is established. Therefore, why would the correct view arise from proper mental attention?

original: de las 'bras bu nyon mongs pa spongs bar 'gyur zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bsam par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las 'bras bu nyon mongs pa spongs bar 'gyur zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bsam par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The result of that is the abandonment of the afflictions. One should not think in such terms.

original: theg pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa ni bsam pa dang / bshad pa dang / sbyor ba dang / tshogs dang / yang dang par 'grub pa dang / rnam par lnga'i sgo nas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa ni bsam pa dang / bshad pa dang / sbyor ba dang / tshogs dang / yang dang par 'grub pa dang / rnam par lnga'i sgo nas rig par bya ste /
translated: The establishment of the three vehicles should be understood in terms of five aspects: intention, teaching, practice, equipment, and complete accomplishment.

original: bsam pa dang / bshad pa dang / sbyor ba dang / tshogs dang / yang dag par 'grub pa dman pa rnams ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dang / bshad pa dang / sbyor ba dang / tshogs dang / yang dag par 'grub pa dman pa rnams ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'o //
translated: The inferior intention, teaching, practice, equipment, and complete accomplishment are the ÅšrÄvaka Vehicle.

original: 'bring rnams ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring rnams ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'o //
translated: The middling are the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle.

original: chog rnams ni theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: chog rnams ni theg pa chen po ste /
translated: The superior are the Great Vehicle.

original: bsam pa ji lta ba dang / 'dod pa ji lta bar chos bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba dang / 'dod pa ji lta bar chos bshad pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is in accordance with the intention and desire.

original: chos bshad pa ji lta bar de la sbyor ro //
analyzed: chos bshad pa ji lta bar de la sbyor ro //
translated: The practice is in accordance with the teaching of the Dharma.

original: sbyor ba ji lta bar tshogs stsogs so //
analyzed: sbyor ba ji lta bar tshogs stsogs so //
translated: The equipment is in accordance with the practice.

original: tshogs ji lta bar byang chub yang dag par 'grub po //
analyzed: tshogs ji lta bar byang chub yang dag par 'grub po //
translated: Enlightenment is completely accomplished in accordance with the equipment.

original: yongs su tshol ba'i rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /ğŸ”½ming dang dngos dag phan tshun du //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba'i rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa / ming dang dngos dag phan tshun du //
translated: One verse on the analysis of thorough searchingğŸ”½.ğŸ”½Name and thing are mutually imputed.

original: glo bur ba ni nyid du btsal ;
analyzed: glo bur ba ni nyid du btsal ;
translated: One should thoroughly search for the adventitiousness of name and thing

original: /'dogs pa rnam pa gnyis po 'dir //
analyzed: /'dogs pa rnam pa gnyis po 'dir //
translated: in regard to the two kinds of designation,

original: de tsam nyid du tshol ba'o /
analyzed: de tsam nyid du tshol ba'o /
translated: and in regard to the mere thing itself.

original: chos rnams la yongs su tshol ba ni rnam pa bzhi sto //
analyzed: chos rnams la yongs su tshol ba ni rnam pa bzhi sto //
translated: The thorough searching of things is fourfold.

original: ming yongs su tshol ba dang // dngos po yongs su tshol ba dang // ngo bo nyid gdags pa yongs su tshol ba dang / khyad par gdags @245b ba yongs su chol ba'o //
analyzed: ming yongs su tshol ba dang // dngos po yongs su tshol ba dang // ngo bo nyid gdags pa yongs su tshol ba dang / khyad par gdags @245b ba yongs su chol ba'o //
translated: The thorough searching for name, the thorough searching for thing, the thorough searching for the designation of intrinsic reality, and the thorough searching for the designation of specific.

original: de la dngos po la ming glo bur ba nyid du yongs su tshol ba ni ming yongs su tshol bya yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dngos po la ming glo bur ba nyid du yongs su tshol ba ni ming yongs su tshol bya yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therein, the thorough searching for the adventitiousness of the name in regard to the thing is to be known as the thorough searching for name.

original: ming la dngos po glo bur ba nyid du yongs su tshol ba ni dngos po yongs su tshol ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ming la dngos po glo bur ba nyid du yongs su tshol ba ni dngos po yongs su tshol ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The thorough searching for the adventitiousness of the thing in regard to the name is to be known as the thorough searching for the thing.

original: de gnyis 'brel pa la ngo bo nyid dang khyad par 'dogs pa dang gdas pa tsam du yongs su tshol ba ni /
analyzed: de gnyis 'brel pa la ngo bo nyid dang khyad par 'dogs pa dang gdas pa tsam du yongs su tshol ba ni /
translated: The investigation of the mere designation of identity and distinction in the relation between those two is the investigation of the mere designation of identity and distinction.

original: ngo bo nyid dang khyad par 'dogs pa yongs su chol byin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang khyad par 'dogs pa yongs su chol byin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The investigation of the reality of identity and distinction should be understood as the investigation of the reality of identity and distinction.ğŸ”½Eight verses on the analysis of the understanding of realityğŸ”½.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa brgyad de /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa brgyad de /
translated: The understanding of reality is fourfold,

original: thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir //ğŸ”½yang dag ye shes rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir // yang dag ye shes rnam pa bzhi //
translated: because all things are not perceived.

original: sa rnams kun la brtan pa yi //ğŸ”½don kun grub par byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: sa rnams kun la brtan pa yi // don kun grub par byed par 'gyur //
translated: The steadfast achieve all goalsğŸ”½on all stages by means of these four understandings of reality.

original: chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ni rnam par bzhi ste /
analyzed: chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa ni rnam par bzhi ste /
translated: The understanding of reality is fourfold:

original: ming yongs su tshol ba dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: ming yongs su tshol ba dang ldan pa ste /
translated: the investigation of names,

original: dngos po yongs su tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du 'dogs pa yongs su tshol ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po yongs su tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du 'dogs pa yongs su tshol ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: the investigation of things, and the investigation of the designation of identity and distinction.

original: de yang ming la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad mi dmigs pa las rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang ming la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad mi dmigs pa las rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, all of these, name, etc., should be understood as not being perceived.ğŸ”½The second half of the verse shows the greatness of the perfect knowledge of reality and its function.

original: phyed 'og mas ni yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa ni che ba'i bdag nyid dang las kyis ston to //ğŸ”½'chir ba yi ni rten dag dang // longs spyod sa bon gyur mtshan 'dir //
analyzed: phyed 'og mas ni yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa ni che ba'i bdag nyid dang las kyis ston to // 'chir ba yi ni rten dag dang // longs spyod sa bon gyur mtshan 'dir //
translated: The verse says,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams //
translated: The mind and mental activities are bound

original: rten bcas sa bon bcas te bcings //
analyzed: rten bcas sa bon bcas te bcings //
translated: by the signs of the body, enjoyments, and seeds.

original: de la rten gyi rgyu mtshan ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: de la rten gyi rgyu mtshan ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The signs of the body are the internal sense bases.

original: longs spyod kyi rgyu mtshan ni gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga'o //ğŸ”½sa bon gyi rgyu mtshan ni /
analyzed: longs spyod kyi rgyu mtshan ni gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga'o // sa bon gyi rgyu mtshan ni /
translated: The signs of enjoyments are the five external sense objects, form, etc.

original: de dag gis sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa ste ;
analyzed: de dag gis sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa ste ;
translated: The signs of seeds are the seeds of those, i.e., of the body and enjoyments.ğŸ”½The mind and mental activities along with their supports are bound by these three kinds of signs, and the store consciousness is bound by the seeds of those.

original: rgyu mtshan rnam pa gsum po 'dir sems dang sems las byung ba rten dang bcas pa rnams dang / de dag gis bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa yang bcings so //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan rnam pa gsum po 'dir sems dang sems las byung ba rten dang bcas pa rnams dang / de dag gis bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa yang bcings so //
translated: The signs of the body are the internal sense bases.ğŸ”½The signs of enjoyments are the five external sense objects, form, etc.ğŸ”½The signs of seeds are the seeds of those, i.e., of the body and enjoyments.ğŸ”½The mind and mental activities along with their supports are bound by these three kinds of signs, and the store consciousness is bound by the seeds of those.

original: rten ni mig la sog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rten ni mig la sog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The basis should be understood as the eye, etc.ğŸ”½Whatever is the sign placed in front,

original: mdun bzhag mtshan ma gang yin dang / bdag nyid 'dug pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: mdun bzhag mtshan ma gang yin dang / bdag nyid 'dug pa gang yin pa //
translated: and whatever is the one who sits,

original: thams cad rnam 'jig blo ldan gyis //
analyzed: thams cad rnam 'jig blo ldan gyis //
translated: the wise one destroys all of that,

original: byang chub mchog ni thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: byang chub mchog ni thob par 'gyur //
translated: and attains supreme enlightenment.

original: de ltar mi rtog pa rim pa de lta bus zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar mi rtog pa rim pa de lta bus zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: Thus, it should be said that by this kind of non-conceptuality,

original: de la mdun du bzhag pa'i mtshan ma ni /ğŸ”½thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i sbyor bas dmigs par byas pa'i @246a * //
analyzed: de la mdun du bzhag pa'i mtshan ma ni / thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i sbyor bas dmigs par byas pa'i @246a * //
translated: therein, the sign placed in front

original: kun brtags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: is the imagined one that is made an object by the application of hearing, reflection, and cultivation.

original: bdag nyid 'dug pa ni rang bzhin gyis dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'dug pa ni rang bzhin gyis dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The one who sits is the natural one that becomes an object,

original: 'bad pas kun brtags pa ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bad pas kun brtags pa ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: not the imagined one that is made an object through effort.

original: de rnam par 'jig pa ni 'bral ba ste /
analyzed: de rnam par 'jig pa ni 'bral ba ste /
translated: The destruction of those two is separation,

original: dmigs pa med pa'i ngo bo'i //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i ngo bo'i //
translated: the nature of non-apprehension.

original: de'i thabs ni mtshan ma'i gnyen po rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i thabs ni mtshan ma'i gnyen po rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The method for that is the non-conceptuality that is the antidote to signs.

original: de gnyi ga yang rim gyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang rim gyis 'byung ste /
translated: Both of those occur gradually.

original: sngar ni gzhag pa la'o //
analyzed: sngar ni gzhag pa la'o //
translated: First, regarding the one placed in front,

original: phyis ni bdag nyid 'dug pa la'o //
analyzed: phyis ni bdag nyid 'dug pa la'o //
translated: and later, when he is seated, he is the one who is seated.

original: de la phyin ci log bzhi dang ldan pa'i gang zag gi mtshan ma rnam par 'jig pa'i rnal 'byor bas ni nyan thos kyi byang chub bam /ğŸ”½rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub 'thob bo //
analyzed: de la phyin ci log bzhi dang ldan pa'i gang zag gi mtshan ma rnam par 'jig pa'i rnal 'byor bas ni nyan thos kyi byang chub bam / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub 'thob bo //
translated: The yogi who destroys the signs of the person endowed with the four errors attains the enlightenment of the disciples or the enlightenment of the solitary sages.

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma rnam par 'jig pas ni byang chub chen po 'thob ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma rnam par 'jig pas ni byang chub chen po 'thob ste /
translated: By destroying the signs of all things, he attains great enlightenment.ğŸ”½This shows how liberation comes about through the thorough knowledge of the bondage just as it is.ğŸ”½The thorough knowledge of the three realitiesğŸ”½The thorough knowledge of the three realities is the thorough knowledge of the reality of suffering, the reality of the origin, and the reality of the path.

original: 'dis ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pas 'ching ba ji ltar yongs su shes na thar par 'gyur ba de bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pas 'ching ba ji ltar yongs su shes na thar par 'gyur ba de bstan to //
translated: The thorough knowledge of the reality of cessation is the thorough knowledge of the reality of cessation.ğŸ”½The thorough knowledge of the three realities is the thorough knowledge of the reality of suffering, the reality of the origin, and the reality of the path.ğŸ”½The thorough knowledge of the reality of cessation is the thorough knowledge of the reality of cessation.

original: de bzhin nyid dmigs shes pa dang / gnyis su 'dzin pa rnam spangs dang // gnas ngan len lus mngon sum pa //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dmigs shes pa dang / gnyis su 'dzin pa rnam spangs dang // gnas ngan len lus mngon sum pa //
translated: The thorough knowledge of the three realities is the thorough knowledge of the reality of suffering, the reality of the origin, and the reality of the path.

original: blo ldan de zad byed par 'dod //
analyzed: blo ldan de zad byed par 'dod //
translated: The thorough knowledge of the reality of cessation is the thorough knowledge of the reality of cessation.ğŸ”½The thorough knowledge of the three realities is the thorough knowledge of the reality of suffering, the reality of the origin, and the reality of the path.ğŸ”½The thorough knowledge of the reality of cessation is the thorough knowledge of the reality of cessation.ğŸ”½The thorough knowledge of the three realities is the thorough knowledge of the reality of suffering, the reality of the origin, and the reality of the path.ğŸ”½The thorough knowledge of the reality of cessation is the thorough knowledge of the reality of cessation.ğŸ”½The thorough knowledge of the three realities is the thorough knowledge of the reality of suffering, the reality of the origin, and the reality of the path.ğŸ”½The thorough knowledge of the reality of cessation is the thorough knowledge of the reality of cessation.ğŸ”½The thorough knowledge of the three realities is the thorough knowledge of the reality of suffering, the reality of the origin, and the reality of the path.ğŸ”½The thorough knowledge of the reality of cessation is the thorough knowledge of the reality of cessation.

original: 'dis ni ngo bo nyid gsum ji ltar yongs su shes pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid zad par 'gyur ba de yongs su bstan te //
analyzed: 'dis ni ngo bo nyid gsum ji ltar yongs su shes pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid zad par 'gyur ba de yongs su bstan te //
translated: The thorough knowledge of the three realities is the thorough knowledge of the reality of suffering, the reality of the origin, and the reality of the path.ğŸ”½The thorough knowledge of the reality of cessation is the thorough knowledge of the reality of cessation.ğŸ”½The thorough knowledge of the three realities is the thorough knowledge of the reality of suffering, the reality of the origin, and

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs la nyid kyis yongs su grub pa ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa dang / gnyis su 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa nyid kyis kun brtags pa dang / gnas ngan len gyi lus mngon gsum pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi dbang yongs su shes pas gnas ngan len gyi lus kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi dbang de nyid zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs la nyid kyis yongs su grub pa ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa dang / gnyis su 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa nyid kyis kun brtags pa dang / gnas ngan len gyi lus mngon gsum pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi dbang yongs su shes pas gnas ngan len gyi lus kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi dbang de nyid zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The thoroughly established nature is fully understood by the very observation of suchness, the imagined nature is fully understood by the abandonment of the duality of the two, and the dependent nature is fully understood by the direct perception of the body of negative reflex actions.

original: de zad par byed pa ni de zad pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: de zad par byed pa ni de zad pa'i ched du'o //
translated: The exhaustion of the body of negative reflex actions is the exhaustion of the dependent nature, the store consciousness.

original: de bzhin nyid dmigs ye shes ni //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dmigs ye shes ni //
translated: The knowledge that observes suchness

original: rnam par tha dad med bsgoms shing //
analyzed: rnam par tha dad med bsgoms shing //
translated: is cultivated without differentiation.

original: yod dang med don mngon sum pa //
analyzed: yod dang med don mngon sum pa //
translated: It is the direct perception of the meaning of existence and nonexistence

original: rnam rtog dbang 'byor nyid ces bya //
analyzed: rnam rtog dbang 'byor nyid ces bya //
translated: and is called mastery over conceptualization.

original: rnam pa tha dad pa med pa bsgom pa ni mtshan ma dang de bzhin nyid ngag tha mi dad pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa med pa bsgom pa ni mtshan ma dang de bzhin nyid ngag tha mi dad pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Cultivation without differentiation is because the sign and suchness are seen as undifferentiated.

original: 'dis ni nyan thos kyi mtshan ma med pa las byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma med pa khyad zhugs par yongs su bstan te //
analyzed: 'dis ni nyan thos kyi mtshan ma med pa las byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma med pa khyad zhugs par yongs su bstan te //
translated: This shows the superiority of the bodhisattva's signlessness over the disciples' signlessness.

original: de dag mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa dag tha dad pa nyid du mthong bas mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i byings yid la byed pa'i sgo nas mtshan ma @246b med pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de dag mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa dag tha dad pa nyid du mthong bas mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i byings yid la byed pa'i sgo nas mtshan ma @246b med pa la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: They enter into the sameness of all signs by not attending to any signs and by attending to the realm of signlessness, because they see signs and signlessness as different.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de bzhin nying las ma gtogs pa'i mtshan ma ma mthong bas mtshan ma nyid mtshan med par mthong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de bzhin nying las ma gtogs pa'i mtshan ma ma mthong bas mtshan ma nyid mtshan med par mthong ste /
translated: But the bodhisattvas, not seeing any sign except suchness, see even signs as signless.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi ye shes de ni rnam pa tha dad pa med par bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi ye shes de ni rnam pa tha dad pa med par bsgom pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, their knowledge is cultivated without any differentiation of aspects.
