original: / longs spyod ma chags zhe la kho na mi 'dzin //
analyzed: / longs spyod ma chags zhe la kho na mi 'dzin //
translated: He is not attached to wealth, does not hold grudges,

original: rnal 'byor rgyu mtshan ma mkhas lta ngag med //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rgyu mtshan ma mkhas lta ngag med //
translated: is skilled in the signs of yoga, and is free of the view of verbal signs.

original: ngang du rab gnas byang chub sems dpa' yin //
analyzed: ngang du rab gnas byang chub sems dpa' yin //
translated: He is well established in the inner, and is a bodhisattva.

original: de la longs spyod dag la ma chags pa ni gang zhig de dag spangs nas rab tu 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de la longs spyod dag la ma chags pa ni gang zhig de dag spangs nas rab tu 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Here, he is not attached to wealth, because he has renounced it and gone forth.

original: rgyu mtshan la mkhas pa ni zhi gnas la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gsum la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan la mkhas pa ni zhi gnas la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gsum la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is skilled in the signs, because he is skilled in the three signs of serenity, etc.

original: nang la rab tu gnas pa ni theg pa chen po las mi g-yo ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nang la rab tu gnas pa ni theg pa chen po las mi g-yo ba'i phyir te /
translated: He is well established in the inner, because he does not waver from the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis nang yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis nang yin no //
translated: The Great Vehicle is the inner teaching for bodhisattvas.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of the rest is self-evident.

original: brtse dang ldan pa ngo tsha yon tan gnas //
analyzed: brtse dang ldan pa ngo tsha yon tan gnas //
translated: He is compassionate, has a sense of shame, and is a repository of good qualities.

original: sdug bsngal dang len rang gi bder ma chags //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang len rang gi bder ma chags //
translated: He accepts suffering, is not attached to his own happiness,

original: dran gtso shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i bdag //
analyzed: dran gtso shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i bdag //
translated: is mindful, and is well concentrated.

original: theg pa mi 'khrugs byang chub sems dpa' yin //
analyzed: theg pa mi 'khrugs byang chub sems dpa' yin //
translated: He is unshaken in his vehicle, and is a bodhisattva.

original: de la dran pa gtso bo ni bsam gtan dang ldan pa dran pa'i stobs kyis sems mnyam par 'dzeg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dran pa gtso bo ni bsam gtan dang ldan pa dran pa'i stobs kyis sems mnyam par 'dzeg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The chief of these is mindfulness, because one who possesses concentration enters into the evenness of mind through the power of mindfulness.

original: shin tu mnyam @248b par gzhag pa'i bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: shin tu mnyam @248b par gzhag pa'i bdag nyid ni //
translated: The nature of complete meditative equipoise

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: is nonconceptual intuition.ğŸ”½The rest is selfevident.ğŸ”½The bodhisattva accepts suffering,

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad dang // sdug bsngal sel ba sdug bsngal mi byed nyid //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad dang // sdug bsngal sel ba sdug bsngal mi byed nyid //
translated: because he dispels suffering, does not create suffering,

original: sdug bsngal bzod pa sdug bsngal 'jigs pa med //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bzod pa sdug bsngal 'jigs pa med //
translated: is patient with suffering, is not frightened by suffering,

original: sdug bsngal rnam grol sdug bsngal mi rtog pa //ğŸ”½sdug bsngal khas len byang chub sems dpa' yin //ğŸ”½de la sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam grol sdug bsngal mi rtog pa // sdug bsngal khas len byang chub sems dpa' yin // de la sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba ni //
translated: is liberated from suffering, and does not conceptualize suffering.

original: bsam gtan dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral bas sdug bsngal nyid las grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral bas sdug bsngal nyid las grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Liberation from suffering is due to the fact that one who possesses concentration is liberated from suffering by being free from attachment to the realm of desire.

original: sdug bsngal khas len pa ni 'khor ba khas len pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal khas len pa ni 'khor ba khas len pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Acceptance of suffering is due to the acceptance of cyclic life.

original: / lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: / lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: chos la mi dga' rang bzhin chos la dga' //
analyzed: chos la mi dga' rang bzhin chos la dga' //
translated: He is naturally fond of the Dharma, not fond of worldly things.

original: chos la smod cing chos la mngon par brtson //
analyzed: chos la smod cing chos la mngon par brtson //
translated: He is critical of the Dharma, and yet he is devoted to the Dharma.

original: chos la dbang chos la mun pa med //
analyzed: chos la dbang chos la mun pa med //
translated: He is a master of the Dharma, and yet he is not in the dark about the Dharma.

original: chos gtsor byed pa byang chub sems dpa' yin //ğŸ”½de la chos la smod pa ni //
analyzed: chos gtsor byed pa byang chub sems dpa' yin // de la chos la smod pa ni //
translated: The bodhisattva is one who makes the Dharma paramount.

original: mi bzod pa la smod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bzod pa la smod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, he is critical of the Dharma because he is critical of intolerance.

original: chos la dbang ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa la'o //
analyzed: chos la dbang ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa la'o //
translated: He is a master of the Dharma because he is absorbed in concentration.

original: chos gtsor byed pa ni byang chub chen por lhur len pa'o //
analyzed: chos gtsor byed pa ni byang chub chen por lhur len pa'o //
translated: He makes the Dharma paramount because he is intent on great enlightenment.

original: tshig sbyar ba la bde bas chos nyid 'dir chos su bshad do //
analyzed: tshig sbyar ba la bde bas chos nyid 'dir chos su bshad do //
translated: The word â€œdharmaâ€ is used here in the sense of the ultimate principle, because it is pleasant to use.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: longs spyod bag yod res la bag yod dang // bsrung la bag yod dge la bag yod dang // bde la bag yod chos la bag yod dang // theg pa bag yod byang chub sems dpa' yin //
analyzed: longs spyod bag yod res la bag yod dang // bsrung la bag yod dge la bag yod dang // bde la bag yod chos la bag yod dang // theg pa bag yod byang chub sems dpa' yin //
translated: The bodhisattva is one who is heedful in regard to wealth, heedful in regard to pleasure, heedful in regard to protection, heedful in regard to virtue, heedful in regard to happiness, heedful in regard to the Dharma, and heedful in regard to the vehicle.

original: de la bsrung ba la ngag yog pa ni bzod par ldan pa rang rang dang gzhan gyi sems rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½chos la bag yog pa ni //
analyzed: de la bsrung ba la ngag yog pa ni bzod par ldan pa rang rang dang gzhan gyi sems rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir ro // chos la bag yog pa ni //
translated: The armor of protection is patience, because it protects the minds of oneself and others.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The armor of Dharma is wisdom, because it is the knowledge of reality just as it is.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: ma gus ngo tsha dang // mi bzod de tsha yongs nyams ngo tsha dang // rnam 'phro ngo tsha ta chung ngo tsha dang // theg chen ngo tsha byang chub sems dpa' yin //
analyzed: ma gus ngo tsha dang // mi bzod de tsha yongs nyams ngo tsha dang // rnam 'phro ngo tsha ta chung ngo tsha dang // theg chen ngo tsha byang chub sems dpa' yin //
translated: The bodhisattva is ashamed of disrespect, ashamed of impatience, ashamed of backsliding, ashamed of distraction, ashamed of lesser vehicles, and ashamed of the HÄ«nayÄna.

original: de la mgus bas ngo tsha ba ni //
analyzed: de la mgus bas ngo tsha ba ni //
translated: Here, shame of disrespect is

original: gang zhig slong ba la khyad du gsod pas so //
analyzed: gang zhig slong ba la khyad du gsod pas so //
translated: because one is ashamed of slighting a beggar.

original: nyes pa chung dus ngo tsha ba ni /
analyzed: nyes pa chung dus ngo tsha ba ni /
translated: Shame of lesser faults is

original: kha na ma tho ba phra ra ba tsa ma dag la yang 'jigs par lta bas so //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba phra ra ba tsa ma dag la yang 'jigs par lta bas so //
translated: because one sees danger even in the slightest wrongdoing.

original: lta ba chung dus ngo tsha ba ni //
analyzed: lta ba chung dus ngo tsha ba ni //
translated: Shame of lesser views is

original: chos la bdag med par ma rtogs pas so //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par ma rtogs pas so //
translated: because one has not realized the selflessness of phenomena.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag thams @249a * //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag thams @249a * //
translated: All of these versesğŸ”½

original: cad kyis ni rnam grangs gzhan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa dang / byang chub chen por smon pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid rig par bya'o //
analyzed: cad kyis ni rnam grangs gzhan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa dang / byang chub chen por smon pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan nyid rig par bya'o //
translated: All of these verses should be understood as defining the bodhisattva in terms of the practice of the six perfections by another method and in terms of the aspiration for great enlightenment.

original: 'di dang rol dang ni btang snyoms dang // du byed ldan dang dbang 'byor nyid thob nyid thob dang // mtshungs par ston dang 'bras bu chen po yis //ğŸ”½byang chub sems dpa' phan 'dogs byed la 'jug //
analyzed: 'di dang rol dang ni btang snyoms dang // du byed ldan dang dbang 'byor nyid thob nyid thob dang // mtshungs par ston dang 'bras bu chen po yis // byang chub sems dpa' phan 'dogs byed la 'jug //
translated: He engages in helping beings by giving, by morality, by being indefatigable, by his powers, by his sovereignty, by his teaching, and by his great results.

original: sbyin pas ni di kho na sems can rnams la phan pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: sbyin pas ni di kho na sems can rnams la phan pa la 'jug go //
translated: By giving, he engages in helping beings in this life.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni skye ba khyed par can thogs nas gzhan du'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni skye ba khyed par can thogs nas gzhan du'o //
translated: By morality, in a subsequent life, having obtained a favorable rebirth.ğŸ”½By being indefatigable, by his powers, and by his sovereignty, he helps by his actions of maturation.

original: 'du byed dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'o //
translated: By his teaching, he helps by the action of showing.

original: 'bras bu chen po yis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'bras bu chen po yis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid kyis so //
translated: By his great results, he helps by the action of universal enlightenment.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang // byang chub chen por smon pas ji ltar sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba de yongs su bstan to ;
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang // byang chub chen por smon pas ji ltar sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba de yongs su bstan to ;
translated: This shows how the bodhisattva benefits beings by means of the six perfections and by aspiring to great enlightenment.

original: / byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan spyir rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa brgyad de /
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan spyir rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa brgyad de /
translated: Eight verses on the general classification of the bodhisattvas names.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
translated: The bodhisattva, the great being,

original: blo ldan nyid dang gsal ba'i mchog //
analyzed: blo ldan nyid dang gsal ba'i mchog //
translated: the wise one, the most excellent of the clear-sighted,

original: rgyal sras rgyal ba'i gzhi dang ni //
analyzed: rgyal sras rgyal ba'i gzhi dang ni //
translated: the victor-offspring, the ground of the victors,ğŸ”½the victor-maker, the victor-sprout,ğŸ”½the powerful one, the most excellent of the noble,ğŸ”½the caravan-leader, the most excellent of the famous,

original: rgyal byed rgyal ba'i myu gu dang // rtsal ldan dang ni 'phags mchog dang ; / ded dpon dang ni grags mchog dang // snying rje can dang bsong nams che //
analyzed: rgyal byed rgyal ba'i myu gu dang // rtsal ldan dang ni 'phags mchog dang ; / ded dpon dang ni grags mchog dang // snying rje can dang bsong nams che //
translated: the compassionate one, the one of great merit,

original: dbang phyug de bzhin chos dang ldan //
analyzed: dbang phyug de bzhin chos dang ldan //
translated: the powerful one, and likewise the righteous one.

original: bcu drug po di dag ni spyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan don dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: bcu drug po di dag ni spyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan don dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: These sixteen names of the bodhisattvas are generally consistent with their meanings.

original: de nyid bzang rtogs don chen legs rtogs dang // don kun rtogs dang rtag to rtogs pa dang // thabs rnams rtogs par 'gyur ba'i khyad par rgyu //
analyzed: de nyid bzang rtogs don chen legs rtogs dang // don kun rtogs dang rtag to rtogs pa dang // thabs rnams rtogs par 'gyur ba'i khyad par rgyu //
translated: The distinctive cause of the realization of the great meaning, the realization of all meanings, the realization of all aspects, the realization of the inexhaustible, and the realization of the methods.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called a bodhisattva.

original: rtogs pa'i khyad par rnam pa lngas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /ğŸ”½gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa rtogs pa dang // rang dang gzhan gyi don rtogs pa dang / don thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rtogs pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa kun tu ston pa na yang mi zad par rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i khyad par rnam pa lngas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste / gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa rtogs pa dang // rang dang gzhan gyi don rtogs pa dang / don thams cad rnam pa thams cad du rtogs pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa kun tu ston pa na yang mi zad par rtogs pa dang /
translated: He is called a bodhisattva because of five kinds of distinctive realization.

original: gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul ba'i thabs rtogs pas so //
analyzed: gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul ba'i thabs rtogs pas so //
translated: The realization of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, the realization of one's own and others' goals, the realization of all meanings in all their aspects, the realization of inexhaustibility even when displaying complete nirvana, and the realization of the methods of guiding disciples in whatever way is necessary.

original: bdag rjes rtogs dang lta ba phra rtogs dang // rnam rig sna @249b tshogs rnam par rtogs pa dang kun //
analyzed: bdag rjes rtogs dang lta ba phra rtogs dang // rnam rig sna @249b tshogs rnam par rtogs pa dang kun //
translated: The realization of the self, the realization of subtle views, the realization of the variety of consciousnesses, and the realization of the unreality of all things.

original: yang dag min rtog yin par rtogs pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: yang dag min rtog yin par rtogs pa'i rgyu //
translated: These are the causes of the realization of the bodhisattva.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called a bodhisattva.

original: 'dir yang sems dang yid rnam par shes pa rtogs pa dang / de rnams kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa nyid du rtogs pa'i sgo nas rtogs pa'i khyad par rnam pa bzhi ston te /
analyzed: 'dir yang sems dang yid rnam par shes pa rtogs pa dang / de rnams kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa nyid du rtogs pa'i sgo nas rtogs pa'i khyad par rnam pa bzhi ston te /
translated: Here, the four kinds of distinctive understanding are shown by way of the understanding of mind, thought, and consciousness, and by way of the understanding that they are only unreal imagination.

original: de la sems ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Therein, mind is the storeconsciousness.

original: yid ni de la dmigs pa bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yid ni de la dmigs pa bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: Thought is that which is associated with the view of self, etc., and has that storeconsciousness for its object.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go //
translated: Consciousness is the group of the six consciousnesses.

original: ma rtogs dang rjes su rtogs pa rtogs //
analyzed: ma rtogs dang rjes su rtogs pa rtogs //
translated: Understanding of non-understanding, understanding of subsequent understanding,

original: dngos med rtogs dang rab tu skye ba rtogs //
analyzed: dngos med rtogs dang rab tu skye ba rtogs //
translated: understanding of the non-existence of things, understanding of their complete arising,

original: ma rtogs rtogs pa so sor rtogs pa'i rgyu //ğŸ”½des na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o /
analyzed: ma rtogs rtogs pa so sor rtogs pa'i rgyu // des na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o /
translated: understanding of the non-understanding of understanding,ğŸ”½Therefore, he is called a bodhisattva.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called a bodhisattva.

original: 'dir ni ma rig pa rtogs pa dang / rig pa rtogs pa dang / kun brtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum rtog pa'i sgo nas rtogs pa'i khyad par rnam pa lnga ston te /
analyzed: 'dir ni ma rig pa rtogs pa dang / rig pa rtogs pa dang / kun brtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum rtog pa'i sgo nas rtogs pa'i khyad par rnam pa lnga ston te /
translated: Here, the five aspects of the realization of the five topics are taught through the door of the realization of ignorance, the realization of knowledge, and the three natures such as the imagined.

original: de la ma rtogs pa nyid du rtogs pa so sor rtogs pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ma rtogs pa nyid du rtogs pa so sor rtogs pas yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, the thoroughly established nature should be known through the realization of the non-realization itself.ğŸ”½The realization of the unreal, the realization of the ultimate,ğŸ”½the realization of all objects, the realization of the entirety of objects,

original: don med rtogs dang don dam rtogs pa dang // don kun rtogs dang mtha' dag don rtogs dang // rtogs bya rtogs gzhi rtogs pa rtogs pa'i rgyu /
analyzed: don med rtogs dang don dam rtogs pa dang // don kun rtogs dang mtha' dag don rtogs dang // rtogs bya rtogs gzhi rtogs pa rtogs pa'i rgyu /
translated: and the realization of the object of realization, the basis of realization, and the cause of realization.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called a bodhisattva.

original: 'dir ni rtogs pa'i khyad par rnam pa lnga ston te /
analyzed: 'dir ni rtogs pa'i khyad par rnam pa lnga ston te /
translated: Here, the five aspects of realization are taught:ğŸ”½the realization of the dependent characteristic, the realization of the thoroughly established characteristic,ğŸ”½the realization of all objects, the realization of the entirety of objects,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang // don kun rtogs dang mtha' dag don rtogs dang // rtogs bya rtogs pa rtogs pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang // don kun rtogs dang mtha' dag don rtogs dang // rtogs bya rtogs pa rtogs pa'i rgyu //
translated: and the realization of the object of realization, the basis of realization, and the cause of realization.

original: des na byang pa dang / rtogs bar bya ba dang / rtogs pa po dang / rtogs pa 'khor gsum yongs su dag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½grub par gyur pa rtogs dang gnas rtogs dang / lhums rjes rtogs dang rim pa rtogs pa dang // rab tu rtogs dang the tshom bsal rtogs rgyu //
analyzed: des na byang pa dang / rtogs bar bya ba dang / rtogs pa po dang / rtogs pa 'khor gsum yongs su dag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro // grub par gyur pa rtogs dang gnas rtogs dang / lhums rjes rtogs dang rim pa rtogs pa dang // rab tu rtogs dang the tshom bsal rtogs rgyu //
translated: Therefore, he is called Bodhisattva because he has realized the purity of the three sectors in the realization of the object to be realized, the one who realizes, and the realization.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called Bodhisattva because he has realized the state of perfection, the state of abode, the state of the womb, the state of lineage, the state of manifestation, and the state of dispelling doubt.

original: de la grub par gyur pa rtogs pa ni sangs rgyas nyid do //
analyzed: de la grub par gyur pa rtogs pa ni sangs rgyas nyid do //
translated: Therein, the state of perfection is Buddhahood.

original: gnas rtogs pa ni gang gis na dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs se pa'o //
analyzed: gnas rtogs pa ni gang gis na dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs se pa'o //
translated: The state of abode is that by which he abides in the Tuá¹£ita abode.ğŸ”½The state of the womb is that by which he enters the womb of his mother.

original: lhums rnges su rtog pa ni gang gis na yum gyi lhums su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: lhums rnges su rtog pa ni gang gis na yum gyi lhums su 'jug pa'o //
translated: The state of lineage is that by which he is born into a particular family.ğŸ”½The state of manifestation is that by which he leaves home.ğŸ”½The state of asceticism is that by which he practices austerities.

original: rim pa ston pa rtogs pa ni gang gis na @250a * //
analyzed: rim pa ston pa rtogs pa ni gang gis na @250a * //
translated: The state of enlightenment is that by which he attains supreme enlightenment.ğŸ”½The state of setting the wheel of doctrine in motion is that by which he sets the wheel of the doctrine in motion.ğŸ”½The state of final cessation is that by which he demonstrates final cessation.

original: lhums nas bltams shing 'dod pa la yongs su longs spyod pa dang / rab tu 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa dang / mngon par rdzog spar byang chub ston pa yin no //
analyzed: lhums nas bltams shing 'dod pa la yongs su longs spyod pa dang / rab tu 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa dang / mngon par rdzog spar byang chub ston pa yin no //
translated: He shows the descent from the Tuá¹£ita abode, entry into the womb, birth, enjoyment of sense objects, departure from home, practice of austerities, enlightenment, setting of the wheel of the Dharma, and final liberation.

original: rab tu rtogs pa dang the tshom bsal ba rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa dang the tshom bsal ba rtogs pa ni /
translated: Realization and the removal of doubts.

original: gang gis na sems can rnams kyi the tshom thams cad bcad pa'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gis na sems can rnams kyi the tshom thams cad bcad pa'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yin no //
translated: He sets the wheel of the Dharma in motion in order to remove all the doubts of sentient beings.

original: blo dang ldan pa blo thob ma thob dang // rab gnas rtogs dang rjes su rtogs pa dang // so sor chad blo brjod med nga bcom dang // nga can blo gros ma smin yang dang smin //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa blo thob ma thob dang // rab gnas rtogs dang rjes su rtogs pa dang // so sor chad blo brjod med nga bcom dang // nga can blo gros ma smin yang dang smin //
translated: The wise one is endowed with eleven kinds of understanding: of what is heard, of the truth, of the teachings, of retention, of eloquence, of the rite, of the meaning, of the moment, of oneself and others, of her perfection, and of her nonperfection.

original: 'dir ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i rtogs pa rnam pa cu gcig gis byang chub sems dpa' yongs su bstan te //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i rtogs pa rnam pa cu gcig gis byang chub sems dpa' yongs su bstan te //
translated: Here, the bodhisattva is shown by eleven kinds of realization, such as the past, etc.

original: de la blo thob dang / ma thob dang rab tu gnas pa ni rtogs pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar byung ba dag go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de la blo thob dang / ma thob dang rab tu gnas pa ni rtogs pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar byung ba dag go rims bzhin no //
translated: The attainment of understanding, the nonattainment of understanding, and the state of abiding in understanding refer, respectively, to past, future, and present understanding.

original: rtogs pa ni rang gis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni rang gis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Understanding is the understanding that comes from within oneself.

original: rjes su rtogs pa ni gzhan las rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa ni gzhan las rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Realization is the understanding that comes from another.

original: 'dis ni nang dang phyi'i rtogs pa ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nang dang phyi'i rtogs pa ston to //
translated: This shows understanding that is internal and external.

original: so sor 'chad par byed pa dang // brjod pa med pa'i blo zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang phra ba'o //ğŸ”½nga rgyal can dang nga rgyal bcom pa zhes bya ba ni dman pa dang gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: so sor 'chad par byed pa dang // brjod pa med pa'i blo zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang phra ba'o // nga rgyal can dang nga rgyal bcom pa zhes bya ba ni dman pa dang gya nom pa'o //
translated: The phrases â€œthe analytic intellectâ€ and â€œthe inexpressible intellectâ€ refer to the gross and subtle forms of understanding.ğŸ”½The phrases â€œthe intellect of the proudâ€ and â€œthe intellect of the humbleâ€ refer to the inferior and superior forms of understanding.

original: blo gros ma smin pa dang yang dag par smin pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa ring ba dang nye ba ston pa yin no //
analyzed: blo gros ma smin pa dang yang dag par smin pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa ring ba dang nye ba ston pa yin no //
translated: The phrases â€œthe immature intellectâ€ and â€œthe mature intellectâ€ refer to understanding that is distant and near.

original: yon tan gyi skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: yon tan gyi skabs rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the section on the qualities of the bodhisattvas.

original: // / rtags rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te //
analyzed: // / rtags rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te //
translated: Two verses on the analysis of the signs of the bodhisattvas.

original: brtse dang snyan par smra ba dang brten pa nyid dang lag brkyang nyid //
analyzed: brtse dang snyan par smra ba dang brten pa nyid dang lag brkyang nyid //
translated: Tenderness, speaking pleasantly, fortitude, and generosity,

original: dgongs pa zab mo nges 'grel ba //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo nges 'grel ba //
translated: and the elucidation of the profound thought of the teaching:ğŸ”½these are the marks of the wise.

original: 'di dag blo ldan rnams kyi rtags //ğŸ”½yongs gzung mos pa thob pa dang // mi skyo gnyis kyis bsdu ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di dag blo ldan rnams kyi rtags // yongs gzung mos pa thob pa dang // mi skyo gnyis kyis bsdu ba'i phyir //
translated: They are to be known as the five marks of the wise,

original: bsam pa dang ni sbyor ba las //
analyzed: bsam pa dang ni sbyor ba las //
translated: because they are the means of conversion, through attraction, through the acquisition of faith, and through the non-discouragement of the two.

original: rtags lngar rnam par shes par bya //
analyzed: rtags lngar rnam par shes par bya //
translated: They are to be known as the five marks of the wise,ğŸ”½because they are the means of conversion, through attraction, through the acquisition of faith, and through the non-discouragement of the two.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtags lnga ston to //
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtags lnga ston to //
translated: In this verse, the first half shows the five marks of the bodhisattva.

original: gnyis pas ni de dag gi las dang mdor bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni de dag gi las dang mdor bsdu ba'o //
translated: The second half shows their function and summary.

original: de la brtse ba ni byang chub kyi sems can yongs su bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brtse ba ni byang chub kyi sems can yongs su bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, tenderness is the means of conversion through attraction, because of the acquisition of faith in the teaching of the Buddha.

original: snyan par smra ba ni /
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni /
translated: Speaking pleasantly is the means of conversion through attraction,

original: sems @250b can rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la mos pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems @250b can rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la mos pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the acquisition of faith by sentient beings in the teaching of the Buddha.ğŸ”½Fortitude is the means of conversion through attraction,

original: brtan pa nyid ni bya dka' ba spyod pa la sogs pas mi skyo bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtan pa nyid ni bya dka' ba spyod pa la sogs pas mi skyo bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the non-discouragement of the two.

original: lag brkyang ba nyid dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba ni gnyis kyis bsdu ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: lag brkyang ba nyid dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba ni gnyis kyis bsdu ba'i phyir te /
translated: The two of openhanded generosity and definitive expression of the teachings comprise the perfection of generosity.ğŸ”½

original: zang zing dang chos kyis go rims bzhin no //ğŸ”½rtags lnga po 'di dag las brtse ba ni bsam pa'i sgo nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zang zing dang chos kyis go rims bzhin no // rtags lnga po 'di dag las brtse ba ni bsam pa'i sgo nas rig par bya'o //
translated: The two of openhandedness and definitive expression are included in the second, because they respectively give material and Dharma gifts.ğŸ”½The five signs are to be known as the five perfections of generosity and so on, because they are the causes of the bodhisattvas openhandedness.

original: lhag ma ni sbyor ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sbyor ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: Of these five signs, loving kindness is to be known as the attitude, and the other four as the application.

original: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste /ğŸ”½byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu ni //
analyzed: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste / byang chub sems dpa' rtag tu ni //
translated: Three verses on the analysis of the householder and the renunciateğŸ”½The bodhisattva

original: khyim pa 'khor los sgyur rnams su //
analyzed: khyim pa 'khor los sgyur rnams su //
translated: always becomes a householder, a universal monarch,

original: gyur nas skye ba thams cad du //
analyzed: gyur nas skye ba thams cad du //
translated: and in all lives

original: sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don byed do //
translated: acts for the benefit of sentient beings.ğŸ”½The wise one

original: sa rnams kun la blo ldan gyis //
analyzed: sa rnams kun la blo ldan gyis //
translated: in all the stagesğŸ”½has the vows of the renunciate,ğŸ”½and also the vows of the householder.

original: rab byung len pas thob pa dang // chos nyid kyis ni thob pa gzhan //
analyzed: rab byung len pas thob pa dang // chos nyid kyis ni thob pa gzhan //
translated: The renunciate

analyzed: rab tu byung ba ston byed pa yin // rab tu byung ba'i phyogs dag ni //
translated: is the one who teaches the renunciate life,

original: yon tan tshad med rnams dang ldan //
analyzed: yon tan tshad med rnams dang ldan //
translated: which has immeasurable good qualities.

original: de ltas sngom brtson khyim pa yi //
analyzed: de ltas sngom brtson khyim pa yi //

original: byang chub sems dpa' las khyad 'phags //ğŸ”½tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'i phyogs ji lta bu zhig la gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las khyad 'phags // tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ni byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'i phyogs ji lta bu zhig la gnas te /
translated: The bodhisattva is superior to them.

original: sems can gyi don byed pa de yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa de yongs su bstan to //
translated: One verse on the kind of household life in which the bodhisattva practices for the benefit of beings.

original: gnyis pas ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs ji lta bu zhig la'o //ğŸ”½de la rab tu byung ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis pas ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs ji lta bu zhig la'o // de la rab tu byung ba ni /
translated: The second verse shows the kind of life of ordination in which he practices.

original: rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: Therein, ordination should be understood as threefold:

original: yang dag par len pas thob pa dang / chos nyid kyis thob pa dang / sprul pa rnams kyis ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par len pas thob pa dang / chos nyid kyis thob pa dang / sprul pa rnams kyis ston par byed pa'o //
translated: that obtained by the rite of going forth, that obtained by the reality of things, and that obtained by the manifestation of emanations.

analyzed: gsum pas ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs khyim pa'i phyogs las khyad par du 'phags par yongs su bstan to //
translated: The third verse shows the superiority of the life of ordination over the household life.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba drug pa ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba drug pa ste /
translated: One verse with six quarters analyzing superior attitude.

original: sa rnams kun la thob pa dang // pha rol sdug pa'i 'bras bu dang // 'di la dge ba 'jug 'dod dang // mya ngan 'das par 'dod pa dang // ma dag rnam dag rab dag pa /
analyzed: sa rnams kun la thob pa dang // pha rol sdug pa'i 'bras bu dang // 'di la dge ba 'jug 'dod dang // mya ngan 'das par 'dod pa dang // ma dag rnam dag rab dag pa /
translated: the desire for nirvana,

original: sems can rnams la bsam par 'dod //
analyzed: sems can rnams la bsam par 'dod //
translated: and the desire for the purification of beings who are not yet pure,ğŸ”½who are pure, and who are very pure.

analyzed: 'dis ni mdor na lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam pa lnga yongs su bstan te /
translated: In brief, these five kinds of superior attitude are taught.

original: bde ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ni pha rol phyin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ni pha rol phyin pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pa'o //
translated: The superior attitude of happiness is the desire for the result of the perfections.

original: phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ni /
analyzed: phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa ni /
translated: The superior attitude of benefit is

original: 'di nyid la dge ba la 'jug par 'dud pa'o //

original: mya ngan la 'das par 'dod pa ni de gnyi ga'i lhag pa'i bsam pa kho na ni yin pas gzhan ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan la 'das par 'dod pa ni de gnyi ga'i lhag pa'i bsam pa kho na ni yin pas gzhan ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The superior attitude of nirvana is the desire for both of these.

original: @251a * // lhag pa'i bsam pa ma dag pa la sogs pa gsum ni ma zhugs pa rnams dang / sa la zhugs pa rnams dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob pa rnams kyi ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: @251a * // lhag pa'i bsam pa ma dag pa la sogs pa gsum ni ma zhugs pa rnams dang / sa la zhugs pa rnams dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa thob pa rnams kyi ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: The three kinds of superior attitude that are impure, etc., belong respectively to those who have not yet entered the stages, to those who have entered the stages, and to those who have attained the irreversible stages.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the bodhisattvas' embracing

analyzed: sa rnams kun la blo ldan pa'i //

translated: with the embrace of prayer, the embrace of mind, the embrace of sovereignty,

analyzed: 'khor sdud pa yis yongs su 'dzin // byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can rnams yongs su 'dzin pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: and the embrace of the assembly.ğŸ”½The bodhisattvas' embrace of beings is fourfold.

original: smon lam gyis yongs su 'dzin pa ni //ğŸ”½byang chub kyi sems kyis sems can yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½sems mnyam pa nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin pa ni mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam gyis yongs su 'dzin pa ni // byang chub kyi sems kyis sems can yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro // sems mnyam pa nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin pa ni mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The embrace of prayer is the embrace of beings by the spirit of enlightenment.ğŸ”½The embrace of mind is the embrace of beings by the spirit of enlightenment.

original: bdag pos yongs su 'dzin pa ni /ğŸ”½rje por gyur pa 'di gang dag gi rje bo yin pa'o //ğŸ”½'khor sdud pas yongs su 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: bdag pos yongs su 'dzin pa ni / rje por gyur pa 'di gang dag gi rje bo yin pa'o // 'khor sdud pas yongs su 'dzin pa ni /
translated: The embrace of sovereignty is the embrace of beings by the bodhisattvas who have attained sovereignty over birth, intuition, and action.

original: slob ma'i tshogs nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob ma'i tshogs nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The embrace of the assembly is the embrace of beings by the bodhisattvas who attract to themselves a following of disciples.

original: skye ba rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa //
analyzed: skye ba rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa //
translated: One verse on the analysis of birth

original: blo ldan gyi las dang ni //ğŸ”½gzhan yang smon lam dag dang ni //
analyzed: blo ldan gyi las dang ni // gzhan yang smon lam dag dang ni //
translated: The wise are born through karma,ğŸ”½through prayer, through concentration,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang dbang 'byor ba'i //ğŸ”½dbang gis skye bar 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang dbang 'byor ba'i // dbang gis skye bar 'dod pa yin //
translated: and through mastery.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas birth is of four kinds.

analyzed: las kyi dbang gis ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams las kyi dbang gis 'dod pa'i gnas su skye ba gang yin pa'o // smon lam gyi dbang gis ni sa la zhugs pa rnams sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Through the power of karma, those who abide in the stage of action in faith are born in the realm of desire through the power of karma.

analyzed: dud 'gro la sogs pa'i gnas dman par yang skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Through the power of prayer, those who have entered the stages are born in the lower realms, such as the animal birthstate, in order to develop living beings.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis ni bsam gtan rnams bzlog nas 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba gang yin pa //ğŸ”½dbang 'byor ba'i dbang gis ni //
translated: Through the power of concentration, they are born in the realm of desire after turning away from the absorptions.ğŸ”½Through the power of mastery, they are born in the inferior realms, such as the hells, through the power of their mastery in order to develop the beings there.

original: sprul pa dag gis dga' ldan gyi gnas la sogs par skye bar kun tu ston pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa dag gis dga' ldan gyi gnas la sogs par skye bar kun tu ston pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the display of birth in the abode of Tuá¹£ita Heaven and so on by means of emanations.

analyzed: gnas pa dang sa rnam par dbye ba'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa /

analyzed: gnas pa dang ni sa nyid do //

analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par dbye ba las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste /

analyzed: las rnams chud me za bar gnas /

analyzed: mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub //
