original: zhing yang rnam par sbyong ba ste /ğŸ”½de yi 'og tu sems can ni //
analyzed: zhing yang rnam par sbyong ba ste / de yi 'og tu sems can ni //
translated: And the field is purified.ğŸ”½After that, the accomplishment of the

original: smin par byed pa 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: smin par byed pa 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: maturation of beings is achieved.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang gzugs rnam dang // byang chub rnam par dag pa nyid //ğŸ”½rnam par gzhag pa 'di dag gis //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang gzugs rnam dang // byang chub rnam par dag pa nyid // rnam par gzhag pa 'di dag gis //
translated: The concentrations, the form, and the purity of enlightenment

original: sa yi mtshan nyid shes par bya //
analyzed: sa yi mtshan nyid shes par bya //
translated: are the characteristics of the stages.

original: gnas pa bcu gcig ni sa bcu gcig go //
analyzed: gnas pa bcu gcig ni sa bcu gcig go //
translated: The eleven stations are the eleven stages.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid las dang po'i mtshan nyid ni stong pa nyid mchog mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid las dang po'i mtshan nyid ni stong pa nyid mchog mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: The characteristics of those stages are as follows: The characteristic of the first stage is the realization of the supremacy of emptiness,

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the realization of the selflessness of persons and things.

original: gnyis pa'i ni las rnams chud mi za ba la rnam par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i ni las rnams chud mi za ba la rnam par gnas pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of the second stage is the stability of the non-loss of karma,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi lam dang de'i 'bras bu rnam par sna tshogs shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi lam dang de'i 'bras bu rnam par sna tshogs shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the knowledge of the virtuous and non-virtuous paths of action and their various results.

original: gsum pa'i ni byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan bde ba phul du byung ba dag gis gnas nas de dag las yongs su ma nyam bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa'i ni byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan bde ba phul du byung ba dag gis gnas nas de dag las yongs su ma nyam bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba yin no //
translated: The third is the bodhisattva who, dwelling in the excellent bliss of the bodhisattva's meditative concentration, is born in the desire realm without losing that bliss.

original: bzhi pa'i ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pas mang du gnas kyang byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams 'khor bar yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pas mang du gnas kyang byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams 'khor bar yongs su bsngo ba yin no //
translated: The fourth is the bodhisattva who, dwelling in the factors of enlightenment, dedicates the factors of enlightenment to cyclic existence.

original: lnga ba'i ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhis mang du gnas pas bdag nyid kyi sems la kun nas nyon mongs pa med par sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: lnga ba'i ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhis mang du gnas pas bdag nyid kyi sems la kun nas nyon mongs pa med par sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa yin te /
translated: The fifth is the bodhisattva who, dwelling in the four noble truths, matures sentient beings without afflicting his own mind.

original: bstan bcos dang bzo sna tshogs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos dang bzo sna tshogs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he composes treatises and various arts.

original: drug pa'i ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung pas mang du gnas pas mang du gnas pas bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba na der kun nas nyon mongs pa rjes su bsrung ba yin no //
analyzed: drug pa'i ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung pas mang du gnas pas mang du gnas pas bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba na der kun nas nyon mongs pa rjes su bsrung ba yin no //
translated: The sixth is the bodhisattva who, dwelling in dependent origination, is born in cyclic existence through his own will and protects the afflicted.

original: bdun pa'i ni 'dres pa nye bar 'dris pa nyid kyis bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam la gnas pa brgyad pa dang 'brel pa mtshan ma med par gcig tu nges pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: bdun pa'i ni 'dres pa nye bar 'dris pa nyid kyis bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam la gnas pa brgyad pa dang 'brel pa mtshan ma med par gcig tu nges pa'i lam yin no //
translated: The seventh is related to the eighth, which is the path of single progress, by the fact that it is the path of single progress, through the mixing and complete mixing of meditative realization.

original: brgyad pa'i ni mngon par 'du byed pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½mtshan ma med pa yang lhun gyis grub pa dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs @252a * //ğŸ”½su sbyong ba yin no //
analyzed: brgyad pa'i ni mngon par 'du byed pa mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i phyir / mtshan ma med pa yang lhun gyis grub pa dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs @252a * // su sbyong ba yin no //
translated: The eighth is related to the ninth, which is the path of liberation, by the fact that it is the path of no more learning, because it is the basis of the effortless, signless, meditative concentration.ğŸ”½The ninth is related to the tenth, which is the great stage of the bodhisattva, by the fact that it is the path of the unique vehicle, because it is the path of the unique vehicle of the three vehicles.

original: dgu pa'i ni so so yang dag par rig pa la dbang ba nyid kyis sems can yongs su smin pa 'grub par 'gyur ba yin te /ğŸ”½rnam pa thams cad du sems can yongs su smin par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgu pa'i ni so so yang dag par rig pa la dbang ba nyid kyis sems can yongs su smin pa 'grub par 'gyur ba yin te / rnam pa thams cad du sems can yongs su smin par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The tenth is related to the eleventh, which is the stage of the tathagata, by the fact that it is the path of the single instant, because it is the path of the single instant of knowledge.ğŸ”½The eleventh is related to the twelfth, which is the stage of the tathagata, by the fact that it is the path of the single instant, because it is the path of the single instant of knowledge.ğŸ”½The twelfth is related to the thirteenth, which is the stage of the tathagata, by the fact that it is the path of the single instant, because it is the path of the single instant of knowledge.

original: bcu pa'i ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nas /ğŸ”½gzungs kyi sgo rnams rnam par dag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bcu pa'i ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nas / gzungs kyi sgo rnams rnam par dag pa nyid yin no //
translated: The thirteenth is related to the fourteenth, which is the stage of the tathagata, by the fact that it is the path of the single instant, because it is the path of the single instant of knowledge.ğŸ”½The fourteenth is related to the fifteenth, which is the stage of the tathagata, by the fact that it is the path of the single instant, because it is the path of the single instant of knowledge.ğŸ”½The fifteenth is related to the sixteenth, which is the stage of the tathagata, by the fact that it is the path of the single instant, because it is the path of the single instant of knowledge.ğŸ”½The sixteenth is related to the seventeenth, which is the stage of the tathagata, by the fact that it is the path of the single instant, because it is the path of the single instant of knowledge.ğŸ”½The seventeenth is related to the eighteenth, which is the stage of the tathagata, by the fact that it is the path of the single instant, because it is the path of the single instant of knowledge.

original: bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mtshan nyid ni //ğŸ”½byang chub rnam par dag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i mtshan nyid ni //ğŸ”½byang chub rnam par dag pa nyid yin te /
translated: The eighteenth is related to the nineteenth, which is the stage of the tathagata, by the fact that it is the path of the single instant,

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam pa thams cad spangs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam pa thams cad spangs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has abandoned the obscurations to omniscience in all their aspects.

original: sa rnams kho na la gang zag rnam par dbye ba las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te //
analyzed: sa rnams kho na la gang zag rnam par dbye ba las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te //
translated: Two verses on the analysis of the person on the various stages

original: byang chub sems dpa' lta ba rnam dag pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lta ba rnam dag pa //
translated: The bodhisattva is pure in view,

original: tshul khrims shin tu rnam dag mnyam par gzhag / chos la nga spangs rgyud dang kun nyon mongs //
analyzed: tshul khrims shin tu rnam dag mnyam par gzhag / chos la nga spangs rgyud dang kun nyon mongs //
translated: pure in morality, and well equipoised; he has abandoned the view of self, is skilled in the purification of the stream,

original: rnam par dag pa tha dad nga rgyal med //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa tha dad nga rgyal med //
translated: and is free from pride in purity.

original: skad cig gcig blo thob pa btang snyoms pa ;ğŸ”½/ zhing rnams sbyong ba sems can smin byed par //
analyzed: skad cig gcig blo thob pa btang snyoms pa ; / zhing rnams sbyong ba sems can smin byed par //
translated: He attains the understanding of a single moment, and is indifferent.ğŸ”½The wise one, having great power, with a perfected body,

original: mkhas pa mthu chen lus yongs rdzogs pa dang // nges par ston la mkhas pa dbang bskur yin //
analyzed: mkhas pa mthu chen lus yongs rdzogs pa dang // nges par ston la mkhas pa dbang bskur yin //
translated: and skilled in the demonstration, is consecrated.

original: sa bcu po dag la byang chub sems dpa' bcu rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: sa bcu po dag la byang chub sems dpa' bcu rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Ten bodhisattvas are posited on the ten stages.

original: sa dang po la ni /ğŸ”½gang zag dang chos su lta ba'i gnyen po'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa dang po la ni / gang zag dang chos su lta ba'i gnyen po'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir /
translated: On the first stage

original: lta ba rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: lta ba rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: he is pure in view, because he has attained the intuition which is the antidote to the views of personality and of holding to an extreme.

original: gnyis pa la ni ltung ba'i 'khrul pa phra mo kun tu spyod pa yang med pa'i phyir tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni ltung ba'i 'khrul pa phra mo kun tu spyod pa yang med pa'i phyir tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: In the second, morality is very pure, because there is no longer any transgression of the slightest fault.

original: gsum pa la ni mi nyams pa'i bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa yin no //ğŸ”½bzhi pa la ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos la tha dad pa nyid kyi nga rgyal spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsum pa la ni mi nyams pa'i bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa yin no // bzhi pa la ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos la tha dad pa nyid kyi nga rgyal spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: In the third, there is concentration, because one obtains the concentration and absorption that are not subject to degeneration.

original: chos la nga rgyal spangs pa yin no /
analyzed: chos la nga rgyal spangs pa yin no /
translated: In the fourth, there is the absence of pride in the Dharma, because one has abandoned the pride of difference with regard to the Dharma of the Sutras, etc.

original: lnga pa la ni sems dang bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid bcus rgyud thams cad mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad par nga rgyal med pa yin no //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni sems dang bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid bcus rgyud thams cad mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir rgyud tha dad par nga rgyal med pa yin no //
translated: In the fifth, there is the absence of pride in the different continuums, because the ten equalities of mind and thought cause one to enter into the equality of all continuums.

original: drug pa la ni /
analyzed: drug pa la ni /
translated: In the sixth, there is the absence of pride in the result, because one has obtained the result of the path of insight.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid kyis mang du gnas pas na nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs dag gi de bzhin nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar mi lta ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid kyis mang du gnas pas na nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs dag gi de bzhin nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar mi lta ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it abides in the suchness of dependent origination, it is not conceited about the differentiation of affliction and purification, because it does not view the suchness of the dark and light sides as afflicted or purified.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang pa tha dad par nga rgyal med pa yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang pa tha dad par nga rgyal med pa yin te /
translated: It is not conceited about the differentiation of affliction and purification,

original: @252b rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @252b rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is naturally pure.

original: bdun pa la ni mtshan ma med par gnas pa'i mthus /ğŸ”½skad cig re re la byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdun pa la ni mtshan ma med par gnas pa'i mthus / skad cig re re la byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa'i phyir /
translated: On the seventh, by the power of abiding in the absence of attributes,

original: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i blo thob pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i blo thob pa yin no //
translated: it attains the cognition of a single moment, because it cultivates the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment in every moment.

original: brgyad pa la ni lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i phyir dang // byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la zhugs pa rnams dang 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa'i phyir btang snyoms pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par sbyong par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: brgyad pa la ni lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i phyir dang // byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la zhugs pa rnams dang 'dres pa nye bar 'dres pa'i phyir btang snyoms pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par sbyong par byed pa yin no //
translated: On the eighth, he is indifferent, because he spontaneously abides in the signless, and he purifies the buddhaverse, because he is mixed with and associated with the irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: dgu pa la ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la mkhas pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dgu pa la ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la mkhas pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: On the ninth, he is skilled in bringing beings to maturity, as before.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa la ni /ğŸ”½mngon par shes pa chen po thob pa'i phyir dang // mthu chen por yang rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa la ni / mngon par shes pa chen po thob pa'i phyir dang // mthu chen por yang rnam par gzhag go //
translated: On the tenth bodhisattva stage,ğŸ”½he is also established as having great superknowledge and great power,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo tshad med pas khyab pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo tshad med pas khyab pa'i phyir //
translated: because he has attained the great superknowledges.

original: lus yongs su rdzogs par yang rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: lus yongs su rdzogs par yang rnam par gzhag go //
translated: He is also established as having a perfect body,ğŸ”½because he is pervaded by immeasurable doors of concentration and retention.

original: dga' ldan gyi gnas na gnas pa la sogs pa'i sprul pa nges par ston pa'i phyir lus nges par ston pa la mkhas par yang rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi gnas na gnas pa la sogs pa'i sprul pa nges par ston pa'i phyir lus nges par ston pa la mkhas par yang rnam par gzhag go //
translated: He is also considered skilled in manifesting bodies in order to demonstrate emanations such as residing in the Tuá¹£ita heaven.

original: de nas sangs rgyas thams cad las dbang bskur ba thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas thams cad las dbang bskur ba thob pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, because he has received consecration from all the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas nyid du dbang bskur ba yin par yang rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du dbang bskur ba yin par yang rnam par gzhag go //
translated: he is considered consecrated to buddhahood.

original: bslab pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste /
analyzed: bslab pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste /
translated: Five verses on the establishment of the trainings

original: chos nyid rab tu rtogs nas 'dir //
analyzed: chos nyid rab tu rtogs nas 'dir //
translated: . Having realized reality,

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims lhag sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la rjes slob //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims lhag sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la rjes slob //
translated: he trains in superior morality, superior mind, and superior wisdom.

original: shes rab spyod yul gnyis yin te //
analyzed: shes rab spyod yul gnyis yin te //
translated: The domain of wisdom is twofold:

original: chos kyi de nyid de dang ni //
analyzed: chos kyi de nyid de dang ni //
translated: the reality of things

original: mi shes shes sogs 'jug pa nyid //
analyzed: mi shes shes sogs 'jug pa nyid //
translated: and the engagement of ignorance and knowledge, etc.

original: shes rab spyod yul de lta bas //
analyzed: shes rab spyod yul de lta bas //
translated: Such is the domain of wisdom.

original: de sa gnyis la rnam par gnas //
analyzed: de sa gnyis la rnam par gnas //
translated: It is based on two stages:

original: bslabs pa rnams dang bsgoms pa yin //
analyzed: bslabs pa rnams dang bsgoms pa yin //
translated: the stage of the wise and the stage of the work.

original: 'bras bu gzhan ni rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan ni rnam pa bzhi //
translated: The results are fourfold:

original: mtshan med 'du byed dang bcas par //ğŸ”½gnas pa 'bras bu dang po yin //
analyzed: mtshan med 'du byed dang bcas par // gnas pa 'bras bu dang po yin //
translated: The first fruit is the abiding in the signless with formative activity.ğŸ”½

original: de nyid mngon 'du byed med dang // zhing ni rnam par dag pa dag //ğŸ”½'bras bu gnyis par 'dad pa yin //
analyzed: de nyid mngon 'du byed med dang // zhing ni rnam par dag pa dag // 'bras bu gnyis par 'dad pa yin //
translated: The first result is the station of the bodhisattva who is not yet without discrimination, but who is endowed with the formative forces.

original: sems can smin par 'grub nyid dang // ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs rnams ni //
analyzed: sems can smin par 'grub nyid dang // ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs rnams ni //
translated: The second result is the station of the bodhisattva who is without formative influence, but who is not yet endowed with the purification of the field.

original: 'grub pa 'bras bu dam pa yin //ğŸ”½'bras bu rnam pa 'di bzhi ni //
analyzed: 'grub pa 'bras bu dam pa yin // 'bras bu rnam pa 'di bzhi ni //
translated: The third result is the purification of the field.ğŸ”½The fourth result is the full accomplishment of the aims of self and other.

original: sa bzhi po la yang dag bstan //
analyzed: sa bzhi po la yang dag bstan //
translated: These four results are respectively demonstrated in the four stations.

original: sa dang po la chos nyid de bzhin nyid rtogs nas gnyis pa la lhag pa'i tshul @253a * //ğŸ”½khrims la slob pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang po la chos nyid de bzhin nyid rtogs nas gnyis pa la lhag pa'i tshul @253a * // khrims la slob pa'o //
translated: Having understood reality, i.e. thusness, on the first station, he trains in superior morality on the second.

original: gsum pa la lhag pa'i sems la'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la lhag pa'i sems la'o //
translated: On the third, he trains in superior mind.

original: bzhi pa dang lnga pa dang drug pa dag la ni lhag pa'i shes rab la ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa dang lnga pa dang drug pa dag la ni lhag pa'i shes rab la ste /
translated: On the fourth, fifth and sixth stations, he trains in superior wisdom.

original: sa bzhi pa la ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pas bsdus pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: sa bzhi pa la ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pas bsdus pa'i shes rab po //
translated: On the fourth station, it is the wisdom which is included in the factors that contribute to enlightenment.

original: de yang sa gnyis la ni spyod yul gnyis pa can te ;
analyzed: de yang sa gnyis la ni spyod yul gnyis pa can te ;
translated: Moreover, on the first two stations, it is endowed with the two spheres.

original: gnyis ni chos kyi de kho na nyid sdug pa bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa dang / de mi shes pa dang shes pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ni chos kyi de kho na nyid sdug pa bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa dang / de mi shes pa dang shes pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang lugs dang mi mthun pa'o //
translated: and the process of not knowing that, knowing that, etc., which is the forward and reverse processes of dependent origination.

original: de mi shes pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de mi shes pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The process of not knowing that, etc. is ignorance, etc.

original: de shes pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa ni rigs pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de shes pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa ni rigs pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The process of knowing that, etc. is correct view, etc.

original: de lta bas na sa gnyi ga la yang lhag pa'i shes rab rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de lta bas na sa gnyi ga la yang lhag pa'i shes rab rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom is established in both stages.

original: de yan chad bslab pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi ni go rims bzhin du sa bzhi la brten par rig par bya ste //
analyzed: de yan chad bslab pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi ni go rims bzhin du sa bzhi la brten par rig par bya ste //
translated: Beyond that, the four results of the trainings should be known as being based on the four stages in order.

original: de la 'bras bu dang po ni mtshan ma med par gnas pa 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu dang po ni mtshan ma med par gnas pa 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Among them, the first result is the signless abiding with effort.

original: 'bras bu gnyis pa ni mtshan ma med par gnas pa de nyid mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / zhing yongs su dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gnyis pa ni mtshan ma med par gnas pa de nyid mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang / zhing yongs su dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The second result is the very same state of abiding in the signless, but without any more deliberate effort, and the complete purification of the field.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //ğŸ”½phung po rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do // phung po rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /ğŸ”½chos nyid rab tu rtogs nas 'dir //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te / chos nyid rab tu rtogs nas 'dir //
translated: The two verses that begin with the classification of the aggregatesğŸ”½Having fully understood reality,

original: tshul khrims kyis ni phung po sbyong //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni phung po sbyong //
translated: in this life one purifies the aggregate of morality.

original: de yi 'og tu ting 'dzin dang // shes rab tu phung po rnam par sbyong //
analyzed: de yi 'og tu ting 'dzin dang // shes rab tu phung po rnam par sbyong //
translated: After that, one purifies the aggregates of meditative concentration and wisdom.

original: de las gzhan pa dag la ni //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag la ni //
translated: In the other stages,

original: sgrib pa rnam bzhi dang thogs pa yi //
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam bzhi dang thogs pa yi //
translated: one is liberated from the four obstructions and the obstruction of the knowable.

original: sgrib pa las kyang rnam grol dang // grol ba'i ye shes rnam par sbyong //
analyzed: sgrib pa las kyang rnam grol dang // grol ba'i ye shes rnam par sbyong //
translated: And one purifies the liberation and the knowledge of liberation.

original: de las gzhan pa dag la zhes bya ba ni sa bdun pa nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag la zhes bya ba ni sa bdun pa nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du ste /
translated: In the other stages means from the seventh stage up to the stage of the Buddha.

original: rnam par grol ba dang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gnyi ga rnam par sbyong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba dang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gnyi ga rnam par sbyong ngo //
translated: In both liberation and the knowledge of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba de yang 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi'i sgrib pa la sa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba de yang 'bras bu rnam pa bzhi'i sgrib pa la sa rig par bya'o //
translated: And this liberation should be understood as the obscuration to the four fruits.

original: sangs rgyas kyis la ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis la ni //
translated: The Buddha stage is

original: thogs pa'i sgrib pa las te /
analyzed: thogs pa'i sgrib pa las te /
translated: the obscuration of the blockages.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni gang gis na gzhan dag shes bya la shes pa thogs par 'gyur ba de las rnam par grol bas thams cad la ye shes thogs pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni gang gis na gzhan dag shes bya la shes pa thogs par 'gyur ba de las rnam par grol bas thams cad la ye shes thogs pa mi mnga'o //
translated: The Buddhas are liberated from that which blocks the knowledge of others, and therefore their knowledge is unobstructed with regard to everything.

original: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: grub pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa @253b gsum ste //
analyzed: grub pa rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams nas tshigs su bcad pa @253b gsum ste //
translated: Three verses on the establishment of the perfections

original: sa rnams thams cad ma grub dang // grub pa dag tu shes par bya //
analyzed: sa rnams thams cad ma grub dang // grub pa dag tu shes par bya //
translated: . All the stages are to be understood as unestablished and established.

original: grub pa dag kyang ma grub dang // sgrub pa ji ltar rnam gzhag bzhin //
analyzed: grub pa dag kyang ma grub dang // sgrub pa ji ltar rnam gzhag bzhin //
translated: The established are also unestablished, and the establishment is as it is taught.

original: yid la byed pas de rtogs par //
analyzed: yid la byed pas de rtogs par //
translated: Because of the realization of that by mental attention,

original: shes pa'i phyir dang de nyid la //
analyzed: shes pa'i phyir dang de nyid la //
translated: and because of the knowledge of that,ğŸ”½and because of the discrimination of that,

original: rnams rtog phyir rnam shes bya //
analyzed: rnams rtog phyir rnam shes bya //
translated: it is called knowledge.ğŸ”½Because of the individual intuition of that,

original: so sor rang rig bya phyir dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul gyi phyir //
analyzed: so sor rang rig bya phyir dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul gyi phyir //
translated: and because of the object of the Buddhas,

original: sa rnams kun la sgom pa dang // grub pa yang ni bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: sa rnams kun la sgom pa dang // grub pa yang ni bsam mi khyab //
translated: The meditations and the accomplishments on all the stages are inconceivable.

original: de la mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: de la mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni ma grub pa'o //
translated: The stage of action in faith is not an accomplishment.

original: lhag ma rnams ni grub pa ste //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni grub pa ste //
translated: The remaining stages are accomplishments.

original: de ltar na de dag ni sa thams cad yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni sa thams cad yin no //
translated: Thus, they are all stages.

original: grub pa dag la yang bdun ni ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: grub pa dag la yang bdun ni ma grub pa yin no //
translated: The seven remaining stages are accomplishments.

original: lhag ma dag ni grub pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma dag ni grub pa ste /
translated: The remaining stages are accomplishments.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are entered without effort.

original: gang yang gong dus rab tu dga' ba grung bar bshad pa de la grub pa ni sa ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa bzhin yid la byed pas sa rnam par gzhag pa de rtog pa tsam du shes pa'i phyir dang // de la yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang gong dus rab tu dga' ba grung bar bshad pa de la grub pa ni sa ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa bzhin yid la byed pas sa rnam par gzhag pa de rtog pa tsam du shes pa'i phyir dang // de la yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir rig par bya ste /
translated: The stage of the Joyful One, which was previously explained as an accomplishment, is an accomplishment because one understands that the arrangement of the stages is merely conceptualization, and because one is free from conceptualization even in regard to that.

original: gang gi tshe sa rnam par gzhag pa de rtog pa tsam du shes shing rtog pa tsam de de la yang rnam par rtog par mi byed na //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sa rnam par gzhag pa de rtog pa tsam du shes shing rtog pa tsam de de la yang rnam par rtog par mi byed na //
translated: When one understands that the arrangement of the stages is merely conceptualization, and when one does not even conceptualize that conceptualization,

original: de ltar na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir sa yongs su grub pa zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir sa yongs su grub pa zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the stage is called the stage of completion because of the attainment of the nonconceptual intuition of the nondiscriminative subject and object.

original: gzhan yangs thams cad la sa rnams bsgom pa dang / grub pa gnyi ga bsam gyis mi khyab ste //
analyzed: gzhan yangs thams cad la sa rnams bsgom pa dang / grub pa gnyi ga bsam gyis mi khyab ste //
translated: The cultivation and the achievement of all the stages are inconceivable.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so sor rang gis rig par bya ba dang ; sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi so sor rang gis rig par bya ba dang ; sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, they are to be personally experienced by the bodhisattvas and are the domain of the buddhas, not of others.

original: sa la zhugs pa'i rtags rnam par dbye ba las brtsams nas tshigs su bcang pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sa la zhugs pa'i rtags rnam par dbye ba las brtsams nas tshigs su bcang pa gnyis te /
translated: Two verses on the analysis of the signs of the stages

original: snang dang bcas dang mos pa dang // ma zhum pa dang mi dman nyid //
analyzed: snang dang bcas dang mos pa dang // ma zhum pa dang mi dman nyid //
translated: . The bodhisattvas signs are considered to be the following: appearance, aspiration, nondejection, noncontempt,ğŸ”½nondependence on others, selfconfidence, complete understanding, equanimity toward all, nondeception, nonattachment,

original: gzhan dring mi 'jog bdag nyid dang // thams cad rab tu rtogs pa dang // kun la sems ni mnyam pa dang // bkri dang rjes su chags med dang // thabs shes 'khor du skye ba ni //
analyzed: gzhan dring mi 'jog bdag nyid dang // thams cad rab tu rtogs pa dang // kun la sems ni mnyam pa dang // bkri dang rjes su chags med dang // thabs shes 'khor du skye ba ni //
translated: skill in means, and birth in the retinue.

original: kun la rtags su 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: kun la rtags su 'dod pa yin //
translated: These are considered the signs for all.

original: rnam pa bcu po 'di dag ni //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po 'di dag ni //
translated: These ten are the signs

original: sa thams cad la byang chub @254a * //ğŸ”½sems dpa' sa la zhugs pa'i rtags yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sa thams cad la byang chub @254a * // sems dpa' sa la zhugs pa'i rtags yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: of the bodhisattva who has entered the stages.

original: sa gang la zhugs pa de la snang ba dang / gang la zhugs pa de la mos pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rtags gcig go //
analyzed: sa gang la zhugs pa de la snang ba dang / gang la zhugs pa de la mos pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rtags gcig go //
translated: The light of the stage and the interest in the stage are one sign.

original: ma zhum pa nyid ni chos zab cing rgya che ba dam pa dag la'o //
analyzed: ma zhum pa nyid ni chos zab cing rgya che ba dam pa dag la'o //
translated: The absence of discouragement is with regard to the holy Dharma, which is profound and extensive.

original: mi dman pa nyid ni dka' ba spyod pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: mi dman pa nyid ni dka' ba spyod pa rnams la'o //
translated: The absence of inferiority is with regard to the difficult practices.

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa nyid ni rang gi sa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa nyid ni rang gi sa la'o //
translated: The absence of dependence on others is with regard to ones own stage.

original: sa thams cad rab tu rtogs pa ni de dag mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa thams cad rab tu rtogs pa ni de dag mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The full realization of all stages is due to skill in accomplishing them.

original: kun la sems mnyam pa nyid ni sems can thams cad la bdag dang sems mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: kun la sems mnyam pa nyid ni sems can thams cad la bdag dang sems mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Mental evenness with regard to all is the equality of oneself and all beings.

original: bkrir mi btub pa nyid ni snyan pa dang mi snyan pa'i sgra dag gis so //ğŸ”½rjes su chags pa med pa ni //
analyzed: bkrir mi btub pa nyid ni snyan pa dang mi snyan pa'i sgra dag gis so //ğŸ”½rjes su chags pa med pa ni //
translated: The absence of being led is by pleasant and unpleasant sounds.ğŸ”½The absence of attachment is to the enjoyments of gods and men.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba nyid la sogs pa'i phun tshogs pa dag la'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba nyid la sogs pa'i phun tshogs pa dag la'o //
translated: in the perfections of a universal monarch, and so on.

original: thabs la mkhas pa ni //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa ni //
translated: Skill in means is

original: mi dmigs par sangs rgyas nyid kyi thabs shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs par sangs rgyas nyid kyi thabs shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the knowledge of the means to buddhahood, without objectifying it.

original: skye ba ni dus rtag tu sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor rnams su skye ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba ni dus rtag tu sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor rnams su skye ba ste /
translated: Birth is always in the circles of buddhas.

original: 'di dag ni sa rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i rtags gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sa rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i rtags gzhan yin no //
translated: These are the other signs of the bodhisattva on the stages.

original: pha rol tu thob pa'i rtags rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ste //
analyzed: pha rol tu thob pa'i rtags rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ste //
translated: Two verses on the analysis of the signs of the perfections

original: 'dun pa med pa ma yin chags dang 'khu ba'i snying med khro min le lo med //
analyzed: 'dun pa med pa ma yin chags dang 'khu ba'i snying med khro min le lo med //
translated: . He is not without aspiration, not with a heart of attachment or spite, not angry, not lazy,

original: byams dang snying rje min pa'i bsam med blo gros rnam rtog ngan rtog 'phrogs pa med //
analyzed: byams dang snying rje min pa'i bsam med blo gros rnam rtog ngan rtog 'phrogs pa med //
translated: not with a mind lacking love and compassion, not with a mind stolen away by bad thoughts,

original: blo gros rnam par g-yengs min bde bas mi 'phrogs sdug bsngal dag gis gnod pa med //
analyzed: blo gros rnam par g-yengs min bde bas mi 'phrogs sdug bsngal dag gis gnod pa med //
translated: not with a distracted mind, not carried away by pleasure, not harmed by pain,

original: dge ba'i bshes la nye bar brten zhing thos pa lhur len ston pa mchod la brtson //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes la nye bar brten zhing thos pa lhur len ston pa mchod la brtson //
translated: he relies on spiritual friends, is intent on learning, and is devoted to worshiping the Teacher.

original: thabs mchog shes pa gang zhig bsod rnams yang dag bsdus pa shin tu rgya chen kun//
analyzed: thabs mchog shes pa gang zhig bsod rnams yang dag bsdus pa shin tu rgya chen kun//
translated: Whoever knows the supreme means, having made all the vast accumulations of merit common to others,

original: gzhan dang thun mong byas nas nyin gcig bzhin du rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa yongs bsngo zhing //
analyzed: gzhan dang thun mong byas nas nyin gcig bzhin du rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa yongs bsngo zhing //
translated: daily dedicates to perfect enlightenment,

original: bzang po'i gnas su skyes pa rtag tu dge byed mngon shes yon tan rnams kyis rtsen //
analyzed: bzang po'i gnas su skyes pa rtag tu dge byed mngon shes yon tan rnams kyis rtsen //
translated: always creating virtue in a good rebirth, and delighting in the qualities of the higher knowledges.

original: sangs rgyas sras de kun gyi bla na 'dug pa yon tan gter du shes par bya //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras de kun gyi bla na 'dug pa yon tan gter du shes par bya //
translated: Know that this child of the buddhas is supreme over all, a treasure of good qualities.

original: byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa bcu thob pa'i rtags rnam pa bcu drug ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa bcu thob pa'i rtags rnam pa bcu drug ston te /
translated: This verse shows the sixteen aspects of the signs of the bodhisattvas' attainment of the ten transcendent perfections.

original: rtags rnam pa bcu drug ni rtag tu pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrub @254b pa'i bdun pa dang ma bral ba nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug po re re'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bral ba nyid dang // thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags theg pa gzhan yid la byed pa byed pas sems rnam par ma g-yengs pa nyid dang //
analyzed: rtags rnam pa bcu drug ni rtag tu pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrub @254b pa'i bdun pa dang ma bral ba nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug po re re'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bral ba nyid dang // thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags theg pa gzhan yid la byed pa byed pas sems rnam par ma g-yengs pa nyid dang //
translated: The sixteen signs are: always being inseparable from the seven riches of practice with regard to the perfections, being free of the counteragents to each of the six perfections, and being free of the signs of the perfection of skillful means.

original: phun sum tshogs pa'i bde ba dag la ma chags pa nyid dang / rgud pa dang dka' ba spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dag gis sbyor ba las mi ldog pa nyid dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten cing thos pa lhur len pa nyid dang /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa'i bde ba dag la ma chags pa nyid dang / rgud pa dang dka' ba spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dag gis sbyor ba las mi ldog pa nyid dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten cing thos pa lhur len pa nyid dang /
translated: Not being distracted from the mind that attends to other vehicles, not being attached to perfect happiness, not turning away from application in the face of misfortune and the suffering of difficult conduct, relying on spiritual masters and being intent on listening,

original: ston pa mchod pa gtsor byed pa nyid dang / dge ba thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i gnas su skye ba'i phyir gnas bzang por skye ba dang /
analyzed: ston pa mchod pa gtsor byed pa nyid dang / dge ba thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i gnas su skye ba'i phyir gnas bzang por skye ba dang /
translated: The first is the preeminence of worshiping the teacher; the second is the dedication of all virtue to unsurpassed enlightenment; the third is rebirth in a good place, because of the perfection of vows, one is reborn in the abode of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas;

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir rtag tu dge ba byed pa nyid dang ; ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa'i yon tan gyis rnam par rtse ba'o //ğŸ”½de la byams pa ni //
analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir rtag tu dge ba byed pa nyid dang ; ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mngon par shes pa'i shes pa'i yon tan gyis rnam par rtse ba'o // de la byams pa ni //
translated: the fourth is always doing good, because of the perfection of power, one is not mixed up with the dharmas which are the opposites of that power; and the fifth is sporting with the qualities of knowledge, because of the perfection of knowledge, one sports with the knowledge of the superknowledges.

original: gnod sems kyi gnyen po ste //
analyzed: gnod sems kyi gnyen po ste //
translated: Of these, loving kindness is the antidote to malice;

original: bde ba nye bar sgrub pa'i rnam pa can gyi bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba nye bar sgrub pa'i rnam pa can gyi bsam pa yin no //
translated: it is the attitude of establishing in happiness.

original: snying rje ni rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po ste //
analyzed: snying rje ni rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po ste //
translated: Compassion is the antidote to violence;

original: sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: it is the attitude of freeing from suffering.ğŸ”½Sympathetic joy is the antidote to discontent;

original: rtog pa ni ngo bo nyid du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ni ngo bo nyid du rtog pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization is the conceptualization of an essence.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni khyad par du rtog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni khyad par du rtog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Imagination is the conceptualization of distinctions.

original: de nyid kyi phan yon rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /ğŸ”½sa rnams kun la rnam kun du //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phan yon rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa / sa rnams kun la rnam kun du //
translated: A verse on the analysis of its benefitsğŸ”½The benefits of the geniuses

original: blo ldan rnams kyi phan yon ni //
analyzed: blo ldan rnams kyi phan yon ni //
translated: on all stages are

original: zhi gnas lhag mthong gnyi ga la //
analyzed: zhi gnas lhag mthong gnyi ga la //
translated: in both calm and insight

original: lnga po'i bdag nyid dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: lnga po'i bdag nyid dag tu 'dod //
translated: in five ways.

original: sa thams cad la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa de nyid kyi phan yon gyi rnam pa thams cad ni rnam pa lngar rig pa bya ste /
analyzed: sa thams cad la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa de nyid kyi phan yon gyi rnam pa thams cad ni rnam pa lngar rig pa bya ste /
translated: The benefits of the bodhisattvasâ€™ attainment of the transcendences on all stages should be known as fivefold.

original: skad cig re re la gnas ngan len gyi rten thams cad zad par 'gyur ;
analyzed: skad cig re re la gnas ngan len gyi rten thams cad zad par 'gyur ;
translated: Moment to moment, the support of all addictions is destroyed.

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i chos kyi dga' ba la yang dga' ba 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba'i chos kyi dga' ba la yang dga' ba 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: One attains the joy of Dharma, free from the perception of multiplicity.

original: sa thams cad du rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i chos kyi snang ba tshad med pa yang yang dag par shes par 'gyur /ğŸ”½'di'i rnam par dag pa'i skal ba dang mthun pa'i @255a * //
analyzed: sa thams cad du rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i chos kyi snang ba tshad med pa yang yang dag par shes par 'gyur / 'di'i rnam par dag pa'i skal ba dang mthun pa'i @255a * //
translated: He also correctly knows the immeasurable light of the Dharma, which is not limited to any stage.

original: pa'i rgyu mtshan rnam par brtags pa ma yin pa dag kyang kun tu spyod par 'gyur /
analyzed: pa'i rgyu mtshan rnam par brtags pa ma yin pa dag kyang kun tu spyod par 'gyur /
translated: He also practices the unfabricated signs of the purity of the stages.

original: chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa 'grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa 'grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: And in order to achieve the perfection of the Dharma body,

original: gong nas ches gong du rgyu phun sum tshogs pa yang yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: gong nas ches gong du rgyu phun sum tshogs pa yang yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
translated: he also takes up the abundant causes that are even higher than the highest.

original: de la dang po dang gnyis pa ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang po dang gnyis pa ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The first and second of these are to be known as being on the side of serenity.

original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa ni lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa ni lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa dag yin no //
translated: The third and fourth are on the side of transcendent insight.

original: lhag ma ni gnyi ga'i phyogs dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni gnyi ga'i phyogs dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: The rest are on the side of both.

original: sa'i nges pa'i tshig rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dgu ste ;
analyzed: sa'i nges pa'i tshig rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dgu ste ;
translated: Nine verses on the analysis of the names of the stages

original: byang chub la ni nye ba dang // sems can don sgrub mthong ba dang // rab tu dga' ba skye 'gyur te //
analyzed: byang chub la ni nye ba dang // sems can don sgrub mthong ba dang // rab tu dga' ba skye 'gyur te //
translated: He sees that enlightenment is near, and that the welfare of beings is to be accomplished.

original: de phyir rab dga' zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de phyir rab dga' zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, he experiences a joy that is called the Joyful One.

original: 'di la ni bshad du cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: 'di la ni bshad du cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is nothing to explain here.

original: 'tshal tshul rtsol ba'i dri bral phyir //
analyzed: 'tshal tshul rtsol ba'i dri bral phyir //
translated: Because of the absence of the stain of moral defilement and the stain of effort,

original: dri ma med pa'i sa zhes bya //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i sa zhes bya //
translated: it is called the Immaculate One.

original: chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma dang theg pa gzhan yid la byed pa'i dri ma las 'das pa'i phyir //

original: thugs rjer bcas khyod la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: thugs rjer bcas khyod la phyag 'tshal //
translated: who are compassionate toward the afflicted!

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi nyon mongs pa med pa'i khyad par sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa 'dul ba dang // nyon mongs pa bskyed pa rnams la @257a * //

translated: Here the Lord's unique absence of afflictions is shown by his taming the afflictions of all beings,

analyzed: yang de dag gi nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po mdzad pa dang / skye bo nyon mongs pa can la rjes su brtse bas yang dag par bstan te /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa gzhan dag ni //

analyzed: smon nas shes pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa / lhun gyis grub cing chags mi mnga' //

original: thogs pa mi mnga' rtag par ni //

original: mnyam par gzhag cing 'dri kun gyi //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag cing 'dri kun gyi //
translated: You are always in equipoise,

original: lan ldon khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: lan ldon khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: and answer all questions.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi smon nas mkhyen pa'i khyad par ni rnam pa lngas yang dag par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi smon nas mkhyen pa'i khyad par ni rnam pa lngas yang dag par bstan te /
translated: Here the special knowledge of the Lord Buddha is shown by five aspects:

original: lhun gyis grub par mngon du 'gyur pa nyid dang / chags pa mi mnga' bar mngon du 'gyur ba nyid dang // shes bya thams cad la thogs pa mi mnga' ba nyid dang / rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa nyid dang / sems can rnams kyi the tshom thams cad gcod pa nyid kyis ston te /ğŸ”½smon nas shes pa thob pa gzhan dag ni smon pa /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par mngon du 'gyur pa nyid dang / chags pa mi mnga' bar mngon du 'gyur ba nyid dang // shes bya thams cad la thogs pa mi mnga' ba nyid dang / rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa nyid dang / sems can rnams kyi the tshom thams cad gcod pa nyid kyis ston te / smon nas shes pa thob pa gzhan dag ni smon pa /
translated: it is spontaneous, it is not attached, it is not obstructed with respect to all objects of knowledge, it is always in equipoise, and it always cuts through the doubts of all sentient beings.

original: lhun gyis grub pas smon nas shes pa mngon du byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pas smon nas shes pa mngon du byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Other persons who have attained knowledge through prayer do not manifest knowledge through prayer spontaneously.

original: chags pa med pa yang ma yin te ;
analyzed: chags pa med pa yang ma yin te ;

original: snyoms par 'jug pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they depend on meditative concentration.

original: thogs pa med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa yang ma yin te /

original: nyi tshe shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyi tshe shes pa'i phyir ro //

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yang ma yin la /

original: the tshom thams cad gcod pa yang ma yin no //

analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ; rten dang rten pa bshad bya dang // gsung dang mkhyen pa 'chad byed la // blo gros rtag thogs mi mnga' ba //
translated: A verse on the analysis of the correct and discerning awarenesses

analyzed: legs ston khyod la phyag 'tshal lo // 'dir ni mdor na gang dang gang gis bshad par bya ba de la blo gros rtag tu thogs pa mi mnga' ba nyid kyis /
translated: . Homage to you, O Teacher, who are always unimpeded in mindğŸ”½with regard to the teaching, the support, the supported,ğŸ”½speech, and knowledge!

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi bstan te /
translated: In brief, the four correct and discerning awarenesses of the Lord Buddha are shown here by his being always unimpeded in mind with regard to whatever he teaches and however he teaches it.

original: de la rten chos dang // de la rten pa don dang gnyis ni bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rten chos dang // de la rten pa don dang gnyis ni bshad par bya'o //

original: gsung dang mkhyen pa dang gnyis kyis ni 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: gsung dang mkhyen pa dang gnyis kyis ni 'chad par byed do //

original: legs par ston pa nyid kyis ni 'di dag gi las yang dag par bstan to //
analyzed: legs par ston pa nyid kyis ni 'di dag gi las yang dag par bstan to //
translated: His activity is shown by his being a good teacher.

original: mngon par shes pa rnam @257b par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnam @257b par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa //
translated: A verse on the analysis of the superknowledgesğŸ”½

original: gshegs nas spyod pa mkhyen mdzad de //
analyzed: gshegs nas spyod pa mkhyen mdzad de //
translated: Having gone there, he knows their conduct,

original: de dag skad kyis sems can gyi //
analyzed: de dag skad kyis sems can gyi //

analyzed: 'ong dang 'gro dang nges 'byung la //
translated: the coming and going and the definite releaseğŸ”½of beings.

original: legs 'doms khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: legs 'doms khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to you, O Well-gone!

original: 'dir mngon par shes pa drug gis bcom ldan 'das kyi yang dag par 'doms pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir mngon par shes pa drug gis bcom ldan 'das kyi yang dag par 'doms pa nyid bstan te /
translated: Here the Blessed Lord's perfect teaching is shown by means of the six superknowledges.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pas gdul ba'i drung du gshegs nas sems kyi rnam grangs mngon par shes pas sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen par mdzad de /

analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pas de dag gi skad kyis /

original: mngon par shes pa lhag ma gsum gyis /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lhag ma gsum gyis /
translated: By means of the remaining three superknowledges, he teaches them the definite release of beings.

original: go rims bzhin du ji ltar sngon gyi mtha' nas 'dir 'ong ba dang / ji ltar phyi ma'i mthar 'gro ba dang / ji ltar 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba mkhyen pas de bzhin du gdams ngag stsol bar mdzad do //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du ji ltar sngon gyi mtha' nas 'dir 'ong ba dang / ji ltar phyi ma'i mthar 'gro ba dang / ji ltar 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba mkhyen pas de bzhin du gdams ngag stsol bar mdzad do //
translated: He gives the instructions in such a way that he knows how to come here from the past, how to go to the future, and how to get out of cyclic existence.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the major Äyatanas

original: lus can kun gyis khyod mthong na //
analyzed: lus can kun gyis khyod mthong na //
translated: . When all embodied beings see you,

original: skyes bu dam pa lags par 'tshal //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa lags par 'tshal //
translated: they know you to be a holy person.

original: mthong ba tsam gyis rab dang bar //
analyzed: mthong ba tsam gyis rab dang bar //
translated: By merely seeing you, they are purified.

original: mdzad pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: mdzad pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to you, whose deeds are pure!

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das la skyes bu chen po nyid du yid ches pas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams kyi las mthong ba tsam gyis gzhan dag rab tu dang bskyed par mdzad pa nyid yang dag par bstan to //

translated: Here the Blessed Lord is trusted as a great man, and his major Äyatanas and minor marks are shown to be the deeds of one who inspires faith in others merely by being seen.ğŸ”½A verse on the analysis of the perfections

original: yongs su dag pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa //
translated: One verse on the analysis of purification.

original: len dang gnas dang gtong ba dang // sprul dang yongs su bsgyur ba dang // ting nge 'dzin dang ye shes la //
analyzed: len dang gnas dang gtong ba dang // sprul dang yongs su bsgyur ba dang // ting nge 'dzin dang ye shes la //
translated: In concentration and in intuition,

original: mnga' brnyes khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: mnga' brnyes khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: You have attained mastery; homage to you!

original: 'dir dbang rnam pa bzhis bcom ldan 'das kyi yongs su dag pa bzhi po rnam pa thams cad du yongs su bstan te //ğŸ”½rten yongs su dag pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir dbang rnam pa bzhis bcom ldan 'das kyi yongs su dag pa bzhi po rnam pa thams cad du yongs su bstan te // rten yongs su dag pa ni /
translated: Here, by means of four masteries, the four purities of the Lord are shown in all their aspects.

original: lus len pa dang / gnas pa dang / gtong ba la mnga' bas so //ğŸ”½dmigs pa yongs su dag pa ni /
analyzed: lus len pa dang / gnas pa dang / gtong ba la mnga' bas so // dmigs pa yongs su dag pa ni /
translated: Purity of the body is shown by mastery in taking up, abiding in, and giving up the body.

original: sprul ba dang / yongs su bsgyur ba la mnga' bas so //ğŸ”½thugs yongs su dag pa ni /
analyzed: sprul ba dang / yongs su bsgyur ba la mnga' bas so // thugs yongs su dag pa ni /
translated: Purity of the object is shown by mastery in emanation and complete transformation.

original: rnam pa thams cad du ting nge 'dzin la mnga' bas so //ğŸ”½shes rab yongs su dag pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du ting nge 'dzin la mnga' bas so // shes rab yongs su dag pa ni /
translated: Purity of mind is shown by mastery in concentration in all its aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad du ye shes la mnga' bas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du ye shes la mnga' bas so //
translated: Purity of intuition is shown by mastery in intuition in all its aspects.

original: stobs rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /ğŸ”½thabs dang skyabs @258a * //
analyzed: stobs rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa / thabs dang skyabs @258a * //
translated: A verse on the analysis of the powersğŸ”½In skillful means, in refuge,

original: dang dag pa dang // theg chen nges par 'byung ba la //
analyzed: dang dag pa dang // theg chen nges par 'byung ba la //
translated: In purification, and in the Great Vehicleâ€™s going forth,

original: sems can rnams la rab slu ba'i //
analyzed: sems can rnams la rab slu ba'i //
translated: And deceive sentient beings.ğŸ”½

original: bdud 'joms khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //ğŸ”½'dir don bzhi la sems can rnams la rab tu slu bar byed pa'i bdud gang yin pa de 'joms par mdzad pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: bdud 'joms khyod la phyag 'tshal lo // 'dir don bzhi la sems can rnams la rab tu slu bar byed pa'i bdud gang yin pa de 'joms par mdzad pa nyid kyis /
translated: You who destroy the demons who deceive sentient beings!

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi stobs rnams kyi las yang dag par bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi stobs rnams kyi las yang dag par bstan te /
translated: Here, the Bhagavat's powers are shown to have the function of destroying the demons who deceive sentient beings in four ways.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely,

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i thabs la rab tu slu ba dang // lha la sogs pa skyabs ma yin pa la skyabs su rab tu slu ba dang // zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'dag pa tsam gyis dag par rab tu slu ba dang ;
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i thabs la rab tu slu ba dang // lha la sogs pa skyabs ma yin pa la skyabs su rab tu slu ba dang // zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'dag pa tsam gyis dag par rab tu slu ba dang ;
translated: deception about the means of going to good and bad destinies, deception about taking refuge in what is not a refuge such as the gods, deception about purity through mere contaminated purification,

original: theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba la rab tu slu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba la rab tu slu bar byed pa'o //
translated: and deception about the Great Vehicle as a means of deliverance.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /
translated: By the power of knowledge of what is possible and impossible,

original: bcom ldan 'das don dang po la 'dud 'joms par mdzad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das don dang po la 'dud 'joms par mdzad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: the Bhagavat destroys the first deception.

original: las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni gnyis pa la'o //
analyzed: las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni gnyis pa la'o //
translated: By the power of knowledge of the results of actions, he teaches the second.

original: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni gsum pa la'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni gsum pa la'o //
translated: By the power of knowledge of concentrations, liberations, and so forth, he teaches the third.

original: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bzhi pa la ste /
analyzed: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bzhi pa la ste /
translated: By the power of knowledge of various superior and inferior faculties, he teaches the fourth,

original: dbang po dman pa la sogs pa spangs nas mchog dag la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dman pa la sogs pa spangs nas mchog dag la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has abandoned the inferior faculties and so forth and is engaged in the superior ones.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /ğŸ”½rang gzhan don du ye shes dang // spangs dang nges 'byung bgegs byed par //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa / rang gzhan don du ye shes dang // spangs dang nges 'byung bgegs byed par //
translated: A verse on the analysis of fearlessnessğŸ”½. You are fearless in teaching the knowledge,ğŸ”½abandonment, definite emergence, and obstructions

original: ston mdzad mu stegs gzhan dag gis //
analyzed: ston mdzad mu stegs gzhan dag gis //
translated: for the benefit of yourself and others.

original: mi brdzi khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: mi brdzi khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to you who cannot be swayed by any tÄ«rthikas!

original: 'dir rang gi don du ye shes dang spangs ba ston par mdzad pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi don du nges par 'byung ba dang / bgegs byed pa ston par mdzad pa nyid kyis gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dir rang gi don du ye shes dang spangs ba ston par mdzad pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi don du nges par 'byung ba dang / bgegs byed pa ston par mdzad pa nyid kyis gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir //
translated: Here, the Lord's fearlessness is taught in four ways: he teaches the knowledge and abandonment for his own sake, and he teaches the going forth and the obstacles for the sake of others.

original: go rims bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis mi 'jigs pa rnam pa bzhi bsnyad do //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis mi 'jigs pa rnam pa bzhi bsnyad do //
translated: The Lord has four kinds of fearlessness, respectively.

original: bsrung ba med pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: bsrung ba med pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the fearless and the establishments of mindfulness

original: bsrung med bsnyel ba mi mnga' bas //
analyzed: bsrung med bsnyel ba mi mnga' bas //
translated: . You are fearless, not subject to confusion,

original: 'khor gyi nang na bag brkyang gsung //
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang na bag brkyang gsung //
translated: you speak with assurance in the assemblies,

original: kun nas nyon mongs gnyis spangs pa //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs gnyis spangs pa //
translated: you have abandoned the two moralities,

original: 'khor @258b sdud khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'khor @258b sdud khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: you gather a following, to you I bow.

original: 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bsrung ba med pa gsum dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / de dag gi las 'khor sdus pa nyid yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bsrung ba med pa gsum dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / de dag gi las 'khor sdus pa nyid yongs su bstan te /
translated: Here the three fearlessnesses and the three establishments of mindfulness of the Lord are taught, and also their function, which is the gathering of a following.

original: de dag gis ni go rims bzhin du 'khor gyi nang du bsrung ba med pa'i phyir //ğŸ”½bag brkyang ste gsung ba yang yin la /
analyzed: de dag gis ni go rims bzhin du 'khor gyi nang du bsrung ba med pa'i phyir // bag brkyang ste gsung ba yang yin la /
translated: These four verses show the four kinds of fearlessness in their order.ğŸ”½He is fearless in the midst of the assembly because he proclaims with an open, expansive mind.

original: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba nyid kyis rtag tu dgongs ba nye bar gnas pas rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba med pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis spangs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba nyid kyis rtag tu dgongs ba nye bar gnas pas rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba med pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis spangs pa yang yin no //
translated: And he is free from the two defilements, attachment and hostility, because he is always mindful through his inexhaustibility.

original: bag chags yang dag par bcom pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ;
analyzed: bag chags yang dag par bcom pa rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ;
translated: A verse on the analysis of the complete conquest of the instinct for the afflictions

original: kun mkhyen khyod la rgyu ba dang // gnas pa kun la rtag par ni //
analyzed: kun mkhyen khyod la rgyu ba dang // gnas pa kun la rtag par ni //
translated: You, Omniscient One, are always and in every way

original: kun mkhyen mi spyod mi mnga' ste //
analyzed: kun mkhyen mi spyod mi mnga' ste //
translated: Free of the nonomniscience that is the instinct for the afflictions.

original: yang dag don ldan khyod phyag 'tshal //ğŸ”½'dis ni rgyu ba dang gnas pa thams cad la rtag tu thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i spyod pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag don ldan khyod phyag 'tshal // 'dis ni rgyu ba dang gnas pa thams cad la rtag tu thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i spyod pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
translated: Homage to you who are endowed with the ultimate reality!

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bag chags thams cad yang dag par bcom pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bag chags thams cad yang dag par bcom pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: This shows that the Lord has completely conquered the instinct for the afflictions because he is always and in every way free of the nonomniscience that is the instinct for the afflictions in all his activities and in all his states.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa ni /
